story:
Hi There...

    I'm Maggie Lawson, visual artist and chef. My work is about healing, ancestry, and intergeneration trauma and wisdom. 

This project and residency are allowing me to live and work in one of my homes, Cincinnati, Ohio (after 15 years living on the left coast!). This work will happen in partnership with a community-focused art gallery (http://www.wavepoolgallery.org) and collaboration with my parents, both Cincinnati residents.

It will also give me the opportunity to address agism and explore within my family and the Camp Washington community what positive aging looks and feels like. Together, we will uncover the inner and outer structures that are obstacles to an old age of growth and play.

I am taking 6 weeks away from work as a chef and funding this project that address something that impacts EVERYONE. To do this I need your help!

What I Need

This is what I need to make a 6 week residency & solo exhibition possible:

Project Budget

video production (gear & labor): $1,000

birthday card production: $700

public events: $500

airline ticket: $350

installation production budget: $600

indie gogo fees: $300

TOTAL $3,450

The Impact

6 weeks as the Wave Pool Gallery Artist in Residence April 15-June 1, 2019 and a solo exhibition that opens May 8, 2019.

The project will offer a wide range of audiences an opportunity to reflect on their relationship to aging and agism. 

       IN THE GALLERY

  • A collaboration with University of Cincinnati printmaking students to print 400 birthday cards that contain positive messages about aging

  •  An interactive birthday scene with cakes sporting custom messages made in partnership with a local baker

  •  A series of video portraits of older people who were nominated as examples of healthy aging

  •  An intergenerational dinner party for the opening of the show

    OUTSIDE THE GALLERY

  • Events gathering people of different generations and showcasing the talents and contributions of Cincinnati’s aging population 

If you're interested in my 10-year body of socially-engaged art work take a look here: www.maggielawsonart.com 

Risks & Challenges

This project is ambitious in scope - the funding I need to be able to take 6 weeks off of my day job and to produce this work is actually greater than the money I'll be raising with this campaign. In addition to the stipend from Wave Pool, I have other income generation in place to earn additional funds. 

This project is worth it to me! Over the last ten years I have produced many socially engaged projects through the contributions (in labor and money) of my community. This is the first one I get to do in my home state. I also am grateful for the skills and knowledge I gained by completing my Masters in Fine Arts at UC Berkeley in May 2018.

If you have any additional resources outside of this fundraising effort that you think could help please send them my way. Usually what it takes to get the job done is a mysterious confluence of the planned and serendipitous!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if it is not be the right moment to contribute financially

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about my campaign--post on social media, and personally email friends and family that might be interested in supporting this kind of work (Indiegogo has a unique set of SHARE tools you can use to easily share with others)
  • Volunteer to help out in the kitchen at one of the dinners or for the opening or closing of the show

story:
The Book of Paintings

My name is Alexandrina Karadjova - Acrista, I am a full-time artist and I am blessed to do what I love. A couple of years ago, after a decade devoted to soft pastels, I set a new professional provocation in front of me: to master the oils. To celebrate the successful transition, I decided to produce a new art catalog with a selection of my recent oil paintings. Now I’d like to share it with you. Here are some of my thoughts on art that you will find in my new catalog:

“…I’m watching as a painting grows in front of my eyes and I feel I’m alive. That sense of creation, streaming under my fingers, is incomparable, just as is the beginning of life. I’m blessed beyond ordinary. Here, a new day in front of me: to give it value, to give it meaning, to feel the complete - that is the will of the heart. To paint the hours, spread under my palms like a white canvas, with all the hues of passion. To embed it with emotion from the deep my heart. To leave the trace of me. To give away to the world the treads of beauty that make me.”

“… leading in all of my paintings is the story it tells. No subject can recreate more beautifully the deep and moving emotion other than the female figure. And if one can feel the story it tells he will be connected with it and he won’t need to have “understanding of art” to live that inmost emotion.”

“… In the world and times we live in, beauty is going to become a commodity more and more valuable and sought after. Fed up with information, our senses will more often yearn for the simple, incipient, meaningful and valuable experiences of the heart.”

The goal

My goal is set at 4300 USD. This sum will be used for production of 500 hardcover copies of the book. The catalog will only be made in hardcover.

The catalog is laid out, edited and ready for press.

Any extra funding goes into creating dust jackets for the catalog and printing more copies.
        
If I reach my goal I expect to release the book and ship out the copies and all other perks (Giclee Prints, Vouchers, etc.) to Indiegogo backers before Christmas time.

What will the catalog look like 

Here are some of the pages:


Specifications

The book is a deluxe full color hardcover edition with 60 pages. It includes 20 oil works in two chapters - Delicate and Passionate, as well as some of my poems and thoughts on the painting process, some artwork close-up details and photos from my studio. The catalog is bilingual: English and Bulgarian.

Trim Size: 22 x 22 cm (approx. 9 x 9 in)
Pages: 60 pages
Body: 75 gsm at 1,55v LVC Solaris Silk
End-sheets: Antalis Curious Collection | Metallics Laquer 120 gsm
Hardcover: Sewn Case Bound cover, dressed with Antalis Geltex Reflejos - Dorado Pearl 115 gsm plus embossing.

And here are the perks

$ 6 - for my deepest gratitude via email + desktop wallpaper

$ 12 - for a pdf copy of the catalog

$ 25 - for a SIGNED catalog

$ 30 - for a SIGNED catalog + pdf

$ 45 - for a bundle of 2 SIGNED catalogs + pdf

$ 65 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "Pear Jam", 30 x 50 cm, approx. 12 x 20 in.:

$ 65 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "Whisper", 30 x 55 cm, approx. 12 x 22 in.:

$ 65 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "Love", 50 x 38cm, approx. 20 x 25 in.:

$ 65 - for a bundle of 3 SIGNED catalogs + pdf
$ 75 - for a bundle of 5 SIGNED catalogs

$ 75 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "When you want me", 38 x 54 cm, approx. 15 x 21 in.:

$ 75 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "Every Breath", 38 x 54 cm, approx. 15 x 21 in.:

$ 75 - for a SIGNED catalog + Giclée Print of "Lilac Nights", 38 x 54 cm, approx. 15 x 21 in.:

$ 100 - for a SIGNED catalog + Limited Edition Giclée Print of "Eternity", 50 x 40 cm, approx. 20 x 16 in.:

$ 110 - for a SIGNED catalog + 10% discount voucher for a future original oil purchase:

$ 120 - for a SIGNED catalog + Limited Edition Giclée Print of "When you want me", 50 x 70 cm, approx. 20 x 27 in.:

All Giclée Prints, including the numbered (limited edition), are made on Napolli Canvas 100% Cotton 340 gsm matte + satin. The prints are gallery wrapped and ready to hang.

$ 180 - for a SIGNED catalog + 20% discount voucher for a future original oil purchase:

$250 - for a SIGNED book and an original oil painting called "Silver". The canvas size is 20 x 39 cm (approx. 8 x 15") and the framed size is 36 x 55 cm (approx. 15 x 22")

Please share and invite your friends to visit my website.

story:
Short Summary

I want to make sure you're able to get copies of Marvel at the Mystery as Christmas gifts for friends and family this year, so I'm using this indiegogo page as a pre-order/sale/fundraiser hybrid. The book is hardcover, 48 full-color pages, and retails at $15,00, but you can order a copy for only $10! Just click on one of the perks to order copies. 

Although Wisdom for the Heart (my father's radio ministry) is buying many books for their ministry and helping me fund the cost of printing, I need to raise funds for a reprint of The Big Cat Spat. That fable is probably my favorite published book so far, but it has been on backorder for over three months now. If this campaign is successful, I'll be able to reorder copies in time for Christmas.  

Also, remember that fifteen percent of proceeds goes to Carol Adams in Uganda who is helping to equip and educate orphaned children touched by aids and war. I've been partnering with her now for two years and have been blessed to see all that God continues to accomplish through that ministry. 

All in all, thank you for your interest in my poetry and art and I pray this new devotional book serves as a blessing to your entire family this year. 

-Seth

story:
JewSalsa is Seven  years Old ! (French Below)

In order to avoid the closing of the french non profit Organisation JewSalsa (JS), we are launching an innovating crowdfunding campaign for an amount of 55.555 €. (For official WebSite of the JewSalsaThon 2015 , click jewsalsa.wix.com/jewsalsa)

JewSalsa is defined by seven pillars ;A positiv judaism (1), a cultural Judaism (2), a judaism centered on youth (3), based on innovation and creativity (4), humour(5), a strong link with international judaism and more specifically with communities from Europe and Latin America (6), Togetherness shared with our friends from other cultures (7).


We have been consulted 7 times this year by study institutes from Europe and America, and even if our model has been widely acclaimed in the USA, We're having a hard time in France ... We are an army of volunteers and a few donators giving a breath of fresh air to Judaism in France, but it's a real struggle... We took this decision to solicit your help, because this renewal can only exist, take root and obtain funding thanks to your assistance..

Without help, we will have to shut down, we chose an Indiegogo campaign for its inflexible rules . i.e.that if we don't get the required amount, you will all be automatically reimbursed by Indiegogo.

Many of you share our values. We are now inviting you to massively become members of JewSalsa for the year 2015/2016.

1. A Community of Artists

Music, dance, theatre improvisation... our workshops are not only about art, they are genuine communities with art aficionados (music, dance, theatre improvisation) meeting weekly, learning together, and becoming BFFs

2. JewSalsa creates the Event for every Jewish Celebration

Through out celebration of Pessah,  Hanukkah ( hanukkah revolucion evening), Purim ( the great Gatsby Purim Party), Rosh hashana ( Camel Island Party) and finally Sukot ( SUKKAMASUTRA party), we offered innovating funny and quirky concepts, allowing the JS youth to gather in a unifying spirit, opened to others (200 to 400 people at each party).

During our four shows at the NEW MORNING (best world music club in Paris), we invited many orchestras to reinterpret Jewish celebration songs in a new and lively way (gospel, salsa, chamber music). We have spread our Togetherness values gathering Jews and non Jews around tolerance and Jewish identities.
-►-Click on Video Link.

3. Solidarity Departement

The national call for Tzedaka, OSE, OPEJ, princess Margot, Casip Cojasor, Cuban jewish community, Pourimland,... JewSalsa is dedicated to helping many solidarity associations each year and have them benefit from its support be in artistic (class, shows...) in logistics (equipement setup), or financial.

JewSalsa also creates awareness videos with dedicated Youth (video link), and organizes the JewSalsa Festival for TZEDAKA every year where 26 volunteers take a month to prepare a unique event which can raise up to 3500€ (we raised 13.000€ in 4 years)
-►-Click on Video Link.

3. Street Festivals

More and more festivals contact us to benefit from the unique JS know-how, in outdoors animations, in Klezmer, salsa or oriental dances. Our videos are a perfect illustration of our skills to unite and create togetherness, as we did at the Paris plage on the Jussieu Quay, where nearly 2,000 people were joining JS twice a week for two months last summer .

5. Post Taglit JewSalsa

With 12 Taglit JewSalsa groups created in a year, JewSalsa is the first French association to organise TAGLIT. A very innovating programme that will soon exceed 500 people. From the training of youth workers, to the creation of the complete post Taglit dynamics, JS wants to make sure that all the magic of these10 days goes on in France: reunions, leadership trainings ...

5. JewSalsa TV

With over 550.000 views reached, JS TV daily spreads a positive judaism, as well as JS values through humoristic quality videos. Have you seen “the Mission Impossible for Hanukkah” parody? The Matzah dance (100,000 views) Our shooting on the Champs Elysées on Yom Haatzmaouth ?


***************************************
*********** FRENCH VERSION *********
***************************************

JewSalsa fête ses 7 ans !

Afin d'éviter la fermeture de JewSalsa, nous lançons une campagne innovante de CrowdFunding d'un montant de 55.555 €. Retrouvez toutes la campagne en détail sur notre site de campagne JewSalsaThon : http://jewsalsa.wix.com/jewsalsa

JewSalsa se définit en 7 piliers : un judaïsme positif (1), un judaïsme culturel (2), un judaïsme centré sur la jeunesse (3), fondé sur l'innovation et la créativité (4) , l'humour (5), la relation forte avec le judaïsme international et en particulier les communautés d'Europe et d'Amérique Latine (6) , le Vivre Ensemble avec nos amis d'autres cultures (7). 
Nous avons été consulté 7 fois cette année par des instituts d'étude ou d'expertise européens ou américains, et si notre modèle a été largement plébiscité aux USA, en France, on galère ... On est une armée de bénévoles et quelques donateurs à apporter un peu d'air frais au judaïsme en France, mais on galère ... On a pris la décision de vous solliciter car ce renouveau ne peut exister, prendre racine, et se financer, que s'il passe par vous.
-►- Sans aide, nous fermerons : nous avons choisi une campagne Indiegogo pour son coté non flexible. C'est à dire que si nous n'obtenons pas la somme requise, vous serez tous intégralement remboursés automatiquement par Indiegogo. 
-►- Vous êtes nombreux à adhérer à nos valeurs. A présent, nous vous invitons à devenir massivement adhérents JewSalsa pour l'année 2015-2016.

-►- Et faites-vous un Kiff : c'est l'anniversaire de JewSalsa, c'est votre anniversaire : offrez-vous un cadeau parmi notre gamme de Goodies 2015-2016 ;)

1. Communautés d'Artistes

Musique, danse et impro théâtrale... Nos ateliers ne sont pas que des ateliers artistiques : ce sont d'authentiques communautés. Avec des membres passionnés d'Art (Musique, Danse, Impro Théâtrale), qui se voient de manière hebdomadaire, apprennent ensemble, deviennent les meilleurs potes du monde...

2. Jewsalsa crée l'événement lors de chaque fête juive !

A travers les fêtes de Pessah (Soirée PessahTek), Hanukkah (Soirée Hanukkah Revolucion), Purim (The Great Gatsby Purim Party), Rosh Hashana (Camel Island Party) et Sukkot (soirée Sukkamasutra), nous avons proposé des concepts innovants, humoristiques et décalés qui ont permis aux jeunes de la communauté JewSalsa de se retrouver dans un esprit fédérateur (200 à 400 personnes à chaque soirée) et ouvert sur les autres. Lors de nos 4 spectacles au New Morning, nous avons invité nombreux orchestres à réinterpréter les airs des fêtes juives de manière entraînante et inédite (Gospel, Salsa, Musique de Chambre, ..) et nous avons diffusé nos valeurs de Vivre Ensemble, en réunissant Juifs et non Juifs autour de la tolérance et de l'identité juive.

3. Pôle Solidarité

L'appel national pour la Tsédéka, l'OSE, l'OPEJ, Princess Margot, Casip Cojasor, Communauté juive de Cuba, PourimLand, ... JewSalsa tient à cœur d'aider chaque année de nombreuses associations de Solidarité, en leur faisant bénéficier de son soutien artistique (cours, show, ..), logistique (installation de matériel),  ou financier (collectes). JewSalsa créé aussi des vidéos de sensibilisation impliquant la jeunesse (lien vidéo), et organise chaque année le festival JewSalsa pour la Tsédaka où 26 bénévoles préparent pendant un mois un événement unique qui récolte jusque 3500 € pour la tsédaka.

4. Festivals Plein Air

De plus en plus de festivals nous contactent afin de bénéficier du savoir faire unique de JewSalsa en animation plein air, que ce soit en Klezmer, Salsa ou Oriental. Nos vidéos illustrent parfaitement notre capacité à fédérer et à générer du Vivre Ensemble comme aux festivals Paris Plages au Quai de Jussieu ou près de 2.000 personnes côtoyaient JewSalsa deux fois par semaine pendant 2 mois l'été dernier à Paris.

5. Post Taglit JewSalsa

Avec 12 groupes Taglit JewSalsa créés en 1 an, JewSalsa est la première association de France à organiser Taglit. Un programme innovant qui dépassera bientôt la barre des  500 jeunes. De la formation des animateurs à la création de toute la dynamique Post Taglit, JewSalsa souhaite s'assurer que la magie de ces 10 jours se prolongera en France. Retrouvailles, formation leadership, ...

6. JewSalsa TV

Avec 550.000 vues atteintes, JewSalsa TV propage un judaïsme positif et  les valeurs de JewSalsa au quotidien au travers de vidéos humoristiques et de qualité. Avez vous visionné la parodie de Mission Impossible pour Hanukkah ? La parodie Derrick JewSalsa ? La danse de la Matzah (100.000 vues) ? Le tournage sur les champs Elysées le soir de Yom Haatzmaouth ?

in logistics (equipement setup), or financial.
JewSalsa also creates
awareness videos with dedicated Youth (video link), and organizes the JewSalsa Festival for TZEDAKA every year where 26 volunteers take a month to prepare a
unique event which can raise up to 3500€ (we raised 13.000€ in 4 years)-►-Click on Video Link.

3. Street Festivals
More and more festivals contact us to benefit from the unique JS know-how, in outdoors animations, in Klezmer, salsa or oriental dances. Our videos are a perfect illustration of our skills to unite and create togetherness, as we did at the Paris plage on the Jussieu Quay, where nearly 2,000 people were joining JS twice a week for two months last summer .

5. Post Taglit JewSalsa
With 12 Taglit JewSalsa groups created in a year, JewSalsa is the first French association to organise TAGLIT. A very innovating programme that will soon exceed 500 people. From the training of youth workers, to the creation of the complete post Taglit dynamics, JS wants to make sure that all the magic of these10 days goes on in France: reunions, leadership trainings ...


5. JewSalsa TV
With over 550.000
views reached, JS TV daily spreads a positive judaism, as well as JS values
through humoristic quality videos. Have you seen “the Mission Impossible for Hanukkah” parody? The Matzah dance (100,000 views) Our shooting on the Champs
Elysées on Yom Haatzmaouth ?
************************************************** FRENCH VERSION ************************************************JewSalsa fête ses 7 ans !Afin d'éviter la fermeture de JewSalsa, nous lançons une campagne innovante de CrowdFunding d'un montant de 55.555 €. Retrouvez toutes la campagne en détail sur notre site de campagne JewSalsaThon : http://jewsalsa.wix.com/jewsalsaJewSalsa se définit en 7 piliers : un judaïsme positif (1), un judaïsme culturel (2), un judaïsme centré sur la jeunesse (3), fondé sur l'innovation et la créativité (4) , l'humour (5), la relation forte avec le judaïsme international et en particulier les communautés d'Europe et d'Amérique Latine (6) , le Vivre Ensemble avec nos amis d'autres cultures (7). 


Nous avons été consulté 7 fois cette année par des instituts d'étude ou d'expertise européens ou américains, et si notre modèle a été largement plébiscité aux USA, en France, on galère ... On est une armée de bénévoles et quelques donateurs à apporter un peu d'air frais au judaïsme en France, mais on galère ... On a pris la décision de vous solliciter car ce renouveau ne peut exister, prendre racine, et se financer, que s'il passe par vous.-►- Sans aide, nous fermerons : nous avons choisi une campagne Indiegogo pour son coté non flexible. C'est à dire que si nous n'obtenons pas la somme requise, vous serez tous intégralement remboursés automatiquement par Indiegogo. -►- Vous êtes nombreux à adhérer à nos valeurs. A présent, nous vous invitons à devenir massivement adhérents JewSalsa pour l'année 2015-2016.-►- Et faites-vous un Kiff : c'est l'anniversaire de JewSalsa, c'est votre anniversaire : offrez-vous un cadeau parmi notre gamme de Goodies 2015-2016 ;)



1. Communautés d'ArtistesMusique, danse et impro théâtrale... Nos ateliers ne sont pas que des ateliers artistiques : ce sont d'authentiques communautés. Avec des membres passionnés d'Art (Musique, Danse, Impro Théâtrale), qui se voient de manière hebdomadaire, apprennent ensemble, deviennent les meilleurs potes du monde...2. Jewsalsa crée l'événement lors de chaque fête juive !A travers les fêtes de Pessah (Soirée PessahTek), Hanukkah (Soirée Hanukkah Revolucion), Purim (The Great Gatsby Purim Party), Rosh Hashana (Camel Island Party) et Sukkot (soirée Sukkamasutra), nous avons proposé des concepts innovants, humoristiques et décalés qui ont permis aux jeunes de la communauté JewSalsa de se retrouver dans un esprit fédérateur (200 à 400 personnes à chaque soirée) et ouvert sur les autres. Lors de nos 4 spectacles au New Morning, nous avons invité nombreux orchestres à réinterpréter les airs des fêtes juives de manière entraînante et inédite (Gospel, Salsa, Musique de Chambre, ..) et nous avons diffusé nos valeurs de Vivre Ensemble, en réunissant Juifs et non Juifs autour de la tolérance et de l'identité juive.3. Pôle SolidaritéL'appel national pour la Tsédéka, l'OSE, l'OPEJ, Princess Margot, Casip Cojasor, Communauté juive de Cuba, PourimLand, ... JewSalsa tient à cœur d'aider chaque année de nombreuses associations de Solidarité, en leur faisant bénéficier de son soutien artistique (cours, show, ..), logistique (installation de matériel),  ou financier (collectes). JewSalsa créé aussi des vidéos de sensibilisation impliquant la jeunesse (lien vidéo), et organise chaque année le festival JewSalsa pour la Tsédaka où 26 bénévoles préparent pendant un mois un événement unique qui récolte jusque 3500 € pour la tsédaka.4. Festivals Plein AirDe plus en plus de festivals nous contactent afin de bénéficier du savoir faire unique de JewSalsa en animation plein air, que ce soit en Klezmer, Salsa ou Oriental. Nos vidéos  illustrent parfaitement notre capacité à fédérer et à générer du Vivre Ensemble comme aux festivals Paris Plages au Quai de Jussieu ou près de 2.000 personnes côtoyaient JewSalsa deux fois par semaine pendant 2 mois l'été dernier à Paris.5. Post Taglit JewSalsaAvec 12 groupes Taglit JewSalsa créés en 1 an, JewSalsa est la première association de France à organiser Taglit. Un programme innovant qui dépassera bientôt la barre des  500 jeunes. De la formation des animateurs à la création de toute la dynamique Post Taglit, JewSalsa souhaite s'assurer que la magie de ces 10 jours se prolongera en France. Retrouvailles, formation leadership, ...6. JewSalsa TVAvec 550.000 vues atteintes, JewSalsa TV propage un judaïsme positif et  les valeurs de JewSalsa au quotidien au travers de vidéos humoristiques et de qualité. Avez vous visionné la parodie de Mission Impossible pour Hanukkah ? La parodie Derrick JewSalsa ? La danse de la Matzah (100.000 vues) ? Le tournage sur les champs Elysées le soir de Yom Haatzmaouth ?

story:
Update!

Some of the pictures and videos are now up on the carousel bar above! Thanks to your support, over $4000 of the $4000 - $4500 needed for TCP's  National Drive, and $500 of that needed for its companion Traveling Art Exhibit have been raised to date through Indiegogo, private checks, and online donations on our website! Please keep spreading the word and keep the donations coming, everyone! Thank You.

The National Drive: The Traveling Art Exhibit and Presentations.

The Custody Project assists qualified mothers who can no longer provide the common necessities of life for their families, due to the cost of defending the custody or visitation of their children. In need of competent guidance, affordable attorneys, and financial assistance, services to aid them are almost nonexistent. For this reason, The Custody Project's National Drive will run from San Francisco through Washington D.C., stopping in communities and cities along the route to give presentations, display a traveling art exhibit, and share a short documentary. The Drive will raise awareness of the plight of the families we serve, showcasing the hardships experienced by mothers and their children in the United States as a result of custody issues, inadequate child support, the complications of the family court system, or the inability to afford counsel. These hardships include homelessness, hunger, instability, poverty, domestic violence, abuse, devastating career restrictions, educational setbacks, and legal decisions which endanger and destabilize them. The art exhibit will include photos, quotes, and writings, and may include artwork created by affected families, such as paintings, drawings, and quilts - detailing their struggles in their own words: for example, a photo of the empty backpack of a child whose mother cannot afford to buy school supplies because she has not received any child support; or the empty pill bottle of a mother who forgoes medical treatment for herself in order to put food on the table for her infant. Towards the end of The Drive, part of the art collection donated may be sold to generate additional funding for our families and to support the next National Drive. By joining with us, you help strengthen a nationwide community to facilitate change for these silenced families.

 

The Custody Project and Its Impact
 

In accordance with its mission, "to promote the general welfare, both directly and indirectly, of mothers and their children as a unit as related to care, custody, and visitation issues," The Custody Project has been assisting those who suffer amongst us, unrecognized and unsupported, since 1994. TCP responds by helping qualified mothers with legal costs when they are defending the custody and visitation of their children, and by providing funds for common necessities when legal expenses prevent it and they are unable.

Our grant program, Heart to Heart, has been operational for over nineteen years. Our revolving-door loan program helps when, as mothers repay their loans, the funds can be redistributed to new families in need. TCP has also assisted in other ways including telephone support, brief lectures, information exchange, and meeting with mothers.

By way of example, The Custody Project assisted a mother whose two young girls went on a routine, summer visitation block of several weeks to their father. During this time, he took the girls to England, as he had done in previous years. But when September and the time for their return to school in the United States arrived, the girls were not returned. The mother sought help from the courts, the district attorney, regular attorneys, the police, child protective services, and by frantically reaching out to whatever resources and agencies she could find. Told by attorneys that it would cost a minimum of $20,000 - $30,000 to reverse the kidnapping and effect the return of her children, in anguish she suffered, as she did not have the money. Eight months went by. One day, she found us and explained her situation. The Custody Project contacted an attorney familiar with international abduction who stated she need only fill out a one page form. The document was sent to us and forwarded to the mother. Great Britain took the case and the children were returned within a month, for free. The mother placed her testimony on our web site and it can be viewed in its entirety and in her own words under our Services tab (see, http://thecustodyproject.org/tipsformoms.php and http://thecustodyproject.org/supportlinks.php).

Please visit our website to read other anonymous Case Excerpts detailing how TCP has helped families through the years (http://thecustodyproject.org/caseexcerpts.php).  

Such mothers face difficult financial challenges and may barter their homes, vehicles, assets, savings, retirement, and valuables - if they have them - to hire attorneys and meet the court costs required to protect their children. When you spread the word and help share their stories, you lift mothers and children facing family courts today whose costs can include:

Mediators:  $0 - $400 - $700+ per report

Evaluators:  $1500 - $5000+

Expert Witnesses:  $50 - $500+ per hour

Attorneys:  $25 - $300+ per hour

Attorney Retainers:  $500 - 5,000+

Attorney Hours Required:  10 - 100 - 1000 - 10,000+

Other Fees $$$:  Court Filing Fees, Service of Process Fees, Deposition Fees, Transcription Fees, Visitation Fees, Investigative Fees, Paralegal Fees, Expert Consultation Fees, and More...

Crippling court costs demand mothers forego their mortgage or rent, their car payments, and  heating/electric/water/sewage/telephone/grocery bills. Having used funds for common necessities to pay the uncommon costs of law, they face economic disaster. Court hearings demand these mothers take time off from work and, unlike employers who understand and can provide flexible scheduling, unsupportive employers let them go. Some lose their homes, their cars, all of their savings, and still, it is not enough to cover the ongoing costs of court: the crises these mothers face to protect their children are all encompassing and devastating.  When you donate, you are making it possible for a family to have heat in the winter, to keep the homes they live in, to drive the cars they've got, to hire the attorneys needed, to cover court costs without risk to their jobs - and these are great gifts to our families. You keep them stable and secure and you protect children in great need of your help.


What We Need
Phase I: $2500 - $4500 is needed to fund the cost of The National Drive. This amount essentially depends upon how much the final route deviates from the route currently planned. This figure will depend upon the number of speaking engagements arranged, plus those we are invited to along the way and the new distances required to travel to them.

Thanks to your support, TCP has raised over $3600 for the The National Drive through Indiegogo, private checks, and online donations on our website! Thank You!

Watch for the dates of the Drive to post in our web site's "Events" section once the remaining funds are raised.  $400-$500 is still needed and, as no handling fees are charged, The Custody Project receives 100% of your donation when you visit our website at  http://thecustodyproject.org/donate_online.php#mf, or use our link on eBay's PayPal Giving Fund, http://givingworks.ebay.com/charity-auctions/ch.... (On eBay, the last link continues: charity-auctions/charity/the-custody-project/2172/ ).  Be sure to state that your donations are for The Drive.

Although funding for Phase I has ended on Indiegogo and the wording now reflects the goals of Phase II, the link was https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/drive-for-the-voiceless/x/9582145#/story).


Phase II: $500 - $9500 is needed to cover the cost of The Traveling Art Exhibit and Presentations. The amount raised determines how much art we can afford to create, and the costs associated with framing, protecting, and presenting it to the public. Donated art is welcome. Please contact us. The current Indiegogo Campaign is running to meet the goals of Phase II. Should you donate by check or through our website, be sure to specify that your donations are for the Traveling Art Exhibit.

Phase III: $3500 - $9500 is needed to cover the cost of filming a short documentary to capture the struggles of these affected families. The short would highlight their efforts to improve their lives, and would be shown during the Drive on stops along the way. Amounts over those designated would permit us to create further segments of a longer documentary to be shown at a later date.

The Custody Project, founded in 1994, is a charitable, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, Fed Tax ID 95-4521373, and contributions are tax-deductible to the extent allowable by law.     

                                                 To all who donate, thank you!

We have set our goal at $500 for Phase II. Art work and a short documentary will be created to the extent further donations allow. Once the minimum for The Drive, The Art, and The Documentary have been achieved, we will begin adding additional stops along our route, adding more art to our collection, and increasing the length of the documentary.

It is our plan to raise donations nationwide for our families, and to apply the funds to assist and protect them via our Heart to Heart Program, with a minimal amount set aside to fund the next Nationwide Drive. It is our intention to conduct periodic nationwide drives to shine a light on their dilemmas again and again so that these families find their voice, and obtain the national support and protection they desperately need.

Your help in meeting this crucial goal of $2500 for The Drive (Phase I) and $500 for the Art Work (Phase II) is a fantastic way to leverage a small funding goal into a generous nationwide response. Your response determines the dates of The Drive, whether during 2015 or summer, 2016, as well as the route and speaking engagements the Drive can support. Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help
For those donating on our web site or sending checks directly to us, your gifts must state your intention that the money be used for The Drive, the Art, or the Documentary, or you can indicate percentages so that we can divide your donations as you instruct. Otherwise, undesignated donations go into our general fund to assist mothers and children in our Heart to Heart Program. More information can be found on our web site (http://thecustodyproject.org). Thank you.

Spread The Word! Please share our Drive with your friends, family, and others supportive of our mission, sharing us on social media, and using IndieGoGo's share tools, too.

Speaking Engagements! Contact us, if you would like to invite us to speak at universities, churches, at business meetings, or before charitable or other interested groups in your area.

Art: Donated art is welcome. Please contact us to support our families in this way.
 

Heart to Heart: Please consider visiting our web site to donate and help families in our Heart to Heart Program. 

Contact: Donna @ 850.682.3460 (Email not watched).

Address:  The Custody Project, PO Box 20753, El Sobrante CA 94820-0753.


Risks and Challenges
As the funding for The National Drive is almost fully secured, we are launching Phase II to raise the amount needed for the visuals for The Traveling Art Exhibit and Presentations. This step includes obtaining the materials to create the pictures, photographs, and remaining artwork to be displayed. The next will involve choosing the framing and protection of the pieces during travel. Once the artwork is created, a portable, collapsible, lightweight presentation assembly will be designed to highlight it. As sufficient funding comes along, work on the documentary will begin. When the amount of material we must transport is known, a suitable vehicle must be driven from engagement to engagement, with funding determining the itinerary and the amount sufficient for travel expenses. Once our itinerary is determined, the need for permits will be known and requested as needed. Outreach and media announcements will go out at no charge. Most of the above is resolved with time, patience, talent, adequate funding, and the proper tools and equipment. The serious difficulty lies in visually and respectfully representing the plight and difficulties faced by these mothers and children, representing their needs, being their voice, raising awareness, and reaching sympathetic, attentive, and responsive audiences as we travel.
 


About Donna

The need for support for mothers and children affected by custody and visitation issues has been evident to Ms. Signorelli, founder of The Custody Project, since 1990. Representation by competent, compassionate attorneys familiar with the unique circumstances these families must be excised from is crucial, and it is financial support which secures representation when affordable options are otherwise unavailable to them. Such vital assistance means the difference between 18 years lived in peace and productivity versus years marred by danger, legal entanglements, and catastrophic educational, familial, and financial losses. In a nation of families where all lives matter, it is the difference between a family resting calm or floundering in chaos, between security or poverty, between going forward or going bankrupt, between life or losing their children to kidnapping, domestic violence, and death.

Thankfully, a loyal group has given their financial backing for years to forward her concern and help affected families through The Custody Project and, for these mothers and children a donor's compassion is their lifeline. But a broader effort for such families is needed. Envisioning periodic nationwide drives to raise awareness for their plight since 1992, she made her first national drive during the summer of 2008, personally paying the Drive's cost along with two friends. Now, she plans to Drive again and, to create a visual showcase to uplift these families, your help is needed. You can deliver hope, strengthen the hands of a concerned nationwide community, and build upon the nationwide call to action now needed for our mothers and children by giving voice to compassion. To develop an independent artistic voice for them now, which can be displayed on national drives and shared through many other venues when raising awareness for our families, please join us in making a difference by Sharing our Indiegogo Campaign, Spreading the word, and Giving as you can.

In a nation of families where all lives matter, it is the difference between a family resting calm or floundering in chaos, between security or poverty, between going forward or going bankrupt, between life or losing their children to kidnapping, domestic violence, and death.Thankfully, a loyal group has given their financial backing for years to forward her concern and help affected families through The Custody Project and, for these mothers and children a donor's compassion is their lifeline. But a broader effort for such families is needed. Envisioning periodic nationwide drives to raise awareness for their plight since 1992, she made her first national drive during the summer of 2008, personally paying the Drive's cost along with two friends. Now, she plans to Drive again and, to create a visual showcase to uplift these families, your help is needed. You can deliver hope, strengthen the hands of a concerned nationwide community, and build upon the nationwide call to action now needed for our mothers and children by giving voice to compassion. To develop an independent artistic voice for them now, which can be displayed on national drives and shared through many other venues when raising awareness for our families, please join us in making a difference by Sharing our Indiegogo Campaign, Spreading the word, and Giving as you can.

story:
Hello! I am Anna Horvath, graduate designer at CSM, London. My travelling project got accepted to the Games for Change Festival in New York and we would like to take it to Art Cologne 2015 too. The aim is to collect £6000 , which would allow us to take the installation to at least the first 2 locations. If we can raise more than that, we will expand the locations of the tour, and  thus the opportunities to participate!

                 

                  

What is 'Art tag'?

'Art Tag, materialising values' is a critique on the valuation of contemporary art in the form of a game-based art installation.

                                 

Who can play?

ANYBODY CAN PARTICIPATE! It is a role-playing, strategy game where you have to be an artist!The game can be played with your own art work or with art pieces from well-know artists. 

     What is the aim of the game?

You just have to act as an artist and persuade the participants of the art world to buy your art.  Simple. However, for this you need to take some necessary steps, such as education, exhibition, media coverage, etc. while maintaining your living. Not that easy, right?


Where is it going to be played?

The game takes place at art fairs and across unique locations of the contemporary art world. 


What is the outcome?

A fun entertainment where you don't know who is involved in the game and who isn't! At the end, an art installation will express the quantity of the winners and the losers. There won't be any differences between their artworks, however it will show how the circumstances - like financial background, social networks and institutions - influence the artist's carrier in today's prestige-based society. 

So, you will create the results of this game in the form of a thought-provoking installation.


Who are we?

A team of young creatives working on the fields of art and design internationally. The project directed by Anna Horvath who is graduating at MA Narrative Environments from Central Saint Martins, University of Arts, London. 

What is the return of your support?

We will return your generosity with Art tag products, like badges, postcards, bags and toolkits. We will indicate your names on our installations around the world and your gallery, magazine or art piece can be part of the video game!


What is the aim of the game?

The game stands on 2 levels. Firstly it aims to be a teaching device for young artists by showing how the market works, and it offers alternatives in their career rise... Secondly, it is a critical commentary on the manipulative and elitist character of the art market, and it aims to highlight the artist's position in the recession in terms of funds, tuition fees and housing in cultural hubs.

  • If you also think that contemporary art valuation is an unpredictible labirynth...
  • If you wish to raise awareness in this topic...
  • If you would like to participate in testing your self-management skills...



Please support Art Tag! We appreciate every little donation because Many a Little Makes a Mickle.
visit our website: http://www.arttaggame.com/

Watch the video to see how the game works!

story:
I recently learnt that I am the winner of the Florence academy of Art 2015 summer scholarship !!!!! They loved my artworks. It's quiet a big deal because it happens once a year and thousands of artists from all over the world participate. To come first among all of these artists is something magical. The academy is one of the best places to study as it has got everything for an aspiring artist  like me who is passionate about classic realism. I will be learning an intensive course of complete figure painting in oils - traditions and techniques throughout my stay which begins June end till July end. I will be visiting all the historic art heritage sites and this is something which I am sure will bring a big amount improvisation on my understanding of art.

Being a self taught/ learning/ aspiring painter myself, this is something like a dream come true. To be chosen as the winner and being provided this massive opportunity is something so sacred yet empowering and liberating. 

So all of you who have been following my work - encouraging and supporting me all along with your appreciation and have been willing to be collectors - this would be the perfect opportunity., You can view my artworks in the gallery that had  been selected and visit my website to get my complete portfolio.

If you cannot personally invest in the artworks please share this campaign with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.

This opportunity only reminds me of one quote which I read as a kid,

"Follow your bliss", and the universe will make sure to open doors where there were only walls..


Thankyou,

Sej

story:
Short Summary

WROUGHT is a Sheffield-based performance festival with an exclusive focus on one-to-one performance (i.e. a unique one performer, one audience dynamic) and intimate audience experience, brought together by co-producers, Erin Revell and Moe Shoji. 

We launched WROUGHT: A One-to-One Performance Festival in October 2014 in response to the lack of a live art and fringe performance scene in Sheffield, and a passion for one-to-one performance. Over two days, WROUGHT 2014 showcased the work of 19 artists and 1 documenter-in-residence. It allowed both established and local, emerging artists to bring their unique practice to the audiences of Sheffield. And, thanks to all the support from the artists, volunteers and audience members, the inaugural festival was a huge success. 

It was the first festival of its kind in Sheffield, and the first venture of its size for us. As festival producers, we learned so much: we learned that there is an audience for one-to-one in Sheffield, we learned that this type of performance can be thrilling and moving and potentially life-changing, and we learned enough to know that if we were to do it again, it could be even better. And so this year, we are determined to produce WROUGHT 2015, but we need your support.


What We Need & What You Get

Last year, we were generously supported by Arts Council England and Masie Glass Fund of the University of Sheffield. This year again, we are applying for a funding from Arts Council England, but we need to raise 10% of the total amount we are asking for before the application is made. We have money from last year's ticket sales, some support from the University, and as co-producers, we are investing £200 respectively, but we still fall £550 short of what we are aiming for. We would like to ask for your support to make it possible for us to apply for ACE funding and to deliver WROUGHT 2015 in October 2015.

The minimum pledge starts from £10 - please consider this as pre-booking your ticket for this year's festival. The festival ticket will cost £10 (the same as last year) and you will get an audience experience for 3 performance pieces with 1 ticket. All investors will get early access to the tickets and with an event that is likely to sell out fast, this is a great opportunity. 

Any money you donate for us will be a part of 10% we require for ACE funding application and it will be used for either:

  • Documentation. We are planning to have 2 documenters in different media, to document the festival in a creative manner. The final product will be available for you to access.
  • Supporting volunteers' work. We had a great cohort of volunteers last year and we will seek for their support this year again. As a humble thanks to their generous help and hard work, we provide lunch and drink to volunteers.

The Impact

WROUGHT Festival is a new and exciting addition to the cultural calendar of Sheffield. By funding this project, you are supporting us in bringing exciting and acclaimed art to Sheffield audiences as well as enabling local, emerging artists to present new work. Your support allows us to continue to develop this exciting platform, where artists and audiences can communicate directly through performance, and share their experiences. 

Here is the key information for WROUGHT 2015:

  • Dates: 9th - 11th October 2015
  • Venue: the Hide (S3 1AA) 
  • Artists: 22 artists + 2 documenters
  • Free Events: Launch party (Fri 9th Oct), Festival evening party with DJ (Sat 10th Oct), Post-festival Discussion (Sun 11th Oct), Reflective Panel Discussion (on w/c 19th Oct, tbc)

Successful features that are staying the same: WROUGHT will continue to use the Hide as its main hub. However, the performances will spill out across the city of Sheffield -- in the streets, shop-fronts and supermarkets. The line-up is based on the strong network of artists we have built. We will continue to have an open-call for emerging artists based in and around Sheffield in the spirit of supporting the developing local talent.

There are some new developments as well: This year, we have Soraya Nabipour (Sad Siren Theatre) to support the co-producers as an assistant producer. We are also working to make WROUGHT more international by bringing artists from outside the UK. Finally, we have increased the number of performance and installation artists we hope to produce.


Risks & Challenges

Your support is very valuable and it will enable us to apply for ACE funding scheme. However, it is possible that we will not be successful in our funding application, even if this campaign reaches its goal. On such an occasion, the plan is still to go ahead with WROUGHT 2015 nonetheless -- it will be a slightly different festival -- on a smaller scale, concentrating on the work of Sheffield-based emerging artists, but it will continue to be original and inspiring.



We deeply appreciate it if you could pre-book a ticket through a form of donation and enable us to make WROUGHT 2015 happen. 

And if you cannot make monetary contribution, we would like to ask you to spread the word among your friends, colleague and family, using email, Facebook, twitter, and word of mouth -- we would love to have a wide variety of people involved in our festival.

story:
Who We Are

Wolfsisters Creations is a collaboration between Sandra SanTara of Windwolf Studio and Christy Grandjean of Goldenwolf Art.

Since 2005 we have been bringing some of the most unique and inspiring artwork to the public via art shows, conventions, festivals, fairs, and the internet. Focusing on fantasy, visionary, wildlife, and esoteric art our works are eclectic, colorful, sometimes whimsical, and always unique.

For some time now we have been kicking around the idea of doing coloring books with some of our black and white art. With the current craze for coloring books out there right now, we think that the time is right to do some of our own coloring books for you to enjoy!

What We Need

We are going to be creating three coloring books (Totems cover forthcoming), each with 20 black and white images that you can color with markers, crayons, colored pencils...whatever you like! These are single-sided pages so that it won't bleed onto the image underneath it.

  • 3 Coloring Books - Fantasy, Anthropomorphic, and Animal Totems
  • 8.5" X 11" size
  • 20 images per book with art from both artists
  • 60# paper
  • Saddle stitched (staples)
  • Full color glossy cover

Sample Pages:

We would like to do an initial run of 200 books each. We will be selling these books in our online stores, and at the art show and conventions we attend. We would like to get these done ASAP so that we can have them for our upcoming shows.

What you get

You can get either one, two, or all three coloring books.
When choosing the one or two coloring book option, we will need to know which of the three coloring books you want. We will be gathering this information at the end of the campaign via e-mail.

Stretch Goal #1

If we can reach $2,500 in this campaign we will add four more images to each coloring book!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in these coloring books!

story:
COMMON to LA 

I was born as a direct result of the miners’ strikes in the 1980s in the north of England. I studied at University of Falmouth (B.A. Honours) and at Esalen Institute Big Sur, California. I have travelled considerably and for the past five years my base has been Berlin. I have never left my passion for combining my art and political topics. I am a versatile artist, whether collaborating with visual artists, composers, musicians, performance artists or dancers. I have accomplished a rich and diverse performance network including: MPA-B,  APAB and most recently have performed at Die Akademie der Kunste, Hebbel-am-Ufer and won the jury prize for 100 grad festival 2015. - For more about me check out my website: www.katieleedunbar.de

This campaign is about gaining the funds to be able to bring COMMON to another continent, LA - USA. COMMON is a performance series inspired by first-hand experience. It is at the same time an autobiographical reflection and a social political research. I started collecting material from the unemployment situation in the ex-coal mining region of the Northeast of England where my family comes from and I ended up dealing with the issues of post-industrial societies. What I show is a personal story, yet it is universally, common. In this solo performance series I use text, sound, coal, bike-wheels, film and dance to piece together the end of my father's life and the economical and political system around it.

My aim is to draw a link between all the post-industrial communities around the world, by pointing to a pattern of lack of value of the human life that was invested in our different mining/industrial areas around the world. Communities that powered centuries of industrial development are often left to rot after the land and the people are used up. My plan is to draw these links by creating a web of exchange, starting in LA, USA. 

Eastside International has invited me to bring COMMON to LA and take part in their residency program. This is the perfect opportunity to start drawing my map of disparity - LA has a huge gap between rich and poor. The city has a long standing history in the performing Arts. LA is a great place for me to show my work and make connections with performance Artists, making these contacts will strengthen my career.  Most of all, I will be able to expand my audience and more people will be able to hear this very important largely untold story. 

What I Need & What You Get

I am asking for 30 Euros for my 30th Birthday to raise 3,300 Euro to be able to take advantage of this great opportunity. If 110 people contribute 30 Euros to this project I will be able to bring COMMON to LA and spend two months focusing on the continuation of this series. (See below for a full break down of what I will be spending the money on.) If I do not meet the total goal I will withdraw from the residency program and I will use the money raised to continue working on and performing COMMON in LA. 

Check out the Perks you get! They are all designed so that you can see the work you are supporting me producing while I am in LA. For the first 10 people who donate - I will personally call to thank you. For 30 Euros or more you will get a live stream performance while I am in LA. Donations over 100 Euro you will get a free pass for my performances in 2016. And donating between 10 and 30 euro means you will get a selection of photographs of the work I am producing while in LA. So please contribute what you can - the more money I can make for this project - the better! If you cannot contribute then please share the campaign.


It is so important for me to be able to bring this work to other parts of the world and get input and compare the topic in a new climate. More than that, my asking for this money goes to the very core of my work. If creativity is not supported, art not funded and if small projects about poor communities are not made - then this type of work is not seen. That is why I think it is very important you fund me - so that this story is told. So that this work is seen and shared around the world and without my coming from a wealthy background. For more about my track record, just check out my web site: katieleedunbar.de.

Risks & Challenges

I have already saved around 1500 EUR of my own money and have applied for various travel and research grants in Berlin and the UK.  Some I didn't get, some I am still waiting to hear from. For me to be able to accept the residency in December, I need the money quicker than any government funding could get it to me. But, I will not let money get in the way of me being able to make smart professional and creative moves. Originally I was invited to take part in the three months residency at Eastside International and I have already cut that down to one month so that I am sure I can find sufficient funds. I am practical and have spent my life working hard and making a little money go a long way. Therefore whatever amount of money I get, even if it's below the amount I am asking for I will make it work - that's a tried and tested fact. And if the unbelievable happens and I get more money that I am asking for - you can be sure that it will go into the continuation of COMMON - and drawing the map of post industrial communities, next on my map will be the UK. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any spare cash - I get it, trust me - Help me out by sending this campaign to friends and family that might be interested in donating. Or simply share it on any of your social networks.  If I get 110 people who donate 30 EUR then I will have met my goal and will be able to continue working on COMMON and will be able to bring it to the US. Together I think we know 110 people with 30 EUR to support me and my art, right? Back me, write lovely comments or do any other supporting thing you can think of!

If 110 people contribute 30 Euros to this project I will be able to bring COMMON to LA and spend two months focusing on the continuation of this series. (See below for a full break down of what I will be spending the money on.) If I do not meet the total goal I will withdraw from the residency program and I will use the money raised to continue working on and performing COMMON in LA. 


Check out the Perks you get! They are all designed so that you can see the work you are supporting me producing while I am in LA. For the first 10 people who donate - I will personally call to thank you. For 30 Euros or more you will get a live stream performance while I am in LA. Donations over 100 Euro you will get a free pass for my performances in 2016. And donating between 10 and 30 euro means you will get a selection of photographs of the work I am producing while in LA. So please contribute what you can - the more money I can make for this project - the better! If you cannot contribute then please share the campaign.



It is so important for me to be able to bring this work to other parts of the world and get input and compare the topic in a new climate. More than that, my asking for this money goes to the very core of my work. If creativity is not supported, art not funded and if small projects about poor communities are not made - then this type of work is not seen. That is why I think it is very important you fund me - so that this story is told. So that this work is seen and shared around the world and without my coming from a wealthy background. For more about my track record, just check out my web site: katieleedunbar.de.





Risks & Challenges
I have already saved around 1500 EUR of my own money and have applied for various travel and research grants in Berlin and the UK.  Some I didn't get, some I am still waiting to hear from. For me to be able to accept the residency in December, I need the money quicker than any government funding could get it to me. But, I will not let money get in the way of me being able to make smart professional and creative moves. Originally I was invited to take part in the three months residency at Eastside International and I have already cut that down to one month so that I am sure I can find sufficient funds. I am practical and have spent my life working hard and making a little money go a long way. Therefore whatever amount of money I get, even if it's below the amount I am asking for I will make it work - that's a tried and tested fact. And if the unbelievable happens and I get more money that I am asking for - you can be sure that it will go into the continuation of COMMON - and drawing the map of post industrial communities, next on my map will be the UK. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have any spare cash - I get it, trust me - Help me out by sending this campaign to friends and family that might be interested in donating. Or simply share it on any of your social networks.  If I get 110 people who donate 30 EUR then I will have met my goal and will be able to continue working on COMMON and will be able to bring it to the US. Together I think we know 110 people with 30 EUR to support me and my art, right? Back me, write lovely comments or do any other supporting thing you can think of!

story:
In 2012, I created the performance projectThe 2 of Us.

This performance has appeared in so many shapes, taken me to so many places in the world, and helped me to collaborate with so many artists. Many of these inspirational co-creators are now dear friends.

More than just a performance piece, this work has been an intense process of self-discovery. I want to share my personal journey with YOU. I believe sharing this project will inspire our community. For these reasons, I want The 2 of Us to leave a mark!

I have always self-funded all my projects and my art. But this time, so close to finishing, I got stuck and need your help!

The BOOK and the DVD  are in the final editing stages and still need to be published.

The 2 of Us includes lots of amazing contributing artists:

Ron Athey

Joey Arias

Paul King

Kiril Bikov

Alex Noble

Berenice V

Sage Charles

Lea Nahon

Junao Diaz

Chris Sutton

Gabriele Toso

Jose Vigers

Joanna Matuszak

Guido Mencari

Marie et Feline Gruss

Lili Fernandez de Gamboa Toran

Caroline Gagné

Giacomo Garavelloni

Juan Ramos

Taran Regil

Lee Wagtsaff

Floyd E. Shulze


THANK YOU GIFTS

I have put together different thank you gifts from my personal artist archive and from relics of the performances of The 2 of Us. This is a unique chance to own these original pieces. 

The books are being offered here as a pre-order. There will be only 100 printed, signed, numbered, and fingerprinted with my blood.

The finished film will be submitted to festivals around the world. Some film festivals have strict policies about distribution, as such, the DVD will only be available during this fundraiser. After the fundraiser closes, the DVD will not be available again for quite awhile.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

More specifics about the project...

The Book : 

Pages: 156

Images: Black and White, and Color

Editing: Jon John, Lee Wagstaff, and Floyd Schulze

Edition: limited edition of 100 copies, signed, numbered and fingerprinted in my blood.

Publishing: AKA Berlin (Jon John) and RISE Berlin gallery are collaborating to distribute this book.

Layout: Floyd Schulze has done an amazing job!

Contributors: 

Poems from Sages Charles and Juano Diaz

Texts from Ron Athey, Paul King, Lee Wagstaff, Gabriel Toso, Caroline Gagné, and Jon John

Pictures from  Berenice V, Kiril Bikov, Chris Sutton, Joanna Matuszak, Guido Mencari, and Jose Vigers


The Film : 

Editing:  Berenice V and Jon John

Duration: 35 minutes

Language: English (subtitles: French and Spanish)

Music: Giacomo Garavelloni and Juan Ramos

Appearances by : Joey Arias, Ron Athey, Paul King, and Jon John

Photography by : Berenice V, Kiril Bikov, Taran Regil, Marie & Féline Gruss, Joanna Matuszak, and Elsa Biedermann,.

The film follows the development of the live performances of The 2 of Us at:

Berlin: RISE Berlin gallery

London: Chelsea Theatre

Paris: La Flaq

Chicago: Mana Contemporary

Los Angeles: The Cowboy Gallery

Canada: Folie Culture

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For those who cannot financially help, please share this project, every little help is a great help!! 

Thank you all!

with love,

Jon John

story:
The Project

Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) are growing fast with demand from various industries sectors like education, professional trainings, marketing and many more. Individually, both already played crucial roles in changing the future of human interactions with information’s using the latest’s technology and gadgets. However, combining both will revolutionize the way we look at how 3D registered graphics combined and interact in the real world. Reviewing the current apps that are available in the market to date, this project addresses on the methodologies in the context of AR and VR simulations into one platform and how the system can support to benefit both the users and the creative people at the same time.

What is VAR apps?

VAR Gallery is an Augmented Reality apps, where art pieces are presented in real-time, either augment or virtually, in the field of user through an android or ios platform example, phone or pads. This apps replaces the traditional ways of how art lovers and art enthusiast or an artists view, buy, experience and create network from an art gallery visit. 

The Impact

For consumer: The portability of having the apps on a mobile phone helps user to go online to do purchase by printing out the chosen art piece marker and augment it on their walls in real-time, to be able to see the real life painting size, colors and texture and to be able to manipulate the position of the painting before making the purchase. 

For Artists or creative people: They are able to reached bigger audience from anywhere around the world, displaying their art pieces without the hassle of traveling and bringing the art piece to physical locations. They can interact and network with other users real-time, updating their latest’s work and information with a click.

Most of the virtual art galleries created for the purpose of virtual tour. Creating a virtual art gallery to view art pieces and interact with other users is something that I think best to benefit the user and the creative people at the same time.

Goals:

For the user:

The main goal is providing an easy access for art audiences to view art pieces by different artists around the world exploring in the Virtual environment. This will consists of virtual gallery with an option to order, purchase and contact the artists real-time.

For art collectors, they are able to purchase art pieces online in the comfort of their home. The AR will let user choose the piece, print out the unique markers by different artists and augment the art pieces real-time on their walls to make sure the size and colors matches before make payment confirmations.

For the artists and creative people:

The main goal is providing virtual space for artists around the world to display their work anytime anywhere.

Interact and network with users and other artists via the Virtual environment.

Easily access options to update their art pieces regularly.

Conclusion:

The main goal of this project is to bridge the user and the creative artists through the means of digital media. The objective is to ease the complexity of using digital media to do simple daily task in the comfort of your home.

Risks & Challenges

Creating apps is no longer a huge hurdle for developers as there are already a lot of open source resources. Being able to change human perceptions on looking at arts, change human behaviours and experience on using technology to enhance the way we live. The only challenge I can foresee is creating a dynamic pool of team members who have the same visions and missions for this project which boils down to the budget. 

As a First Class Honours, Bachelor of Science in Digital Media graduate, I am confident that with the right dynamic team members, we will be able to finish and execute the project I have started. With the support for this campaign, I am hoping to finish this project and share the concept to the world.

Step In!!

Do provide feedbacks and throw-in some ideas on how I can further develop this apps better. I am also hoping for developers companies to step-in and help boost the funding for this project. Thank you for the support!

story:
Hey art lovers of all varieties,

Thank you for stopping by and supporting the arts, and our team! As artists, we often work on commissioned projects and rarely have the time, or resources, to create our passion projects. 

We are a three person team of body painters and acrobats, collaborating to create living art and bring some joy, beauty, and wonder into this world we all live in. This summer, we are headed to the World Bodypainting Festival again! Let me introduce the team and tell you about our project.

The amazing body painter on our team is Moona Weaner (Hyun Yong Jin). Moona, born in South Korea, now from Los Angeles, started her art journey with sculpting as a young adult. In college she enrolled in a beauty art institute and fell in love with drawing, body painting, and makeup. Since 2010 she has participated in numerous international body painting competitions and has won 5 championships. She is also a sought after educator at many global universities and academies. You can see her work in various prints, ads, and broadcastings around the world.

Tony Schott, one of our amazing acrobats, from Atlanta, GA started his training in gymnastics at a young age. This led to many state and national titles in both gymnastics and competitive cheerleading, both as the athlete and a coach. His professional focus switched to circus arts 7 years ago and he now showcases his creative athleticism, and fabricating expertise, with his co-owned, performance design company, The Off Centered Project.

And hi, I am Kristina Guede, the other half of the acrobatic duo, co-owner, creative director of TheOCP. I have been a dancer since I can remember, finding a focus in classical ballet. That is what led me to Atlanta from Illinois. I have been a freelance artist for 15 years in various roles from runway modeling, ballet, circus variety acts, costume design, body paint modeling and so much more. Life is never dull, and that's how I like it.

Together, our team has won two, 1st Place titles, and one, 2nd Place title at Living Art America, a North American Bodypaint Championship (1st) and IMATS Atlanta (1st & 2nd). We have collaborated on SPFX makeup demos for beauty schools in South Korea, created live visual sensations for audiences unplugging from technology, and have stayed up countless nights working on handmade prosthetics/costuming for various competitions. But most importantly we have created a worldwide friendship through art that creates positive conversation and bewilders the mind.

The end result is always magical but the work put in is not for the faint of heart. Plasters, silicones, latex, clay, paints, and so much more is needed to create the appliances we need for this masterpiece. Hours are spent life casting, sculpting, pouring moulds, creating bald caps, practicing the paint on the body, not to mention traveling with this stuff (watching us get on a plane is often hysterical). The whole process is a science really. Not to mention the hours of training in the gym with our acrobatic coaches we do to keep our bodies in tune and bringing the art to life in the most unique ways we possibly can.

This summer, our team is reuniting to compete at the World Bodypainting Festival in Klagenfurt, Austria!!! We are taking on the Team category, where the paint and the presentation are to be judged as one, SPFX Makeup, AND the SPFX Bodypainting categories. The themes are fun and out of this world. We can't wait to show you what is brewing.

This is why we need your help!

Our plane tickets and apartment are covered but we could use your support to help offset cost of materials, mentioned above, and, if anything is left over, to help fill the fridge while we are there.

Why do we do these projects/competitions? Well, simply put, to gain recognition. Unfortunately we live in a who's who world and titles help us to get the bigger and better jobs to be able to support our platforms and continue to be thriving artists. Not only do the body paint artists benefit, we as models have a chance to win model awards, plus our team category being a collective assessment helps us all, if we win of course. All we can do is our best, but your support helps take the stress off of the financials of the project and allows us to focus on the art.

Your support means the world to us. We can't do this without the people who support us. We look forward to sharing our artistic journey with you. 

xoxo,
Kristina, Moona, & Tony

story:
My name is Laura Isaac Pensar. I’m an artist and Tarot card reader living in Kansas City. I have been reading Tarot since I was 12 years old and have longed to design my own decks for over ten years.  My goal for The Paris Tarot was to create an attractive and spiritual deck exploring the traditional archetypes through photographic images I captured on a very personal journey through France.

When I turned 21 I found myself at a crucial crossroads in my life. Struggling and directionless, I had $2100 to my name and came extremely close to purchasing a one-way ticket to Paris to start a new life. Instead I adopted a shelter dog and moved back to Kansas City to start my life as an artist.

Now, more than a decade later at another major turning point in my life, I traveled to Paris for the first time this past Spring. At my first sighting of the City of Light, I immediately knew I wanted to create images for a Tarot deck.

I didn’t realize doing so would deepen my connection with the Tarot and push me to bring the symbolism of Tarot more fully into my art practice. I began the trip looking specifically for imagery to use in the deck… but I quickly let go of trying to impose my ideas on the archetypes and started freely taking photos.

The images I captured combined with hand-drawn elements and lettering for the cards have come together to form powerful and enchanting depictions of traditional Tarot archetypes for use in exploring psychic paths for all levels of Tarot practitioners.

Since my return, I have designed the cards and produced a test-proof deck.

Funding for this project will make possible printing the full 78-card Paris Tarot in a first edition of 50 decks. The cost of print-on-demand decks is high and printing this first edition of 50 decks will help keep the price point accessible. I am asking for your support to fund 75% of the project. I am able to personally invest $395 out of the total $1,580 and need your help to cover the remaining $1,185 to fully fund this project through pre-sales of The Paris Tarot.

Printing 50 decks - $1,073

Packaging & Marketing - $507

Project Total - $1,580

Artist's Personal Investment - $395

GOAL - $1,185 ((REACHED!!!))

STRETCH GOAL - $1,945 (To print a full edition of 100 decks instead of 50.)

I’ve minimized the risks to this project by personally investing the upfront costs, completing all art, ordering test proofs of all materials, and obtaining verified quotes for production costs. Now I just need to raise at least the campaign goal to cover the production costs of the first edition! **The initial goal of $1,185 was reached just before the solar eclipse on August 21st! Now I've set a stretch goal of $1,945 to print an edition of 100 decks. If the full stretch goal isn't reached I will print as many decks as the amount raised will cover. Thank you all so much for getting The Paris Tarot to a minimum edition of 50 decks!!! Let's shoot for the moon!
