story:
I am a student a the University of Arizona in Tucson. For my senior capstone project, I am creating a field guide to share my love for the Sonoran Desert. This is a book illustrated, designed, and written by me. It's very easy to read, there are 50+ large, color illustrations of plants, animals, and fungi, some are desert icons and some you didn't even know existed! It's small, so it's perfect to carry on a hike. I have poured my heart into every aspect of this book and I would love for it to actually get printed!

So printing is a funny thing, for one of these 150-page books to get printed it's about $200 (in nice paper and perfect bound stitching) but for 25 books each one breaks down to about $22. I can't quite afford to print just one, so why not print a bunch and spread the love?  

What I Need & What You Get

I need at least 10 people to buy a book at 40 dollars each in order to make printing this worthwhile. If 10 people contribute $40 each one will get a book mailed (or delivered if you're nearby) along with a personalized note of thank you. 

If more than 10 people buy a book, thus making the cost of each book go down, you'll get a book, a handwritten note of thanks, and some stickers of the plants and animals you see in the book.

The Impact

You can use this book to learn about the world, encourage you to go outside, teach your kids about animals or simply look at the pretty pictures!

Risks & Challenges

The book is ready to print already, so it's up to your donation to make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! This book is great for anyone young or old, experienced hiker or city dweller.
story_txt:
I am a student a the University of Arizona in Tucson. For my senior capstone project, I am creating a field guide to share my love for the Sonoran Desert. This is a book illustrated, designed, and written by me. It's very easy to read, there are 50+ large, color illustrations of plants, animals, and fungi, some are desert icons and some you didn't even know existed! It's small, so it's perfect to carry on a hike. I have poured my heart into every aspect of this book and I would love for it to actually get printed!
So printing is a funny thing, for one of these 150-page books to get printed it's about $200 (in nice paper and perfect bound stitching) but for 25 books each one breaks down to about $22. I can't quite afford to print just one, so why not print a bunch and spread the love?  

What I Need & What You Get
I need at least 10 people to buy a book at 40 dollars each in order to make printing this worthwhile. If 10 people contribute $40 each one will get a book mailed (or delivered if you're nearby) along with a personalized note of thank you. 
If more than 10 people buy a book, thus making the cost of each book go down, you'll get a book, a handwritten note of thanks, and some stickers of the plants and animals you see in the book.

The Impact
You can use this book to learn about the world, encourage you to go outside, teach your kids about animals or simply look at the pretty pictures!

Risks & Challenges
The book is ready to print already, so it's up to your donation to make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! This book is great for anyone young or old, experienced hiker or city dweller.

story:
Hello world,

We are Rossen and Nenko. We're from Bulgaria, the two and only members of "Badge". From one year ago, we have been living in the poorest Roma ghetto on the Balkans. it's called "Sunrise" or in Bulgarian "Izgrev", popularly known as "Stolipininovo". "Sunrise" for over 20 years has been depicted as the worst and most morally degraded living district in Bulgaria, where things such as prostitution, drug-dealing, murder and rape are nothing unordinary. Our goal is to coach some local kids. We record, together with a few local youngsters with GoPro cameras, everyday situations in the ghetto. The manufactured videos we upload to our youtube channelhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuaSW33X9IO-D_-7UQcTcJ...

 

During this process, the Roma youngsters are taught how to film, how to edit, how to work with sound, how to use social media and without being too intrusive, teach them history of cinema and afterwards we will let them carry on the same challenge we've taken upon with them, finding new students of their own. The letter..maybe is too long or maybe too short..but from previous bad experiences with so-called "big" instiutions - the conflict is that their accent has always been on the differences. How a group of people want to adapt or readjust the others around them according to their values. We want to put an accent on the "sameness" so that we wouldn't be bothered by our differences. We invite you to follow the fruits of our adventures on our YouTube channel.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuaSW33X9IO-D_...

 

One of the videos, “El Maestro”, has been selected by the IndieWise independent film festival. https://getindiewise.com/

The Plovdiv Municipality has covered our travel costs to the extent of $1800. However, we have need of $940 more for participation fees, accommodation, visa costs, services so that we can attend the festival. We are turning to you with the request for partial or total financing of this initiative. The respective donors will be officially presented in the festival as such.

 

Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or concerns about our project.

 

With respect,

Badge

story:
MERGE Art Collective Project 1 

Our first project as a collective will take place in February 2018 in Brooklyn, NY and in order to fund this first project we will need financial backing. We will be bringing together artists from London, Seattle, Orlando, and Brooklyn, and it is an exciting opportunity to facilitate collaborations between members of the deaf and hearing communities. 

In February 2018 we will be debuting our first collaborative piece, and filming the rehearsal process and performance to be used as our product for future grant proposals and venue booking opportunities. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will be needing to fund travel expenses, the artistic contributions of our performers, sound equipment rental, and an ASL interpreter to be present at rehearsals and the filming.
  • We have exciting perks included, such as personalized shout-out videos and recognition on our official site! 

The Impact

This project will do more than create a new art form; it will stimulate discussion amongst members of the deaf and hearing artistic mediums, to understand the similarities we share, and the beauty of American Sign Language. Hearing performers will have the opportunity to learn about deaf culture and ASL, while deaf performers will be placed at the forefront of the performance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help to get word out and share our campaign and website with your friends and family!

Thank you for making a difference. 

A HUGE Thank You to our dear friends and colleagues who have already donated to our cause! Thank you for supporting our network of artists, coming together for the purpose of instigating social change!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

We are a group of students currently in our 3rd year of the BA(Architecture) in the Department of Architecture at the National University of Singapore (NUS). We’ve been given the to opportunity to realise a hypothetical light installation after submitting the proposal for the I Light Student Award over the July 2018 Summer break. We are seeking your help to help fund this 6 months-in-the-making project that will be displayed at the annual I Light Singapore: Bicentennial Edition at the Marina Bay. Your support will help cover additional construction and material costs, as well as general administrative tasks such as setting up of the installation before the start of the lights festival.

 

OUR TEAM

Designers: Bryan Joseph Cadag_ Loo Quan Le_ Zulkarnain Mohd Zin

 

THE DESIGN

_Why the Singapore Stone?_

Seeing how we’ve all at one stage of our local education here in Singapore have been made aware of the story of Badang and the Singapore Stone as a part of the local folklore stories- with Singapore serving as the geographical context- we decided to use this as a starting off point after deliberating what the theme of I Light 2019, Bicentennial Edition- Bridges of Time- means to us. We wanted a subject matter that was familiar, yet not fully understood by Singaporeans. Those stories were always told light-heartedly, with the pretence to take it with a pinch of salt, since it lacked physical evidence (aside from the Sejarah Melayu). However, the Singapore Stone was a tangible vestige of the past; it is one of the 12 ‘preserved’ National Treasures that precedes the 1819 founding date, yet not fully due to historical circumstances

*refer to the excerpt Design Excerpt for the stone’s timeline

_The Installation_

The installation is the interpretation of the various states of the Singapore Stone’s existence; it is an interpretation of what was, what it is, and what it could have been (if it was not destroyed). 52 pedestals of various heights are scattered within an approximately 8m by 5m area, with 51 ‘rock fragments’ being placed a top each pedestal. 1 pedestal is left intentionally empty, as a sort of ‘reservation’ and hinting to the only piece of the Singapore Stone that we still have, currently being kept in the National Museum of Singapore. From the front of the installation, the varying heights of the ‘rock fragments’ will lend to the visual recreation of our assumption of what the original Singapore Stone could have looked like before its destruction. However, as the gaze of the viewer shifts as he circumscribes the installation, it slowly disintegrates and shifts into it’s a sort of time- warped, “exploded” form, referencing to its destruction in 1843. To further emphasize on the state of explosion, the fragments will light up in an orchestrated fashion, so that it radiates from the “empty pedestal”, slowly cascading to the rest of the installation, like a pulse. This will help animate the explosive nature of the installation

The pedestals are made of mild steel, while the ‘rock fragments’ are recreated out of perforated wiremesh, folded and warped to recreate an ephemeral take on a generic rock form. This material choice would allow for the ‘rock fragments’ to be illuminated internally.

*Do read the excerpt Design Concept portion of our proposal for further explanation on the thought process, with relevant renders and diagrams. Be mindful that certain physical aspects of the installation have changed such as scale and dimensions due to site restriction, though intent and concept and general form have remained unaffected.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

After receiving the design budget from the festival organisers and sponsorships, we are still short of $10 000 USD of the estimated construction fees. The additional fund will be used to cover the equipment that we were not able to retrieve from the sponsorship, as well as to cover hidden costs such as initial storage, transport, setting up, tearing down and administrative tasks. This is where your support comes in!

For every donation tier reached (Silver, Gold, Platinum and Premium), the names of the sponsors will be etched and placed prominently as the 1st floor tile of the platform holding the installation; you will be a part of physical manifestation of the installation!

 

THE IMPACT

The installation aims to raise awareness of Singapore’s 700 years of history and before. Singapore’s earliest historical event tends to be essentialised and relegated to Sir Stamford Raffles’ arrival in 1819. However,  Malay folklores such as Sang Nila Utama and Badang serve as glimpses to an earlier past, though lacking in tangible evidences.  We want to shed light and give exposure to a national treasure that has played ‘carafe’ in many historical events and texts; to an object that connects a past before Singapore's modern founding to the present, where it currently resides in the National Museum. It places Singapore in a bigger geographical picture, and not just materialised and made significant in 1819. It also aims to incite interest within Singaporeans to explore on their own country’s past that is not common knowledge or readily accessible.

Any donation or sponsorship, regardless of amount, will go a long way in helping fund this project. For us, to see a summer side project turn to an actual realised installation on such a significant event is a humbling experience and truly exciting as we near the set-up dates. We sincerely invite you to be a part of this project by extending a hand to fulfil the vision we have imagined!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word! Every bit of support helps us greatly, and we appreciate any and all contributions. Looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 
Spread the word! Every bit of support helps us greatly, and we appreciate any and all contributions. Looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ!

story:
Why Are We Crowdfunding?

We're a new company, and every journal we can pre-sell through this campaign makes a difference. For us, and for our artists, pre-sales mean:

  • We get art into more people's lives
  • More resources are available to promote their work
  • Resources are available sooner to sign additional artists

What We Offer

We have already made a commitment to these artists. These journals will be printed, so there is no risk when you contribute to this campaign. The journals are designed, the printer has been booked, and we guarantee delivery in September.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to buy one of our journals. If you like the idea of what we are doing, please spread the word. We'll enter all of our supporters into a special draw.

story:
About Vanessa

Vanessa Norris, born and raised in Maine, makes primarily functional tableware designed for everyday use. Her work is subtle yet playful; she often incorporates tactile oddities on the inside of a handle or at the mouth of a cup, inviting users to take a closer look at the details only visible from close up. Central to her work is her interest in perception and what captures the attention of the viewer versus what people pass by. Vanessa currently exhibits around the United States and teaches at local ceramics studios.

To see more of her work, check out www.vanessamnorris.com

 

About Gustavo

Gustavo Barceloni was born in Brazil, raised in Greater Boston. He collaborates with chefs and designs illustrative tableware for home and restaurant use. He also creates installations and community based projects which explore the complexities and confusions of living within the Brazilian diaspora. Gustavo describes his illustrative work as "sophisticated classroom notebook doodles" and strives to expand these works to include not just his humorous style but also his politics, history, and humanity. He is currently in the process of completing a program that will allow him to teach within the Boston Public School system.

To see more of his work, check out www.gustavobarceloni.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

Fortunately, we have a space and already own some of the major equipment needed for our studio, including a kiln and two wheels. Here are the essentials for setting up a successful and productive studio:

  • Insulation for the garage door and roof of the studio
  • A heater to keep the studio warm and toasty
  • A shed to store extra equipment, tools, and materials
  • Electrician to hook up the kiln properly
  • Kiln venting system
  • Kiln furniture, etc. (shelves, posts, cones, stilts)
  • Heavy duty tables
  • Glaze materials

If we're able to meet our goal of $6000, we are more than happy to give back a little something to those who donated to our campaign. Think of it as a donation with a prize attached! Check out the incentives on the right-hand margin.

If we are able to surpass our goal, we will be able to purchase extra equipment, such as ware carts, photo/lighting equipment, and a hot box, among various other things.

 

 

The Impact

As emerging artists, it is crucial to have a space to make our work. Without the essential items above, we would have no way of firing our work to the finished state. Renting a studio can cost anywhere from $150 (a low estimate) to $400 per month for ceramic artists in the Boston area. We would rather save our money and pour it into cultivating a space to grow on our own terms. A ceramics studio is a place for us to make our work, but it's also a venue to teach and immerse others in the creative process. We plan to host events, hold private one-on-one classes, and build with our local community of Everett, MA.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest risks we face is not gathering enough funding. If the campaign does not raise $6000, then it will take us a lot longer to build our studio. Our goal, with your help, is to have it up and running by the end of this year. However, minus adequate funding, that goal will probably take until the summer of 2018--at minimum.

Since we own and are not renting the space, the risks associated with funding our campaign are pretty minimal. Once the kiln and ventilation are hooked up and the insulation is in place, the only things left to do are buy the rest of the necessary equipment and get the space "studio ready," which will include cleaning, rearranging, and painting. Other than that, we're good to go!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign monetarily, please help us spread the word any way you can! Share our story on social media and tell your friends/family to do the same!

 

 

FAQs

What is a kiln?

Like a super hot oven, we use kilns to fire our work. Without this piece of equipment, our ceramics could never be used because any water added would cause them to disintegrate. Typically, there are two firings within the process, the bisque and the glaze firing. A bisque expels the mechanical/chemical water within the piece and makes it porous/less brittle. After applying glaze, the final firing vitrifies the clay (making it non-porous and able to hold water) and creates that glassy surface!

Why "Dirty E" Studios?

"Dirty E" is a nickname for Everett, MA. We like it because "dirty" has a double meaning--both for the name of the town and the messy making process. We tend to get more than a little dirty when we work...

When will I receive my perk?

You will receive your gift in March of 2018. We need enough time to set up the studio and settle in before we start making your pieces! Please note that the colors and style of the pieces will vary. Each piece is unique!

How do I select a perk?

Click on the perk you'd like (on the right hand margin). If you don't want a perk, simply select "Back It" near the top of the page.

story:
The Basics

I'm a paper sculptor/illustrator, and I'm looking to raise $5500 to help me work on putting together a children's book illustration portfolio. My goal is to have a minimum of twelve new, portfolio-worthy paper sculptures completed by January 2013*.

*Looks like it might be closer to mid-February, updates on progress to come soon! (edited 11/29/2012)

In 2006, I quit my office job to focus on my paper sculpting.  Since then, I've sold art online. The online market quickly shifted the direction of my work away from portfolio-type pieces - since I am usually working to cover bills and rent and such, I've been unable to focus on making larger, more detailed works that would take a long time to find a buyer.

Recently, I was lucky enough to be offered representation by a great literary agent, Kelly Sonnack at the Andrea Brown Literary Agency. So now, all that's holding me back is not having the perfect portfolio. With your help, that last obstacle can finally be overcome!

Important note: All rewards will be paid even if I don't reach my goal!

Check out more of my work on my facebook page or in this temporary gallery.

What I Need & What You Get

Here's what the $5500 is for:

  • Freedom to work on larger, more detailed works geared toward the children's book illustration market.
  • Rent and utilities to have somewhere to create the paper sculptures.
  • Supplies (mostly paper and glue and x-acto blades).
  • Food for myself, my cat Einstein, and my 2 sugar gliders, Zeke and Toby.

Depending on contribution levels, here's what you can get:

  • A PDF of the complete portfolio created for this project.
  • Mini Prints* (2.5x3.5 in) of one or more completed portfolio pieces.
  • 5x7 inch prints* of one or more completed portfolio pieces.
  • 8.5 x 11 inch prints* of one or more of the completed portfolio pieces.
  • All prints are signed and titled on the back by the artist (me).
  • Original paper sculptures.
  • Special discounts on any available original portfolio artwork, and other original paper sculptures.
  • $50-$200 contributions receive credits toward anything in my online stores such as my Etsy Shop or website. These credits will never expire. Credits not redeemable for commission work. Credits are store credit only and have no cash value. Credit cannot be applied to shipping costs (but most items have free shipping anyway!).
  • Contributors at the $500 level will receive one of the originals of their choice produced by this project (handled on a "First come, first choice" basis -1st contributor gets first choice, 2nd gets second choice, ect) -
  • At the $500 level I'll work some contributor suggestions/ideas into one to two of the pieces so I can make sure contributors at that level can have an option they really want in the end!

All perks include shipping to anywhere in the US or Canada, other countries please contact me first for shipping information.

*Prints are printed on glossy photo paper with Canon ChromaLife100 inks for long life (up to 100 years). and are acid free and moisture and fingerprint resistant.

All contributions will come to me even if the total funding goal is not met. I have chosen the Flexible Funding option because I have to create this portfolio no matter what, so any funds raised will help even if the goal isn't reached - it may just take a little longer to get all the rewards. *NOTE - Paypal payments will show up as going to sherrylynn124(at)gmail.com/ Sherry Knaus and will reach me.

The Plan

My goal is to end up with a great portfolio to show to children's book publishers. Right now, because of of the direction online selling has moved my work, I mostly have small sculptures with a single character and little to no background/environment. I need to create detailed pieces with expressive characters interacting believably with each other and their environments. I also want to have some examples of the same character(s) doing different things to show my ability to keep a character looking the same throughout an entire series of illustrations.

Some of the things you'll see in the finished portfolio are: expressive characters with detailed costumes, children interacting with colorful creatures, antrhopomorhic animal characters, fantasy castles and dragons and more (and cats, of course)!

I'll post regular updates with pictures to show the progress of the portfolio.

The Long Version

When I was 5 or 6, I got a copy of "Tales of Magic and Make Believe", a wonderfully illustrated book of short fantasy tales.  From that day, I knew I wanted to illustrate children's books (though at the time I think I just thought of them as "books").

During my final year at RIT (where I earned my BFA in Illustration in 2002), I was introduced to paper sculpture around the middle of the year. It quickly became my favorite medium/technique.  Since it came so late in my college career, I didn't graduate with the portfolio I wanted to show to publishers, as I didn't have but a few paper sculptures.

My plan was to put together a portfolio and then work on getting some book deals, but things didn't work out exactly as planned. For a few years I worked an office job and didn't have much time to work on paper sculptures. 

In 2006, I quit that job to focus on my paper sculpting.  Since then, I've sold art online. The online market quickly shifted the direction of my work away from portfolio-type pieces - since I am usually working to cover rent and bills and such, I'm unable to focus on making larger, more detailed works that would take a long time to find a buyer.

Recently, I was lucky enough to be offered representation by a great literary agent, Kelly Sonnack at the Andrea Brown Literary Agency. So now, all that's holding me back is not having the perfect portfolio!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, you can help by spreading the word -please share this campaign with as many people as you can!

story:
（英語の後に日本語訳あります）

What I do and where I do it.
I’m a capoeira teacher. I’ve been teaching it in Tokyo, where I’ve lived for 14 years. I love it here. My students, the Japanese, the food; love it.
But I don’t just teach capoeira. I spread Afro-Brazilian and Latin culture and dance through presentations (I received a Masters in Brazilian culture from Waseda University, Tokyo) and via collaborations with Brazilian artists living in Japan.
Last year, my family, friends and students took part in the Asakusa Samba Carnival, Tokyo, one of the largest events of its kind in the world – 500,000 people attended! Trust me when I say, the Japanese just love Brazilian culture.

So what’s the challenge?
Japan is great. But they do things a little bit differently over here. Take non-profit organizations　(NPOs); they hardly exist here. If they do, they don’t get a lot of help from the state (no tax breaks or grants) and ordinary people don’t really think about them too much either.
But I ran my Capoeira Zoador Academy (Zoador) as an NPO. Through Zoador, I teach, I visit elementary schools and present classes on Afro-Brazilian music, dance and culture.
Since the economic downturn of the last few years and the 3/11, 2011 Earthquake in Japan, however, NPOs like mine have had a rough time of it. Student numbers are down and cultural events are fewer.
But I live in the Land of the Rising Sun, as Japan is called. And I live by my own motto: live, love, play capoeira! So hope is back in 2013, and Zoador is here to let it breath once again in Japan.

Here’s the Plan.
The 1st Brazilian Culture & Arts Congress (September 14th to 15th 2013).
Basically, we will invite 12 passionate Brazilian artists, including capoeira masters and dance legends, to Yokohama, a beautiful port city and one of the most international places in Japan, right next to Tokyo.

We’re already 50% into the planning: our guests have been contacted and they have agreed to come, some of them even offering to reduce their usual fees for us. A 1,800 person venue has been kindly donated to us – the Yokohama Country and Athletics Club (It’s amazing how asking politely can produce results).

What you can expect to see at the event?
There’s a whole schedule of amazing events we have planned. This is a very short list. Apart from capoeira workshops (of course) by leading mestres (master), we will have:

Carnival style samba dance, samba de Roda, Afro Brazilian Dance, Bossa Nova, and other forms of Brazilian Culture, Guitar, choro, Orchestra of Brazilian Music and creativity, Samba Show techniques, Guitar, Drums and Afro-Brazilian Rhythms, Vocals, Samba dance, Orixás dance, Percussion from Bahia, Cavaquinho, flute and saxophone…


 Headlining Artists 

Carlinhos Pandeiro de Ouro Master Percussionist (Awarded the NEA National Heritage Fellowship) Thelma Ladeira Master Samba Dancer Francis Silva Master Percussionist Mestrando Anjo Master Dance and Capoeira Luiz Claudio Talaia da Costa Master Percussionist Mestre Efraim Master Percussionist and Capoeira Carlinhos do Afro Master Dancer and Choreographer Rosangela Silvestre Master Afro-Brazil Dance Fininho Marimbondo Capoeira Angola Gringo Dance and Capoeira Master Luizinho Barravento Folckloric dance and Capoeira Janderson Afro Master Percussionist and more to be confirmed.
And more to come.......
How can you help?
As you know, these wonderful events always come at cost. We’ve already saved money by securing a free venue and negotiating discounted fees with our guests. But we badly need funds to cover the costs of travel, room and board for our guests. Basically we need bring them here, and house and feed them. For that, we are trying to fundraise: US$17,200 include Indigogo fees

Let me break it down
Cost to get them here and daily expenses. Remember this is really cheap for
Japan (Tokyo-Yokohama Area).
Costs to Hotel, food, and get them around my wonderful city for 5 nights.
Business hotel (Cheap) ¥7,000 a night, back and forth from the airport, meals,
to event and back = ¥47,310 about US$512. per person. So multiplied by 12
artists US$6,144 for everybody. Flights are the other stickler, about ¥935,000 for
all of them! About US$10,136 to get them here and back to their loved ones....
Total: ¥1,502,720 or US$16,280 plus fees equals US$17,200.00

With your kind donation, however large or small, I’m sure we can reach our target.

Whether or not you contribute financially, we would really appreciate your help in spreading the word about our indiegogo campaign. Tell your friends about our campaign through facebook, twitter, any other way you can think of!

So to Recap
Event Title: 1st Brazil Culture & Arts Congress
Organizer: Capoeira Zoador Academy
Dates: Saturday September 14th and Sunday September 15th 2013 (Monday the 16th is a National Holiday in Japan so everyone can rest and go sightseeing)
Times: 10:00 - 20:00 Each Day
Location: Yokohama Country & Athletic Club, Yokohama, Japan

Let’s bring Brazilian-style hope back to Japan
Thank you, with love and passion for life, Sucuri, Nat-chan, Dede, Mathew, Mi-chan and the whole Zoador family and friends

Live, love, play capoeira



Indiegogoって何？
Indiegogoでは、僕たちのように、自分のプロジェクトの資金集めをするページを誰でも作成するくとができる。動画でのPRを載せたり、Paypalアカウントを設定したり、ドネーション（募金）額ごとの特典リストが作れるようになっている。ユーザーはFacebookやTwitterなんかのソーシャルメディアを使って自分のプロジェクトをドンドン宣伝していく。Indigogoはそのキャンペーンが目標金額を達成すると４％、目標に到達しないと9％を手数料として差し引くシステムになっている。


What I do and where I do it.
僕のやっていること、僕の場所

僕はカポエイラの先生をしている。東京での生活も14年になり、その間ずっとカポエイラを教えてきた。僕はこの場所が好きだし、生徒たちが、日本が、食べ物が、すべてが好きだ。

でも、僕がやっているのはカポエイラを教えるだけじゃない。アフロ・ブラジルの文化、ラテンとダンスとその文化を、パフォーマンスにして紹介したりする。（ついでに言うと、ブラジル文化研究で早稲田大学修士課程もきちんと終了した）
日本で活動しているブラジル人アーティストとのコラボレーションだってやる。

昨年、家族、友人、生徒たちと一緒に50万人が参加するビッグイベント、浅草サンバカーニバルに参加してきた。この種のイベントの中じゃ、世界レベルでみても最大規模のイベントだろう。僕の言葉をみんな信じてほしい。それは、「日本人はブラジル文化が大好きなんだ」ってことさ。



So what’s the problem?
それじゃあ、問題は？

日本は素晴らしい国だけど、この国のやり方は少し違うんだ。非営利活動（NPO）の話しだけどね、日本で僕みたいな外国人が、こういう活動を続けるのは思ったほど簡単じゃない。国からの助成金枠もエライ狭いし、税控除だってほとんどしてもらえない。それに、NPO活動やボランティアに対する一般の人たちの意識も、欧米に比べるとだいぶ低いと思うんだ。日本でもNPO活動は広まりつつあるけれど、ボランティアや市民社会活動を支援する仕組みがまだでき上がっていないのが現状なんだ。

だけど、僕はカポエイラ ゾアドール アカデミーをNPOスタイルで運営したいし、そうしてきた。ゾアドールを通じ、小学校、児童施設に行って、アフロ・ブラジルの音楽、ダンスや文化を紹介したりしている。

3.11の東日本大震災の悲劇と、ここ数年の不景気で、NPO活動も存続の危機を迎えていてしまった。生徒数は減ったし、文化イベントの開催自体、グッと減ってしまった。

でも、ここは「日出ずる国」 JAPAN！ここが僕のいる場所だ。 僕は自分のモットーで生きている ：LIVE,LOVE, PLAY CAPOEIRA！
だから、2013年は希望をとり戻そう。ゾアドールはここで、日本で、息を吹き返す。



Here’s the Plan.
これが計画！


ズバリ、 第一回 Brazilian Culture & Arts Congress を開催する。（開催日：2013年 9月14・15日）
Congress（コングレス）って「国会」とか「議会」とか日本では硬いイメージをもたれるようだけど、「一緒に進む」とか「出会う」っていう意味を含んでいる。「Brazilian Culture & Arts大会」みたいに思ってもらえたらいい。

これは何かっていうと、まず、熱いパッションをもっているブラジル人アーティストを12人招待して、ここに集結させる。カポエイラメストレや伝説のダンサーたちをね。場所は東京のお隣、インターナショナルな美しい港町、横浜。

実は、もうこの一大イベントの50％くらいは計画済みなんだ。例えばアーティスト達とは、もうとっくに連絡を取りあっていて、彼らもこのイベントの開催と出演に大賛成してくれている。何人かは、僕らのために通常のギャラを引き下げてでも出演してくれるって乗り気だよ。それに、1800人は入れる開催地がもう決定しているんだ。親切にも、僕らのために会場をタダで提供してくれることになったんだ。知っている人も多いだろう。そう、横浜Country and Athletics Club。




What you can expect to see at the event?
イベントでは何がおこなわれる？

ここに何をやるかのリストがある。短いリストだ。もちろん、カポエイラメストレのワークショップとか、まぁ、ざっとこんな感じ。↓

Carnival style samba dance, samba de Roda, Afro Brazilian Dance, Bossa Nova, and other forms of Brazilian Culture, Guitar, choro, Orchestra of Brazilian Music and creativity, Samba Show techniques, Guitar, Drums and Afro-Brazilian Rhythms, Vocals, Samba dance, Orixás dance, Percussion from Bahia, Cavaquinho, flute and saxophone…


 そしてこれが主要アーティストたち
Carlinhos Pandeiro de Ouro：パーカッション マスター （Awarded the NEA National Heritage Fellowship）←大統領から授与される賞で、日本でいう人間国宝みたいな人ってことかな。
Thelma Ladeira：サンバダンス マスター
Francis Silva：パーカッション マスター
Mestrando Anjo：ダンス / カポエイラ マスター
Luiz Claudio Talaia da Costa パーカッション マスター
Mestre Efraim： パーカッション/ カポエイラ マスター
Carlinhos do Afro： ダンス/ 振付 マスター
Rosangela Silvestre： アフロブラジルダンス マスター
Fininho Marimbondo： カポエイラアンゴーラ
Gringo： ダンス / カポエイラ
Master Luizinho Barravento ：フォークロリックダンス / カポエイラ
Janderson： アフロマスター/ パーカッション
・・・and more!!!


How can you help?
どうやったら協力できるかって？

簡単に想像できると思うけど、これだけのデッカイ企画には莫大な費用がかかる。だけど、もう随分たくさんのコストは削除済みさ。2日間フルに利用でき
るフリーの開催地がもうあるってことと、ゲストアーティスト達と交渉して出
演料をだいぶディスカウントしてもらったってこと。それでも、まだアーテ
ィスト達の旅費、宿泊費とその他滞在費をカバーしなきゃいけない。つまり、
飛行機に乗って日本に来てもらい、部屋と食事を用意してあげないといけな
い。（そりゃそうだよね！）
そのために、僕らはおよそ1,589,000円(≒US$17,200)の資金が必要なんだ！


ちょっと詳しく話させてほしい。

出演者たちの渡航費と日本での滞在費。往復航空券とイベント開催前後含め5泊のホテル代に食事や交通費その他諸々の費用。

安めのビジネスホテルなら1泊7,000円くらいで探せる。それが１人5泊分。空
港とホテルの往復、ホテルとイベント会場の往復、食事、その他・・・で、
1人当たり47,310円（≒US$512）。それが12名分で合計567,720円 （≒$6,144）。 ここでちょっとネックが航空券。彼らをみんな日本に連れてきて、最後はそれぞれの愛する国に帰ってもらうのに、全部でおよそ935,000円 （≒US$10,136）
合計1,502,720円（≒US$1 6,280） ＋Indiegogo 手数料等々


君のドネーション額は大きくても小さくても、みんなの協力が集まれば、目標金額は達成できると思う。

資金面で貢献してくれても、そうでなくても、このindiegogo のキャンペーンを周りに広めてくれたら、僕らは君に心から感謝したいと思う。
僕らのキャンペーンのこと、Facebook、Twitter、思いつくものがあれば何でもいい、友達や周りに広めて欲しい。



So to Recap
それじゃ、最後に確認。

イベントタイトル： 1st Brazil Culture & Arts Congress
オーガナイザー： Capoeira Zoador Academy
日程： 2013年 9月14日（土）、15日（日）  翌日16日は祝日。出演アーティストにも休んでもらえるし、せっかく来たのだから、東京観光くらい連れて行ってあげたい。
時間： 10：00～20：00 （2日間）
会場： 横浜Country & Athletic Club


Let’s bring Brazilian-style hope back to Japan

Brazilian-styleで日本に希望をとり戻そう！

この世界への愛と情熱を込めて、ありがとう！

スクリ、なっちゃん、デデ、マシュー、みーちゃん、そしてゾアドールファミリーと友人たちより

Live, love, play capoeira！

A 1,800 person venue has been kindly donated to us – the Yokohama Country and Athletics Club (It’s amazing how asking politely can produce results).What you can expect to see at the event?There’s a whole schedule of amazing events we have planned. This is a very short list. Apart from capoeira workshops (of course) by leading mestres (master), we will have: Carnival style samba dance, samba de Roda, Afro Brazilian Dance, Bossa Nova, and other forms of Brazilian Culture, Guitar, choro, Orchestra of Brazilian Music and creativity, Samba Show techniques, Guitar, Drums and Afro-Brazilian Rhythms, Vocals, Samba dance, Orixás dance, Percussion from Bahia, Cavaquinho, flute and saxophone…
 Headlining Artists 
Carlinhos Pandeiro de Ouro Master Percussionist (Awarded the NEA National Heritage Fellowship) Thelma Ladeira Master Samba Dancer Francis Silva Master Percussionist Mestrando Anjo Master Dance and Capoeira Luiz Claudio Talaia da Costa Master Percussionist Mestre Efraim Master Percussionist and Capoeira Carlinhos do Afro Master Dancer and Choreographer Rosangela Silvestre Master Afro-Brazil Dance Fininho Marimbondo Capoeira Angola Gringo Dance and Capoeira Master Luizinho Barravento Folckloric dance and Capoeira Janderson Afro Master Percussionist and more to be confirmed.And more to come.......How can you help?As you know, these wonderful events always come at cost. We’ve already saved money by securing a free venue and negotiating discounted fees with our guests. But we badly need funds to cover the costs of travel, room and board for our guests. Basically we need bring them here, and house and feed them. For that, we are trying to fundraise: US$17,200 include Indigogo feesLet me break it downCost to get them here and daily expenses. Remember this is really cheap forJapan (Tokyo-Yokohama Area).Costs to Hotel, food, and get them around my wonderful city for 5 nights.Business hotel (Cheap) ¥7,000 a night, back and forth from the airport, meals,to event and back = ¥47,310 about US$512. per person. So multiplied by 12artists US$6,144 for everybody. Flights are the other stickler, about ¥935,000 forall of them! About US$10,136 to get them here and back to their loved ones....Total: ¥1,502,720 or US$16,280 plus fees equals US$17,200.00With your kind donation, however large or small, I’m sure we can reach our target.Whether or not you contribute financially, we would really appreciate your help in spreading the word about our indiegogo campaign. Tell your friends about our campaign through facebook, twitter, any other way you can think of!So to RecapEvent Title: 1st Brazil Culture & Arts CongressOrganizer: Capoeira Zoador Academy Dates: Saturday September 14th and Sunday September 15th 2013 (Monday the 16th is a National Holiday in Japan so everyone can rest and go sightseeing)Times: 10:00 - 20:00 Each Day Location: Yokohama Country & Athletic Club, Yokohama, JapanLet’s bring Brazilian-style hope back to JapanThank you, with love and passion for life, Sucuri, Nat-chan, Dede, Mathew, Mi-chan and the whole Zoador family and friendsLive, love, play capoeiraIndiegogoって何？Indiegogoでは、僕たちのように、自分のプロジェクトの資金集めをするページを誰でも作成するくとができる。動画でのPRを載せたり、Paypalアカウントを設定したり、ドネーション（募金）額ごとの特典リストが作れるようになっている。ユーザーはFacebookやTwitterなんかのソーシャルメディアを使って自分のプロジェクトをドンドン宣伝していく。Indigogoはそのキャンペーンが目標金額を達成すると４％、目標に到達しないと9％を手数料として差し引くシステムになっている。What I do and where I do it.僕のやっていること、僕の場所僕はカポエイラの先生をしている。東京での生活も14年になり、その間ずっとカポエイラを教えてきた。僕はこの場所が好きだし、生徒たちが、日本が、食べ物が、すべてが好きだ。でも、僕がやっているのはカポエイラを教えるだけじゃない。アフロ・ブラジルの文化、ラテンとダンスとその文化を、パフォーマンスにして紹介したりする。（ついでに言うと、ブラジル文化研究で早稲田大学修士課程もきちんと終了した） 日本で活動しているブラジル人アーティストとのコラボレーションだってやる。 昨年、家族、友人、生徒たちと一緒に50万人が参加するビッグイベント、浅草サンバカーニバルに参加してきた。この種のイベントの中じゃ、世界レベルでみても最大規模のイベントだろう。僕の言葉をみんな信じてほしい。それは、「日本人はブラジル文化が大好きなんだ」ってことさ。So what’s the problem?それじゃあ、問題は？日本は素晴らしい国だけど、この国のやり方は少し違うんだ。非営利活動（NPO）の話しだけどね、日本で僕みたいな外国人が、こういう活動を続けるのは思ったほど簡単じゃない。国からの助成金枠もエライ狭いし、税控除だってほとんどしてもらえない。それに、NPO活動やボランティアに対する一般の人たちの意識も、欧米に比べるとだいぶ低いと思うんだ。日本でもNPO活動は広まりつつあるけれど、ボランティアや市民社会活動を支援する仕組みがまだでき上がっていないのが現状なんだ。だけど、僕はカポエイラ ゾアドール アカデミーをNPOスタイルで運営したいし、そうしてきた。ゾアドールを通じ、小学校、児童施設に行って、アフロ・ブラジルの音楽、ダンスや文化を紹介したりしている。3.11の東日本大震災の悲劇と、ここ数年の不景気で、NPO活動も存続の危機を迎えていてしまった。生徒数は減ったし、文化イベントの開催自体、グッと減ってしまった。でも、ここは「日出ずる国」 JAPAN！ここが僕のいる場所だ。 僕は自分のモットーで生きている ：LIVE,LOVE, PLAY CAPOEIRA！だから、2013年は希望をとり戻そう。ゾアドールはここで、日本で、息を吹き返す。Here’s the Plan.これが計画！
ズバリ、 第一回 Brazilian Culture & Arts Congress を開催する。（開催日：2013年 9月14・15日）Congress（コングレス）って「国会」とか「議会」とか日本では硬いイメージをもたれるようだけど、「一緒に進む」とか「出会う」っていう意味を含んでいる。「Brazilian Culture & Arts大会」みたいに思ってもらえたらいい。これは何かっていうと、まず、熱いパッションをもっているブラジル人アーティストを12人招待して、ここに集結させる。カポエイラメストレや伝説のダンサーたちをね。場所は東京のお隣、インターナショナルな美しい港町、横浜。実は、もうこの一大イベントの50％くらいは計画済みなんだ。例えばアーティスト達とは、もうとっくに連絡を取りあっていて、彼らもこのイベントの開催と出演に大賛成してくれている。何人かは、僕らのために通常のギャラを引き下げてでも出演してくれるって乗り気だよ。それに、1800人は入れる開催地がもう決定しているんだ。親切にも、僕らのために会場をタダで提供してくれることになったんだ。知っている人も多いだろう。そう、横浜Country and Athletics Club。What you can expect to see at the event?イベントでは何がおこなわれる？ここに何をやるかのリストがある。短いリストだ。もちろん、カポエイラメストレのワークショップとか、まぁ、ざっとこんな感じ。↓Carnival style samba dance, samba de Roda, Afro Brazilian Dance, Bossa Nova, and other forms of Brazilian Culture, Guitar, choro, Orchestra of Brazilian Music and creativity, Samba Show techniques, Guitar, Drums and Afro-Brazilian Rhythms, Vocals, Samba dance, Orixás dance, Percussion from Bahia, Cavaquinho, flute and saxophone…
 そしてこれが主要アーティストたちCarlinhos Pandeiro de Ouro：パーカッション マスター （Awarded the NEA National Heritage Fellowship）←大統領から授与される賞で、日本でいう人間国宝みたいな人ってことかな。Thelma Ladeira：サンバダンス マスターFrancis Silva：パーカッション マスターMestrando Anjo：ダンス / カポエイラ マスターLuiz Claudio Talaia da Costa パーカッション マスターMestre Efraim： パーカッション/ カポエイラ マスターCarlinhos do Afro： ダンス/ 振付 マスターRosangela Silvestre： アフロブラジルダンス マスターFininho Marimbondo： カポエイラアンゴーラGringo： ダンス / カポエイラMaster Luizinho Barravento ：フォークロリックダンス / カポエイラJanderson： アフロマスター/ パーカッション・・・and more!!!How can you help?どうやったら協力できるかって？簡単に想像できると思うけど、これだけのデッカイ企画には莫大な費用がかかる。だけど、もう随分たくさんのコストは削除済みさ。2日間フルに利用できるフリーの開催地がもうあるってことと、ゲストアーティスト達と交渉して出演料をだいぶディスカウントしてもらったってこと。それでも、まだアーティスト達の旅費、宿泊費とその他滞在費をカバーしなきゃいけない。つまり、飛行機に乗って日本に来てもらい、部屋と食事を用意してあげないといけない。（そりゃそうだよね！）そのために、僕らはおよそ1,589,000円(≒US$17,200)の資金が必要なんだ！ちょっと詳しく話させてほしい。出演者たちの渡航費と日本での滞在費。往復航空券とイベント開催前後含め5泊のホテル代に食事や交通費その他諸々の費用。安めのビジネスホテルなら1泊7,000円くらいで探せる。それが１人5泊分。空港とホテルの往復、ホテルとイベント会場の往復、食事、その他・・・で、1人当たり47,310円（≒US$512）。それが12名分で合計567,720円 （≒$6,144）。 ここでちょっとネックが航空券。彼らをみんな日本に連れてきて、最後はそれぞれの愛する国に帰ってもらうのに、全部でおよそ935,000円 （≒US$10,136）合計1,502,720円（≒US$1 6,280） ＋Indiegogo 手数料等々君のドネーション額は大きくても小さくても、みんなの協力が集まれば、目標金額は達成できると思う。資金面で貢献してくれても、そうでなくても、このindiegogo のキャンペーンを周りに広めてくれたら、僕らは君に心から感謝したいと思う。僕らのキャンペーンのこと、Facebook、Twitter、思いつくものがあれば何でもいい、友達や周りに広めて欲しい。So to Recapそれじゃ、最後に確認。イベントタイトル： 1st Brazil Culture & Arts Congressオーガナイザー： Capoeira Zoador Academy日程： 2013年 9月14日（土）、15日（日）  翌日16日は祝日。出演アーティストにも休んでもらえるし、せっかく来たのだから、東京観光くらい連れて行ってあげたい。時間： 10：00～20：00 （2日間）会場： 横浜Country & Athletic ClubLet’s bring Brazilian-style hope back to JapanBrazilian-styleで日本に希望をとり戻そう！この世界への愛と情熱を込めて、ありがとう！スクリ、なっちゃん、デデ、マシュー、みーちゃん、そしてゾアドールファミリーと友人たちよりLive, love, play capoeira！

story:
Howdy Everypony!

My name is Zachary Rich, but you might all know me better by my online persona: FlamingoRich. I'm the writer & director of Double Rainboom, a fanmade episode of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. The episode was released on March 30th of this year, and so far has gathered nearly 4 million views on YouTube!
 
In case you haven't seen it yet, you can check it out up above - or through visiting the film's official website at http://www.doublerainboom.com
 
Anyways, I've been invited to host a screening and Q&A panel on the film at Bronycon 2013 - taking place in Baltimore, Maryland from August 2nd to 4th. To learn more about the convention, head on over to their main site at http://www.bronycon.org/
 
The only problem is I don't have enough money to pay for the plane ticket and hotel costs. So I've decided to try out an IndieGoGo campaign to try and raise the money.

What I Need:

I'll need roughly $1000 to pay for these things:
   ○ Roundtrip plane ticket from Atlanta, GA to Baltimore, MD
   ○ Hotel costs for three nights
   ○ Food for three days of being at the convention
   ○ Free shirt buttons to pass out to bronies
 

What You Get:

Aside from being able to see me at the convention, you'll have a chance to claim these rewards when you donate:
• $5 - Printable thank you card emailed to you (signed by FlamingoRich)
• $25 - The above rewards, plus access to exclusive artwork and material related to FlamingoRich's next production
• $50 - The above rewards, plus an exclusive Double Rainboom T-Shirt and access to recorded workshops on animation normally only accessible by FlamingoRich's crew. (These workshops cover things like storyboarding, backgrounds, vector art, character design, and more.)
• $200 - ULTIMATE BRONY PACKAGE: The above rewards, plus access to all 305 shots of Double Rainboom in the form of .FLA & .AE files

The Impact:

The Brony fandom is a fantastic and exhilarating thing, where the impossible can become possible. I created Double Rainboom in order to prove that when we band together, we can surpass society's limitations and create the same kind of entertainment that brought us all together in the first place! I'm hoping that by appearing at Bronycon and talking about my experiences, I can help inspire the community to aim ever higher and achieve greater and more marvelous works of art.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to contribute any money to this campaign but still wish to help out, then you can do one (or all) of the following:

○ Tell your friends! Link this campaign on your twitters, your tumblrs, and your facebooks.

○ Use IndieGoGo's share tools to help spread the word!

○ Email EqD at submit@equestriadaily.com and tell them about this! If we can get this campaign on their front page then it'll bring in tens of thousands of viewers.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Troy and I am a digital and traditional artist and photographer.
I spend most of my time working on all sorts of art using a variety of programs but this is partially because I can't get a regular job.

I have a number of disorders and illnesses, the prominent one being a biorythm disorder that does not allow a regular job because I sleep on different times every day and trying to fight it causes migraines, fevers and a ton of stress.

The only means of generating an income I have is my art, but, my laptop is as close to it's end as it can be. It's old and worn-down, it is in fact broken in half and only barely working, held together by tape.

This is where I'll need your help, my laptop struggles with even the simplest programs at this point and makes art impossible to make. You'll help me get a solid new laptop ready for the work I wish to deliver my commissioners and fans. It really will give me not only hope for the future, but you'll give me an actual future to continue to work up into.

What We Need & What You Get

What I will need is a (more than) decent laptop that can handle any and every program I need. This includes things like Photoshop, rendering software, 3D modeling software and video editing.

What will you get? Well apart from a truly sincere thank you I can hand you my art and give you special rights to existing art, or, for the bigger donators I will personalize my art just for you and finally for the top perks I can make art just for you from scratch! There will be a variety of art types so I can hopefully return the favor of donating to everyone. Patience may be required considering my laptop's state, but I hope it'll manage alright until I reach my goal.

*I will use your funding name and post an image unless you contact me with the name you'd like me to use.

Each and every penny will go towards the laptop and resources I need for my art. This is not a campaign to help me, it is a campaign to help me help myself. You will give me the oppertunity to improve and hopefully fix my life and allow me to give something back to the world in the form of art.

Even if the goal is not reached every euro will be used for a new laptop should I find one that fits my needs and if not than it will be put aside until I have enough to purchase it. So even if the goal is not reached, the money's purpose will remain the same until it can be used for it's goal.

The Impact

This campaign is somewhat of a desperate last shot at trying to get a new laptop, I don't personally enjoy taking donations but this way I can still give something back. You will help me truly change my life and give me an honest shot at trying to live a normal life despite a bunch of problems hindering that.

Since making art is my current only means to generate income it is important that I continue to be able to create it. I'm not the best artist, but I will never be able to live up to my potential if I can't continue to create and improve the art I could never live without.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there is a number of ways you can still help me.
You can check out and share my art and let others know about my campaign.
I would be happy if even ONE more person knows and enjoys my art so even if you can't contribute in the form of money, I will always want people to share and enjoy my art, even giving you opinion on it or points to improve will help me as an artist.

So if you can't contribute, share! It'll help me out a lot.

Thanks to everyone in advance and for taking the time to read all the way down to the end.

story:
I am a student at Hampshire College, in my fourth and final year. My studies here have encompassed Photography (Analog and Digital), Music/Sound Design, Computer Animation, Drawing, Theatre Design, and Sculpture.

My Senior Project is an installation space of a junkyard garden in which the plants, flowers, and creatures are made from found metal objects. As well in the space will be over 100 35mm photographic negatives - depicting themes of nostalgia, passing time, pathways, transitions, and the evolution from child to adult - which will be soldered into bottle caps, and placed in front of twinkling holiday lights. A soundscape will play continuously in the space, and a bench and path through the garden will allow visitors to sit, enjoy, explore, and contemplate.

I require funding for materials such as metal scrap/junk, film, solder, lighting, copper foil tape, tools, and safety supplies.

story:
LOOP Arts Fundraising Campaign

LOOP Arts: A residency for artists, by artists

LOOP Arts runs a print residency that gives San Francisco Bay Area artists free access to a large format inkjet printer to create work for a scheduled exhibition. We had 13 artists come through and print exhibitions for free between January and August 2013 before running out of ink and money. After taking a break to recharge, we're coming back asking the community to help support this great resource. We're asking for enough money to cover a full year of artists (we average around 2 a month). We take nothing. All donations go to ink and rent to help support our artists. 


We are hoping to raise $10,000, a HUGE amount of money, but this will keep us running for over a year and will allow us to serve no less than 24 artists with free printing facilities. If we end up with less, we help as many artists as we can until the money runs dry. If we end up with more, it all goes towards helping more artists.

For more information, please visit our website at http://looparts.com.

In conjunction with this crowd-sourcing campaign, we have an print sale of individual prints coming soon at: http://looparts.com/auction.html.


PLEASE HELP SUPPORT LOCAL ARTISTS!


How did LOOP Arts come about?

LOOP Arts was born out of a series of conversations between Ryan Hendon & Adam Thorman about how to find ways to continue to make work after leaving jobs where we had access to professional large format printers. We realized there was a gap in services for emerging artists and decided to apply for grants to get a printer for our community to be able to use, and LOOP Arts was born.


OUR PERKS

CHECK BACK REGULARLY AS WE'LL BE ADDING PERKS THROUGHOUT THE CAMPAIGN!


T-Shirt & Tote Bag


ap-art-ment editioned print

ap-art-ment (Laura Boles Faw and Cathy Fairbanks), 7"x11" Archival Pigment Print, 2012, $75


Adam Thorman editioned print

Adam Thorman, Cliff House and Sutro Baths, 17x22" Archival Pigment Print, 2013, edition of 25, $200


The White Elephant Experience editioned print set


The White Elephant Experience (Sean Jerd and Lonnie Dean), 2x 11"x14" Archival Pigment Prints, 2014, edition of 15, $300

Check out all of their amazing work on The White Elephant Experience website.

**MORE PERKS WILL BE ADDED SOON!**
story_txt:
LOOP Arts Fundraising CampaignLOOP Arts: A residency for artists, by artistsLOOP Arts runs a print residency that gives San Francisco Bay Area artists free access to a large format inkjet printer to create work for a scheduled exhibition. We had 13 artists come through and print exhibitions for free between January and August 2013 before running out of ink and money. After taking a break to recharge, we're coming back asking the community to help support this great resource. We're asking for enough money to cover a full year of artists (we average around 2 a month). We take nothing. All donations go to ink and rent to help support our artists. We are hoping to raise $10,000, a HUGE amount of money, but this will keep us running for over a year and will allow us to serve no less than 24 artists with free printing facilities. If we end up with less, we help as many artists as we can until the money runs dry. If we end up with more, it all goes towards helping more artists.For more information, please visit our website at http://looparts.com.In conjunction with this crowd-sourcing campaign, we have an print sale of individual prints coming soon at: http://looparts.com/auction.html.PLEASE HELP SUPPORT LOCAL ARTISTS!How did LOOP Arts come about?LOOP Arts was born out of a series of conversations between Ryan Hendon & Adam Thorman about how to find ways to continue to make work after leaving jobs where we had access to professional large format printers. We realized there was a gap in services for emerging artists and decided to apply for grants to get a printer for our community to be able to use, and LOOP Arts was born.OUR PERKSCHECK BACK REGULARLY AS WE'LL BE ADDING PERKS THROUGHOUT THE CAMPAIGN!T-Shirt & Tote Bagap-art-ment editioned printap-art-ment (Laura Boles Faw and Cathy Fairbanks), 7"x11" Archival Pigment Print, 2012, $75Adam Thorman editioned printAdam Thorman, Cliff House and Sutro Baths, 17x22" Archival Pigment Print, 2013, edition of 25, $200

The White Elephant Experience editioned print setThe White Elephant Experience (Sean Jerd and Lonnie Dean), 2x 11"x14" Archival Pigment Prints, 2014, edition of 15, $300Check out all of their amazing work on The White Elephant Experience website.**MORE PERKS WILL BE ADDED SOON!**

story:
False Gallery Presents:

The Hampton Beats Video Release Party & False Gallery's Premier!


WHAT: This opening marks the first event in a series of Pop-Up Art Shows hosted by the new and  enigmatic Los Angeles based collective known as False Gallery. This is a rare and unique opportunity for art collectors and music enthusiasts to experience a immersing and otherwise unprecedented installation of sight and sound combining   unique audio tracks provided by The Hampton Beats with  visual works by three notorious outsider artists, Haunted Euth, Tina St. Claire and Smog City. 

This show features over 15 original paintings by Haunted Euth and Tina St. Claire, a selection of hand pulled silk screen prints by Haunted Euth, two animated music videos for the tracks "Bewarewolf" and " Cheer Up Emo Kid " directed by Haunted Euth and Smog City and a full DJ set of all new material by The Hampton Beats.

WHERE: False Gallery

1553 N. Cahuenga Blvd.

Hollywood, CA 90028

323-462-1100

WHEN: Saturday, January 18th 8pm – 12 a.m. ; 21+,Catered,  Open to the public reception

January 19th, January 25th 12 pm  – 10pm; Open to the public reception

Art Purchases: Info@FalseGallery.com

Bio's:

The Hampton Beats: An LA based electro-pop band, The Hampton Beats, is fusing their dynamic sound with the pulse of LA's street art scene. Over the course of the last year The Hampton Beats have been working with Haunted Euth and Smog City on two animated music videos for their songs "Cheer Up Emo Kid" and "Bewerewolf Bewarewolf." The videos showcase visually what the band achieves sonically, and by pairing the two, the viewer is immersed in an animated world where werewolves roam the streets of LA and emotional youth dressed in all black dance through the city's night swinging a black umbrella to the lyrical chant "I Don't Believe in Nothing."     Members: Eric Swank, Rob King, Jimmy Young, Jeff Price

Haunted Euth: A notorious Los Angeles based Illustrator, Print maker and street artist with a B.F.A. in Painting from Otis College of Art & Design, his work has been seen all over the Los Angeles landscape for the past several year's. Well know for his large scale assemblages, acrylic paintings and cerebral use of latent pop cultural motifs that hearken back to the golden era of science fiction, horror films and 1980s skateboard graphics, he has become a emerging force of unique individual voice and passion that offers a fresh, new take on the city's exhausted street art scene. 

Smog City:  A Los Angeles based artists who works in a broad range of mediums including serigraph's, illustration and animation, his work caries a underlying theme of environmental warning and global concern.

Tina St. Claire: A self taught Los Angeles based painter, she has quickly become one of the cities most unique and carefully watched artist's. Her work, which balances elements of portraiture, abstraction, design and screen printing focuses on the theme of female empowerment.

Follow Us On Twitter: https://twitter.com/FalseGallery

Listen to the Hampton Beats: http://facebook.com/thehamptonbeats 

Check out Haunted Euth's Art: http://www.hauntedeuth.com/

story:
Hello!

  My name is Nickie Lewis. When I was in high school I was quiet, sad, and lonely. That was until I met the most inspirational person, Mrs. Godwin. Mrs. Godwin taught speech and theater, and she said I had talent. I had never been good at anything, in fact one year; I revived the "most improved" award in three separate activities.  But when I started performing, writing, and creating, I felt unstoppable. All the things wrong with my life disappeared if only for a short while. Mrs. Godwin told me I could do anything, and I believed her. As it happens, I went to college, let life get in the way, and forgot all about creating, and the fact that "I could do anything".  Then I had my daughter Bella. She woke me up, made me use my imagination, and create once more. The Imagineerium is my dream, it is a place where children can come and create anything their little minds can dream up. It's also a place where adults can come to reclaim their creativity, and to remember what it is like to use their imaginations. With the help of this campaign, we hope to have a permanent home for The Imagineerium. We will offer imaginative programs, in which we will bring in experts on various mediums to help teach art forms of all kinds, including;

* Girls nights out: where women of all ages can come, paint, craft, write, or whatever creative experience strikes their fancy.

*Date nights: where couples can come get to know one another, and learn how each one creates, and just have fun, whether it be having a paint fight, working together to create a cooperative project.

*Family nights/days: where families can come work together to create projects for their homes, or just have fun painting, creating, or learning more about each's creative process.

*Children’s workshops: This is where kids from the ages of 2-10 can come and create projects using various mediums.

*Children / Adult Birthday Parties: These are customizable events that will run the gambit of creativity. Everything from a Classy painting event to a wild paint throwing, food fighting free for all; and that’s just the adult parties.

  The Imagineerium is a dream, and right now it’s in need of a home. With your help, we would like to find a home, a space for people to gather and create. The funds gathered from this campaign will go towards costs of renting a space for 6 months to a year (depending on costs). If more funds are raised that we need for a space, they will be put towards payment of talented local artists who will be helping with our workshops. If we fall short of our goal, we will continue to fund raise  We will place any funds received into a high interest savings account until our goal is obtained. If we fall short, anyone who submits funds will receive an e-mail update monthly. This e-mail will contain information on our fundraising efforts as well as a photo of a dated bank statement until the goal is achieved.

      We have some great rewards for anyone willing to support our cause. If you live locally, or plan to visit, we will offer up our space for private events, workshops, or general creativity. If you’re far away, we will be your creative proxies: using your ideas, and creativity, we will imagineer your projects for you. Then we will send them to you! We want every person who is willing to help and support us to feel like they are a part of the Imagineerium. Because of this there will also be a very special perk for EVERYONE who helps. We will be placing names on a wall of our space using whichever medium you choose.

  There have been so many people who have done amazing things in history who would never have achieved anything if they hadn't been allowed to be creative. We want the Imagineerium to be a beacon to anyone who might feel as though something is missing in their lives. A place where kids can be kids without electronics, where their small minds can wander and think freely and independently. Life is too short to spend it thinking about bills, and paychecks, and work, and problems. Everyone needs time to Imagineer. Help us make the world more beautiful, more innovative, and more fun.  

        We understand not everyone can afford to support financially  but we would love it if you could help spread the word for us! people who support us by sharing, may also receive special perks.

story:
Our Story

The Friendly Falcons and Their Friend the Snake is the collaboration of artists Jeffrey Kurosaki and Tara Pelletier. Inspired by what they deem as life’s magnificent and miniature grandeurs, they create multi-layered narratives with sculpture, drawing, music and performance. Their work is like riding a wave of primary colors and absurdity with an undercurrent of melancholy and whimsy.


In November 2010, The Friendly Falcons will be undertaking a [five]-country tour, performing their “nomadic artwork,” The Cactus Duet. They will visit Denmark, Germany, France, The Netherlands, and England. The project is a theatrical set that fits into a suitcase and will be put together onsite to tell a story with music and kinetic sculpture. The conceptual underpinnings, design, and form of the work will reflect contemplations on nomadism and wandering. It is an exercise in engineering and editing, as we will bring only what we can carry and use found objects alongside intuitive building techniques to customize each show based on the site and resources. Through song and performance a story will emerge using brief moments and disparate events. It is a fracturing of the linear tale, wherein the parts accumulate one by one to create an overall sense and environment rather than a concrete narrative. The music in the show is written as our musical duo, The Hawk is a Lonely Hunter.


The Impact

Concurrently, we are leading a workshop at Funen Academy of Fine Arts in Odense, Denmark, called Nomad as Art. In the workshop, students will be asked to make a formal or functional artwork that explores the history and ideology of nomadism. We will bookend our tour with our workshop in Denmark, so that we will meet with students before we perform and then after all of our traveling and performances. We love that we will be doing what we are teaching and aim to "report back" to the students, and speak of our own experiences on the road. It would be wonderful to have footage of the different environments and contexts that we experience to share.


We also plan to undertake a US tour, through this project we will learn valuable tools and lessons for planning that tour. It will also enable us to promote that tour through documentation of our past experience.


What We Need & What You Get

Three quarters of this money will go to a video camera and a tripod to document our tour. We would like to record every show we do, so that we can come back and share it with our community and plan our next tour (see above). With the remaining quarter of the money, we will purchase public transportation tickets, cab rides to and from airports (we are carrying a big suitcase), and electrical conversion devices for each country. We are offering different perks to those that can offer donations. Our own handmade soap and postcards from the road. Also, we are working with a friend, Laura Fisk, to make screen-printed posters. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We are booking venues in all of those countries until the last moment- we are hoping to perform as many times and at as many different types of venues as possible. We are open to music spaces, galleries, people's homes, bars, seaside docks, hot air balloons, and inside various large animal's stomachs. If you know of something, please get in touch!

story:
"Find your voice," they tell me. What they're not prepared to hear is that I have found my voice. It's just covered in blood and broken teeth.

My life had a bleak outlook from the beginning. Endless piles of garbage. Old food encrusted on plates, harboring colonies of flies. Cockroaches. More cockroaches. Suicide. Heroin overdoses. Incest. More suicide. Just to scratch the surface.

I've told these stories to friends, psychiatrists, and suicide prevention people, and their response is the same.

"You should write a book."

Therein lies the objective of this campaign. Psychoanalysis (Session 1), an image compilation book, was my first literary "self-help" experiment. The project turned out beautifully, but having to personally fund its publication, production output was minimal and expensive. My next volume, Psychoanalysis, Session 2, will expand my autobiographical endeavors in the same vein as its predecessor. This time around, however, I am furthering the scope of the project. That is where I need your help.

The campaign goal is $1000. I will continue printing copies of my first and second volumes whether that figure is met or not, but in the event of the former, production will be much less expensive and the outreach will be magnified.

It is important to note that this isn't an aim for personal profit, but a chance to channel anguish into raw creation, catharsis, and healing, and for others to identify with those same experiences. If you or someone you know has battled the throes of depression or self-harm, you know how imperative it is to find your voice--however seemingly tarnished--and to just create.

In support of this notion, a $10 donation will enable me to send you a Psychoanalysis volume of your choosing. A $20 donation allows me to send you both. Of course, every contribution, great and small, is highly appreciated. Understandably, a passionate person may be tight on funds. If a donation just isn't feasible right now, you can still be a tremendous help to this project by using the Indiegogo share tools.

However sizeable this campaign's success, there will be more projects to come. There will be a Confessions book, which can be summed up by all those times you think to yourself, "(*INSERT EXPLATIVE*), did I really just (*INSERT EXPLATIVE*)?!" Additionally, I will be working with a non-profit, wherein there will be a variety of campaigns to fund projects like the Psychoanalysis books, and much more. I encourage you to stay posted for these ventures, as your contribution and awareness help the visions come to fruition.

Not everyone wants to hear the song I sing. I get that. To those who do, here it is.


UPDATES:

12/12/14 - There is a little typo in the "Both Sessions plus Extra" Perk... This is actually an 8.5in by 11in paperback... Not 8.5in. by 8.5in.

- I am adding a $1 "Thank you!" Perk. (this will go to all of the FIVERR people who want to "Help" me with my campaign.

story:
For many years I have staved off the tattoo bug by sheer lack of funds; at this point, I have about 13 or 14 ideas in mind, ranging in size and significance. Welp, for Christmas and my Birthday (I mean, the two have always already been lumped together anyway, so lets go ahead and hit two birds with one stone, here) I have decided to dream big, and therefore I created this campaign to pool "donations" (gifts) to fund a large upper arm piece. It will be a totem pole of my four spirit animals (which, incidentally, all happen to be birds: the owl, the pheonix, the swan and the golden crowned night heron) and will serve to remind /empower me to continue my personal growth and development by embodying the strong characteristics/traits associated with each bird:

the owl obviously highlights my insatiable hunger for knowledge; 

the Phoenix represents the baptism by fire I went through to become the person I am; 

the swan, monogamous by nature, symbolizes my need for commitment, loyalty and fidelity; 

and the ever-so-patient golden crowned night heron reminds me to never force opportunities, but wait for them with eyes alert and heart open. Also naturally monogamous, heron's are noted for their lack of gender specific duties and 50/50 cooperation with their partners from nest building to peep rearing; meanwhile, they still hunt alone, a quality that reminds me to retain my individual identity and for my partner to retain theirs, even though we are 100% in the relationship together, giving equally in all pursuits. Nice, huh? Yep. They seem to have figured it out ;-)

Lastly, the totem pole is an homage to the heritage of my American Indian ancestors and relatives. 

So there you have it (if you are in fact still reading at this point). I can't think of a better way to enter my thirties than a tattoo to symbolize all I've learned and how much more I can grow as a person.

Thanks for your time and consideration, and if you are able to gift anything, I thank you very very sincerely from my heart!!
story_txt: For many years I have staved off the tattoo bug by sheer lack of funds; at this point, I have about 13 or 14 ideas in mind, ranging in size and significance. Welp, for Christmas and my Birthday (I mean, the two have always already been lumped together anyway, so lets go ahead and hit two birds with one stone, here) I have decided to dream big, and therefore I created this campaign to pool "donations" (gifts) to fund a large upper arm piece. It will be a totem pole of my four spirit animals (which, incidentally, all happen to be birds: the owl, the pheonix, the swan and the golden crowned night heron) and will serve to remind /empower me to continue my personal growth and development by embodying the strong characteristics/traits associated with each bird:the owl obviously highlights my insatiable hunger for knowledge; the Phoenix represents the baptism by fire I went through to become the person I am; the swan, monogamous by nature, symbolizes my need for commitment, loyalty and fidelity; and the ever-so-patient golden crowned night heron reminds me to never force opportunities, but wait for them with eyes alert and heart open. Also naturally monogamous, heron's are noted for their lack of gender specific duties and 50/50 cooperation with their partners from nest building to peep rearing; meanwhile, they still hunt alone, a quality that reminds me to retain my individual identity and for my partner to retain theirs, even though we are 100% in the relationship together, giving equally in all pursuits. Nice, huh? Yep. They seem to have figured it out ;-)Lastly, the totem pole is an homage to the heritage of my American Indian ancestors and relatives. So there you have it (if you are in fact still reading at this point). I can't think of a better way to enter my thirties than a tattoo to symbolize all I've learned and how much more I can grow as a person.Thanks for your time and consideration, and if you are able to gift anything, I thank you very very sincerely from my heart!!

story:
ENSURE THAT YOU READ THE IMPORTANT INFORMATION SECTION AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE BEFORE DONATING


If anyone has problems making a payment, contact: shapedesigns@hotmail.com

Welcome to my Indiegogo Page!

My name is Louis Dodd and I'm a composer and artist from the UK. Since 2011 I have worked on over 40 short films, episodes and games for companies such as the BBC, as well as companies based in the UK, USA, Bermuda, Bulgaria, Serbia and Istanbul. I have set up this campaign to help me fund my time studying Composition for Film and Television at the National FIlm and Television School. As I have always loved art, I decided to make some designs which would be printed and sold as posters, T-Shirts, Hoodies and Sweatshirts. The designs available are of Walter White (Breaking Bad), Dexter, Nucky Thompson (Boardwalk Empire) and Daenerys Targaryen (Game of Thrones). 
I wanted to do something a bit different and interesting, so I made the portraits on Photoshop and they are made entirely out of triangles. Each triangle was individually drawn and coloured, and each portrait took around 2-3 days to complete.

Recently, after over 6 months of interviews and applications, I was accepted into the prestigious National Film and Television School based in Beaconsfield. This was recently voted the World's best Film School, and as you can imagine is an absolutely incredible opportunity for anyone. I was so happy to find out I had been offered a place, and was lucky enough to find funding to pay half of my fees and shall be taking out a loan for the other half (which is really not cheap at all!). Although all of this has worked out well so far, I am still in need of money to actually move 200 miles away from home and live in a new town for the next two years. Of course, I will be looking for work as soon as I start the course but this campaign is to help me get started by funding a couple of months' rent and bills whilst I look for a part time job. 

The professional advantages of studying at this school are tremendous, with many of its students going on to win Oscars, BAFTAs and work on some of the biggest blockbusters out there! Not only do the students do well, but most of the staff are active in the film industry right now, so the teaching doesn't get much better. Being able to attend this school would be life changing, however without the funds to get started this may not be possible. 

So, what exactly would I be using your money for?


Well, as I said above I'm looking to use the money from this campaign to fund a couple of months of rent and bills when I move from Liverpool to Beaconsfield in January 2015. I have been looking at property renting prices for several weeks now, and £500 per month is pretty much standard (which is almost double what I paid for my last flat) so already this is a big financial blow!
After looking at my past financial outgoings, I figured that I can probably cover utility bills and food for about £250 per month, which is cutting it pretty fine, but is more than manageable (4 years of being a student teaches you how to be poor :P).
The third and final financial problem is that almost every property that I have looked at is unfurnished, meaning I'm going to have to buy a bed, a desk and chair, some kitchen utensils etc. This is likely to come to almost £500 after actually getting all of my stuff to Beaconsfield.
So just to break that down for anyone who fell asleep whilst reading (I need to stop ranting!)
Rent - £500 per month
Bills/Food - £250 per month
Furniture - £500
Total of first two months - £2000

Enough of the boring stuff, what do YOU get?


Well, I have created quite a large variety of perks which I am hoping you will like! All 4 portrait designs are available on T-shirts, Hoodies, Sweatshirts and even as prints in 3 different sizes! Perks are offered for contributions of £5 and upwards, however anything donated is greatly appreciated :).
I have tried to keep the prices as reasonable as possible, taking into account the cost of buying merchandise, printing and postage. Remember these designs are completely unique and cannot be purchased anywhere else. Treat yourself or someone you know to an early Christmas present - you know you deserve it! 

What are the risks?


To be completely honest, none! If you like the designs and would like to have it as a print or to wear, then you'll be getting a quality product and donating to what I think is a very good and honest cause. All money raised is reserved purely to pay for amenities, not for personal enjoyment, and I thank anyone who is kind enough to help out in anyway that they can!

Can't contribute?


That's fine! I'm grateful that you looked at my page and if you would like to help, but can't donate, then sharing this page would help me massively. The more people who see it, the better!
So, that's basically it! If you have read this far, thank you so much for taking the time out to do so, and to any one who donates or shares the page a massive thank you and I hope you like your rewards!
Below are examples of my products. At the very bottom of this page is a size guide and important information about the designs which I highly recommend reading before purchasing, as unfortunately some designs aren't available in certain colours. 

ORDER BY 12TH DECEMBER GUARANTEES DELIVERY IN TIME FOR CHRISTMAS!


ENSURE THAT YOU READ THE IMPORTANT INFORMATION SECTION AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE BEFORE DONATING




Men's T Shirts





Women's T-Shirts





Hoodies





Sweatshirts





Here is a list of colour choices for T-Shirts, Hoodies and Sweatshirts for each portrait:


Walter White - Grey, White
Dexter - Grey, White, Black
Nucky Thompson - Grey, White
Daenerys Targaryen - Grey, White, Black

IMPORTANT INFORMATION BELOW, READ BEFORE DONATING


 PLEASE MAKE SURE AFTER YOU DONATE THAT YOU EMAIL YOUR:
NAME
SHIPPING ADDRESS
PERK CHOICE/CHOICES
PORTRAIT CHARACTER
GARMENT COLOUR
SIZE
to shapedesigns@hotmail.com
IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THIS INFORMATION IS PROVIDED TO ENSURE THAT YOUR ORDER IS SUCCESSFULLY FULFILLED.
