story:
*****UPDATE 5/13/16*****

We are officially 2 weeks from Dragon Burn!  We hope everybody is excited as we definitely are.  We have sold out tickets so we hope all of you have gotten your ticket and transportation handled.

We just previously conducted a site visit to finalize the layout of the campgrounds and attractions.  Though the site has changed since our last visit, we are optimistic we can make the event even better and this includes adding another soundstage.

The effigy test build was a complete success!  We decided to add more set pieces to further accentuate the effigy and we hope to make it as interact-able as possible for all the event-goers.

Unfortunately, all of this will cost more money, but we think it’s in everyone’s best interest and will certainly add to the experience of Dragon Burn.

We are gathering all the most-up-to-date information from the artists and performers so we can ensure the event goes as smoothly and engaging as planned.


*****UPDATE 4/25/16*****

We are well underway in the planning process and we have great news to share.  We opened this year will several meet-ups regarding art and at the end, we received over 70 total proposals regarding – but not limited to – installations, performances, workshops, and theme camps.

All of these applications came from returning participants as well as newcomers so we are very excited about that.  We are carefully deliberating which ones take precedence, but we are attempting to make all of them materialize at Dragon Burn 2016.  Ideas are still pouring in so please, if you’re interested, send us your ideas through our Survey Monkey (link provided at the bottom of this section).

The effigy has been designed, has been transferred onto a CNC file, and we have finalized the contract to begin cutting.  Our test build is scheduled the morning of May 2nd and we hope to iron out any kinks along the way so that everything is exactly-as-intended when it’s time for the event.  This allows us to do a site visit on May 7th to finalize site layouts and placements.

Important Dates – Please let us know if you’re interested in participating or volunteering!

April 28th – Burner Monologues

May 7th – Site Visit – Layout & Placement

May 8th – Effigy Test Build

May 14th – The Mansion – Pool Party & Fundraiser

May 21st – Cambio Coffee – Fundraiser



***DRAGON BURN 2016 ***

Drawing from the 10 principles and influenced by the artistic culture of Burning Man, Dragon Burn is an event where we celebrate art, music, performances, workshops and other imaginative creative outlets in a safe environment where you can be yourself!  Dragon Burn is scheduled to take place May 27-29, 2016.

This campaign is to help fund various art pieces, workshops, and transportation necessary to make Dragon Burn 2016 a reality.  We will need to allocate appropriate funds to workshop collaborators, buy building materials, and transport these pieces to the event site in Anji Forest, Zhejiang Province, China.

****ART PROJECTS: YOUR PERSONAL CONTRIBUTION**** 

In 2016, we have decided to bring a radical idea to Dragon Burn – make admission ticket cheaper and then ask the attendees to become patrons of the artists participating in this year’s Dragon Burn.  This opportunity will allow people and event goers to fund a project they are most interested in.  So far we have these projects committed:

A Full Roller Disco

Tinsel Town 2.0

The Christmas Bar Project

The Garden of Eden

Shanghai's Most Premier Body Paint Artist

The Shalanaya Experience

****BETTER EXPERIENCES****

By choosing which art you would like to contribute to, not only will your experience at Dragon burn be more fulfilling, but you will also be able to make a great connection with an artist you may not have been able to contact before. You will also have a common bond with fellow attendees by discussing which projects were your favorite and perhaps brainstorming ideas for the future.

****WE"RE CRAZY, WE KNOW IT, WE'RE COUNTING ON YOU****

We are aware that this concept is much more different that any other event that you may have been to, but we continue to push the boundaries to give YOU, the participant of Dragon Burn, more of an opportunity to love the event and feel like a contributing member as opposed to just an on-looker or spectator.  Burning Man proves every year that crowd funding is the best way to get the art you love to the burn, and now, we think it's time for you to get that wonderful experience. 

****EFFIGY****

This year’s effigy was designed by Nick Li.  Nick is working as a product engineer and he is currently based in Shanghai, China.  The effigy will be a 3.6m long dragon that will stand a little over 2m tall at its highest point from the ground.  The dragon will be made of wood that will use dado cuts to interlock the pieces together, and if necessary, glue will be used to further solidify the structure.

We plan to do a test build as soon as possible before the event.  The effigy team is currently planning to build the structure into large sections, and then store the sections until the week of the event.  The pieces along with other artwork will be loaded onto a truck and then transported to the site the week of the event.

Potential Problems: Though ultimately hook screws and cables might not be necessary, we are preparing that the dragon may not be stable enough on the uneven floor at the venue site.  We are thinking of making a base or fastening it down with cables.  We are currently working out these issues.

Your contributions mainly go towards:

-Materials (wood, glue, hook screws, and cables/wires)

-CNC Mill Fabrication

-Storage

-Transport

Don't forget to submit your own art project or workshop or volunteer application!

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DragonBurnArts

Tickets for Dragon Burn are on Sale now: 

https://247tickets.cn/tickets/dragon-burn-2016

story:
Hi, I'm Madow Tsai. I am an animator, designer, and toy lover. But whatI love to do most is make my own digital paintings and figures, which you can find on my website, madowdesign.com

The Red Helmet is my first sketch collection book. This title is adopted from my favorite character, Wodam. In 2006, Wodam started to show me his world, and he has done more than simply accompany me through my journey as an artist. He has given me the dream to be a toy designer, illustrator, and animator.



The book will feature images of my art, particularly my sketches from my imagination. All the work in this book was inspired by my love for toys. You can see the characters and elements from Wodam’s story and my life, and I have built a world of cars, weapons, and robots with my experience in Industrial design.



I hope that you will find it inspiring, insightful, and most importantly, enjoyable to read through and explore page by page! And I hope that you consider helping me to bring this book to life. 



Tier 1. 1 signed copy of the book

Tier 2. 1 signed copy of the book + 2 War of horn postcard

Tier 3. 1 signed copy of the book + 4 character postcards

Tier 4. 1 signed copy of the book + 8 pack of War of horn stickers

Tier 5. 1 signed copy of the book + 1 canvas print of book cover

Tier 6. 1 signed copy of the book + 4 character postcards + 1 little red helmet

Tier 9000. 1 signed copy of the book + 4 character postcards + 1 Wodam figure 





The 2-War of horn postcard:The set is including 2 piece of postcards(210x115mm). One is Madow's graphic collection and another is Characters from War of Horn.


The 4-character postcards: The set is including 4 piece of postcards(148x105mm). It's special for this campaign.


The War of horn stickers: This pack is including 8 piece stickers and they are PVC material, double-side printing, waterproof, tear resistant, no glue residue not easily fade, anti-UV.


The little red helmet: Funders will receive a little helmet around 50x50x50mm and it will represent as Wodam's helmet.



The Wodam figure: The Wodam figure is still in process now, and It will be done November,2015. All of you can see the process on my instagram  later on. I will also make the mold, cast it, and painting it. The funders can decide the original colored figure or special black edition.

story:
REVIEWS

The Jerx: http://www.thejerx.com/blog/2016/12/16/your-eyes-are-like-starlight-now

Ning Thing: http://ningthing.com/review-butterfly-playing-cards-ondrej-psenicka/

Magic Orthodoxy: http://magicorthodoxy.weebly.com/magic-reviews/butterfly-playing-cards

MAGIC FEATURES

The unique marking system hidden in the back-design of The Butterfly Playing Cards contains two different marking systems that can be used separately, but they will make you a miracle worker if they are combined. Here are some basic effects you can accomplish using The Butterfly Playing Cards:

IMPOSSIBLE DIVINATION

The cards are shuffled by a spectator and the spectator selects one without you looking. The card is retrieved and the cards are immediately shuffled by the spectator. All without you looking. You take the cards back and without looking at the faces or spreading the cards in any way, you know instantly what card it was.

KNOWING THE MISSING CARD

The cards are shuffled by a spectator, taken behind their back, they take one from anywhere in the deck and hide it in their back pocket. Nobody, including the spectator, knows the identity of the card. They shuffle the cards again and give them back to you. You'll know the identity of the card in seconds without looking at the faces of the cards or spreading the deck in any way.

CUTTING TO ANY CARD CALLED FOR

The cards are shuffled by a spectator. They name any card they want and you are able to cut to that card without spreading the cards in any way.

AND MANY MORE...

Imagine being able to perform feats only possible using a memorized deck, but with a shuffled deck of cards. The Butterfly Playing Cards enable you to see the positions of all the cards in a shuffled deck.

I developed the system for my own professional use.
It is simple, logical, fast to read and easy to learn.

I can't wait until magicians all over the world get their own Butterfly Playing Cards, begin exploring their capabilities and start coming up with new ways to use them.

STRETCH GOALS

300% RED - UNLOCKED!!!

Every backer will be getting a BackerKit survey in early January, where you’ll be able to specify how many BLUE decks and how many RED decks you want.

325% INTERIOR BOX DESIGN - UNLOCKED!!!

There will be a butterfly pattern all over the interior of the tuck case.

 
350% UNMARKED BUTTERFLY PLAYING CARDS - UNLOCKED!!!

We will also print the exact same decks - only with no markings.

  • An unmarked deck gets very handy for that one spectator who is determined to find anything sneaky about the cards at all costs. If you switch the marked deck for the unmarked one, he doesn’t stand a chance.
  • You can also take any card from the marked deck and put it in the unmarked deck as an ultimate key card. Combining these two decks opens a new door to another room full of possibilities.
  • You can play card games with these. Or it is more fair to play card games with these.
  • You can give them to a non-magician friend as a gift.

The unmarked decks will be available in both red and blue and you'll be able to choose them through BackerKit. Every backer will be getting a BackerKit survey in early January, where you’ll be able to specify how many unmarked BLUE decks and how many unmarked RED decks you want.

 

 

THE SECRET OF THE BUTTERFLIES
book and e-book

Every pledge comes with a link to an online document describing the marking system and the way it works. You will be able to perform the effects presented on the videos once you understand the system.

The Secret of The Butterflies book includes deep analysis of the effects and describes alternative handlings. There is a chapter on the history of the marking principles, additional routines, tips on spectator management and more.

 

DESIGN

The cards were designed with two main goals in mind.

  1. They have to be complex and irregular enough to disguise the markings.
  2. They have to be pretty enough to justify their use over a more common deck of playing cards.

I sent the concept of butterflies on a floral pattern to my friend Stefan Eriksson. Stefan is a designer and a brilliant magician whom I met at the Stockholm University of Dance and Circus, where we both studied magic.

We have made two different custom jokers and the ace of spades that are true to the overall theme of the back design. The rest of the deck has standard US faces as it is primarily intended for magic.

QUALITY

The overall quality of the finished product is my highest priority so I talked to the major manufacturers of custom playing cards to find out which one can offer the best quality paper-stock, the best quality control and has the most forward thinking attitude.

Cartamundi has it all under the roof of their mother factory in Turnhout, Belgium.

Their new card stock is soft, the finishing feels amazing, and it is very durable. And their quality control is so strict, that any deck containing even a single card that is off-cut for more than 0,5 mm gets discarded.

I visited the factory twice in the past year. The first time was to learn about their technology, production process and creative options. The second time was to negotiate, clarify and approve the digitally printed Butterfly Playing Cards Prototypes and I can't wait to come back for the third time to personally supervise the off-set production.

ESTIMATED TIMELINE

January 2017 - pre-press and beginning of the six week production period

February 2017 - finishing production

March 2017 - shipping to US fulfilment center plus time cushion for delays

April 2017 - fulfilment

WHAT OUR WHO'S WHO HAS TO SAY ABOUT THE BUTTERFLY PLAYING CARDS

Chris Kenner - This is a game changer.

Daryl - This is the most ingeniously designed marked deck I have ever seen in my life! You can do miracles with this pack that can not be performed with any other deck of marked cards. Wonderful... absolutely wonderful!

Doug McKenzie - So damn clever ... these butterflies are going to fly off the shelves literally.

Héctor Mancha - I  hate you for coming up with this.

Michael Ammar - A Beautiful, Brilliant Design.

Daniel Garcia - Such a good addition to a road less traveled... GREAT JOB!.

Jeremy Griffith - Easily one of the most creative and useful designs I've ever seen on a pack of playing cards.

Johan Ståhl - Congratulations to all card workers around the world. A new era has begun. 

Howard Hamburg - I only wish The Professor was alive to have seen this. He would've called it a masterpiece.

Asi Wind - There are many new beautiful playing cards designs. However this design will blow your mind. I can't wait to explore the endless possibilities.

Harapan Santoso Ong - This deck is too good to be true.
story_txt:
REVIEWSThe Jerx: http://www.thejerx.com/blog/2016/12/16/your-eyes-are-like-starlight-nowNing Thing: http://ningthing.com/review-butterfly-playing-cards-ondrej-psenicka/Magic Orthodoxy: http://magicorthodoxy.weebly.com/magic-reviews/butterfly-playing-cardsMAGIC FEATURESThe unique marking system hidden in the back-design of The Butterfly Playing Cards contains two different marking systems that can be used separately, but they will make you a miracle worker if they are combined. Here are some basic effects you can accomplish using The Butterfly Playing Cards:IMPOSSIBLE DIVINATIONThe cards are shuffled by a spectator and the spectator selects one without you looking. The card is retrieved and the cards are immediately shuffled by the spectator. All without you looking. You take the cards back and without looking at the faces or spreading the cards in any way, you know instantly what card it was.KNOWING THE MISSING CARDThe cards are shuffled by a spectator, taken behind their back, they take one from anywhere in the deck and hide it in their back pocket. Nobody, including the spectator, knows the identity of the card. They shuffle the cards again and give them back to you. You'll know the identity of the card in seconds without looking at the faces of the cards or spreading the deck in any way.CUTTING TO ANY CARD CALLED FORThe cards are shuffled by a spectator. They name any card they want and you are able to cut to that card without spreading the cards in any way.AND MANY MORE...Imagine being able to perform feats only possible using a memorized deck, but with a shuffled deck of cards. The Butterfly Playing Cards enable you to see the positions of all the cards in a shuffled deck.I developed the system for my own professional use.It is simple, logical, fast to read and easy to learn.I can't wait until magicians all over the world get their own Butterfly Playing Cards, begin exploring their capabilities and start coming up with new ways to use them.STRETCH GOALS300% RED - UNLOCKED!!!Every backer will be getting a BackerKit survey in early January, where you’ll be able to specify how many BLUE decks and how many RED decks you want.325% INTERIOR BOX DESIGN - UNLOCKED!!!There will be a butterfly pattern all over the interior of the tuck case. 350% UNMARKED BUTTERFLY PLAYING CARDS - UNLOCKED!!!

story:
Short Summary

No La Tengo is a film production group made up of 15 and 16 year olds. Based out of Montclair, NJ, the six friends making up the group have made two films, both recieving awards at the Montclair Film Festival. 

What We Need 

We will need a minimum of 500 dollars to buy everything for this film. We need a microphone, and lights. 

The Impact

This is our first feature film, and we want it to stand out! We are all passionate and commited to creating the best film we can make. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends!

story:
My name is Robbie Jackson, I am a 19 year old photographer from Liverpool UK.

I have been a photographer for the last six years and I have been studying photography for the last three at college, this year is my last year in college and since its my last year in college I will be taking part in an end of year exhibition.

This exhibition is my chance to show off my work, gain clientele and have something to show for the last three years besides my qualification. 

For this project I have gone with the theme of Dia De Los Muertos which is the Mexican day of the dead. The style of face paint and celebrations have interested me for a while from an art point of view, such as sugar skull designs and pop art style posters. I have taken a series of square format portraits under studio lights, I have nine images making a 3x3 wall display. 

Having this project printed, framed and exhibited would be the perfect way for me to end the three years I have studied at my college, it would prove to both myself, my friends, teachers and who ever else sees it how far I have come over the last three years.      

What I Am Asking For

For this Project I am looking to raise £500, this will pay for the photos to be printed with a metallic finish which is a very professional form of photographic printing which will allow my images to look every bit as good as they can.

This will also pay for me to get custom wooden frames made for my the exhibition as well as having those frames fitted with glass,  I am hoping to have this done by a local artist and a local joiner, in doing so I am hoping to advertise their work as well as mine in an effort to provide some support for the local artists in my community. they have helped me out before and have been very generous and I would like to pay back their kindness.


At the end of the day all I want is to see my work exhibited in the best way possible with the best presentation, I want to impress people I want people to take notice of my photography and I want to succeed in making this project fufill its whole potential.

any amount of funding will be a good amount of funding and help me towards making this idea  come to life.


thanks to all in advance for any help, it really is appreciated :)


Robbie Jackson :)

story:
This is my cousin Anna's little girl Lauren.

Lauren is just 14. She's been poorly for a long time. It took the doctors a while to find out what was wrong with her but after many hospital visits and even more tests, they discovered that she has a condition called gastroparesis. This means that her tummy can't empty food properly so Lauren has to be fed from a tube through her nose. 

She is on this tube 24/7 and gets tired very quickly. She also feels sick and is in pain all the time. She can't do the normal things that teenagers like to do.

We are asking for your help and support.

There is an operation that would mean that Lauren could lead a normal life but the NHS are refusing to fund it. With a gastric pacemaker fitted into her tummy Lauren could lead a relatively normal life. We are trying to raise money for this operation.

When I told some of my creative friends about the situation, they offered to donate works of art so that we could hold an on-line raffle to help raise some funds for Lauren's operation. I am lucky enough to know some very talented artists and makers - these are some of the top contemporary designer makers in the UK,  so there are some amazing prizes to be won; from sculptures to stunning handmade jewellery, ceramics, contemporary prints and textiles. Click on the gallery tab above Lauren's photo to see more information on the artists and prizes. You can also click here.

All you have to do is make a donation - is doesn't matter how big or small, just donate what you can - and you will be automatically entered into the prize draw and could bag yourself a lovely piece of contemporary craft and know that you have helped a little girl live a normal life.

We need to raise a total of £30,000. The family are busy raising money too - here's a link to their fundraising page

Your help is very much appreciated.  Please, if you can, share this campaign with your friends.

story:
Sponsoring the participation at an art fair

I am a Berlin based painter interested in showing my art work to a broader audience. I want to participate on an art fair in Berlin September 2014, called „BERLINER LISTE“. This art fair allows you directly as an artist to show your work, meanwhile most other art fairs are restricted to galleries. However art fairs are most important to make a contact to galleries, potential buyer and collectors, as I did successfull in 2011 at the same art fair.

Art Fairs are expensive

Cost example for a booth of 10 sqm

Rent 1.250,00 €
Catalogue publication 1 page 185,00 €
Marketing fee 340,00 €
Electricity 130 €
Additional light bulb 75 €

Total inclucing 19% Taxes: 2356,20 €


Cost example for a booth of 30 sqm

Rent 3.750,00 €
Catalogue publication 1 page 185,00 €
Marketing fee 960,00 €
Electricity 130 €
Additional light bulb 75 €

Total inclucing 19% Taxes: 6092,80 €

Additional costs for framing, advertising media.
aproximately: 1000 €


I will try to raise 7500 € the money for a 30sqm booth plus additional expenses, the size I had 2011. Then I can show my big paintings 200 x 150 cm. If less money comes in, I will rent a 10 sqm booth and show smaller art work.

For a discout of 50% I will sell my art work for a limited period till may 19th, the end of the campaign! Find a selction of my art work as perks below.


Perks (Will continuously add art work)

25 € :
Get a art catalog about my work with a selection of 14 full size color plates


......................................................................................................................................

"Meer 5"– catalog price 500 € – 50% off – Buy for 250 €
Aquarell // water color, 24 x 17 cm, 2011 (framed)
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Insel Mainau" – catalog price 500 € – 50% off – Buy for 250 €
Aquarell // water color, 24 x 17 cm, 2011 (framed)
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Blume 4"– catalog price 1.400 € – 50% off – Buy for 700 €
Oil on canvas, 30 x 30 cm, 2010
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Blume 3"– catalog price 1.400 € – 50% off – Buy for 700 €
Oil on canvas, 30 x 30 cm, 2010
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Cap Ferat"– catalog price 2.100 € – 50% off –Buy for 1.050 € (sold)
Oil on canvas, 120 x 100 cm, 2013/2014
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.



......................................................................................................................................

"An der Loup 2"– catalog price 2.100 € – 50% off – Buy for 1.050 €
Oil on canvas, 50 x 40 cm, 2013/2014
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.



......................................................................................................................................

"Villeneuve-Loubet 1" – catalog price 4.400 € – 50% off – Buy for 2.200 €
oil on canvas, 100 x 80 cm, 2011
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Villeneuve-Loubet 3" – catalog price 4.400 € – 50% off – Buy for 2.200 €
oil on canvas, 100 x 80 cm, 2012/2014
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Tiergarten 5" – catalog price 5.200 € – 50% off – Buy for 2.600 €
Oil on canvas, 120 x 100 cm
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Tiergarten 7” – catalog price 5.200 € – 50% off – Buy for 2.600 €
Oil on canvas, 120 x 100 cm, 2012/2014
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


....................................................................................................................................

"Litzelstetten 2"– catalog price 8000 € – 50% off – Buy for 4000 €
Oil on canvas, 200 x 150 cm, 2013
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


......................................................................................................................................

"Tiergarten 18"– catalog price 8000 € – 50% off – Buy for 4000 €
Oil on canvas, 200 x 150 cm, 2014
Special offer only till may 19th.
A higher resolution picture at  www.harmanus.de or contact me.


.....................................................................................................................................

Why should you sponsor me?


If you like my art work and feel, that it is worth to support my next steps of making me more known to the art world and providing me with a great platform to sell my paintings, then you should sponsor me.  I started as a painter in 1991, when I was at the beginning of my twenties. In my thirties I thought art is not that important and stopped – stupid I. In 2008 I began to paint again. Since then I have found a surprising new world of colorful "landscapes“, which seemed as if they had just been waiting to be born. Since then many people have appreciated my art work and encouraged me to go on.

Please check out my website www.Harmanus.de and make your choice, if this is something to follow and support. 

Yours Stephan

story:
A MULTI FACETED TRAVELING INSTALLATION

The Little House represents the comfort, communication and interactivity that we have within ourselves and our surroundings. This installation is a homage to understanding that love and oneness come from within, a place to dive into different perspectives of our environments. It's an endeavor seeking to aid and raise the vibration in our hearts. We wish for all to see the light that shines within. 

Home is where the heart is. Access the home within you. 

PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION

external vs. internal reflection

A 20x24 foot cabin-like structure covered in mirrors. The reflective surface enables viewers to immerse themselves within the reflections and achieve a feeling of one with the vicinity. The exterior will have 4 enclosed installations that can be viewed through peepholes. Imagine miniature dioramas, kinetic scriptures, and an array of emotion evoking visuals. At night this mirrored vision transforms through warm illumination. From a distance expect to see an inviting gleam of light, upon contact find your reflection glowing with an amber luminescence.

Upon further exploration you will find an inconspicuous tunnel that runs below the house. Explore its inner depths to experience what we call a vessel of ascension. This will be presented in an enclosed circular room which is designed to aid the rise of frequency. This room will be equipped with 8 stations that will emit binaural sound beats. Other features include a crystal lit shrine, a mixed media sculpture of an anatomical heart and kaleidoscopic mirrored wall treatment.

PHILOSOPHY

comfort from home comes from within

The word home embodies safety, a place of belonging, a bubble where our domestic affections are meant to be centered. From early childhood onwards we are continuously looking for this wholeness within the home. In a society like today's, most of these impressions are mere illusions; shattered notions that have been embedded by past generations, visual stimulation and a longing for connection. The Little House quenches this longing through connection with oneself, confirming that comfort from home comes from within. The Little House is a window into the multiple perspectives we have of our own selves. A way to connect with every view of you. A way to understand that home and wholeness come from within. 

DESTINATIONS

Los Angeles, CA

Black Rock City, NV

New York, NY

Chicago, IL

Miami Beach, FL

Marfa, TX

Coachella Valley, CA

Big Sur, CA


SUPPORT

help us bring The Little House to life

There are high costs using the materials that are needed and building a structure of such scale. Having said that the budget will be transparent.  Funding will be going directly towards building materials, fabrication costs, equipment rentals, and transport fees. There are no artist fees included in the budget. 



HOW MUCH MONEY DO WE NEED? HOW DO WE PLAN ON SPENDING IT? 

Structure $16,750 

Interior & Finishes $8,750 

Illumination $5,950 

Power & Crating $12,700 

Transport Costs $9,200

Campaign Fees $5,350

Estimated Costs: $58,700

Other Ways You Can Help

Pass this campaign along to your network. Help us bring this to life!

We are looking for other means of support. Sponsors, collaborators, people that want to get their hands dirty…

Want to get involved? Drop us a line at..

WelcometoTheLittleHouse(at)gmail(dot)com
story_txt:

The Little House represents the comfort, communication and interactivity that we have within ourselves and our surroundings. This installation is a homage to understanding that love and oneness come from within, a place to dive into different perspectives of our environments. It's an endeavor seeking to aid and raise the vibration in our hearts. We wish for all to see the light that shines within.

story:
Music is a community: we support one another.

When I read about the theft of Kathleen's 1957 Les Paul, it saddened me. I've never been much a musician but I love music, and respect how difficult an art this is.  Stealing someone's cherished guitar is just about as low as you can go.

Kathleen has used this guitar both locally and internationally to bring joy to so many fans. Her music has touched me deeply, and helped me through some tough times. Songs like Hockey Skates and Goodnight California make me smile every time I play them. I know I'm not alone. I don't know Kathleen personally and have never met her, but have enjoyed many of her unforgettable live shows (one at Folkfest in particular).

Now's our chance to give back, and prove to her that the music community is a strong one. If just a small percentage of her fans give $10, we'll have more than enough to get her a replacement guitar (I've checked online and they're priced in the $5,000 US range).

If her guitar is found/returned, this campaign will be closed and all funds raised up to that point will be donated instead to the Ottawa Music Foundation. Another good cause I'm sure we can all get behind.

Thanks in advance for your donations and shares.

I'm giving Kathleen the last word on this (from Oh, Canada):

Yeah, it's written in the press
That your sweet little town
Has lost its innocence

story:
Miscarriage Of Justice Foetry Book

Melissa Balin's first Foetry Book called Miscarriage Of Justice hopes to provide inspiration to those battling against injustice and oppression globally and she wants to dedicate it to YOU!

  • Melissa Balin is the niece of moviestar humanitarian Ina Balin, and a filmmaker & activist in her own right; who has collaborated with Shepard Fairey, Jack Herer, Laszlo Kovacs, ASC and even Paris Hilton!
  • Miscarriage Of Justice is Balin's first Foetry (Fotos & Poetry) Book and 100% of any profits will go to provide the much needed resources for Pro Se litigants to challenge violations of the United States constitution, as well as Injustices & Oppression on a global scale.
  • Be A Part of the Global Evolution Transforming Pain Into #aRT.

Remember, your Resources are worth MORE than your money and #SharingISCaring!

What We Need & What You Get

$250 will get the batch of ISBN Numbers needed to register the printed book, audio book, and e-book, with the Library of Congress-

Any monies raised above and beyond our Special Limited Collector's Edition Printing goal of $3333, will go towards a ten-city #TestOfTheEmergencyFreeSpeechSystem spoken word book signing tour.

  • Check Daily for unusual & unique experience-based perks like #Cupcakes4Justice with Chef Normie of Enchanted Moon Catering!
  • Follow @Balin4Mayor to find out where she will be over the next 49 days via @StayOccupied social media
  • Take the #WomenSeekingJustice Pledge & You will be inscribed forever in the Book of Life on the Righteous Side of posterity ;)

#WomenSeekingJustice #NotForJustUs #Pledge:

Take the Women Seeking Justice Pledge: #NotOnOurWatch.

  • We WON'T "just follow orders."
  • We WILL rally to stomp out Injustice & Oppression through music & song.
  • We WILL transform our personal pain into #aRT to make the world a better place than when we came upon it.

#MiscarriageOfJustice #FOETRY @stayoccupied

Remember, your Resources are worth MORE than your money:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our crowdfunding campaign for Melissa Balin's first Foetry Book, Misccariage Of Justice.  Send a tweet or shout-out via your favorite social media under the tags:  #MiscarriageOfJustice #FOETRY @stayoccupied
  • Please Share Melissa Balin's story with any local and international media you may have access to, so that her story of Injustice doesn't happen to someone like you.
  • Please use the Indiegogo #SharingISCaring tools to tell all your friends, family and fakebook friends!

#GiveThanks.

story:
We are your Winnipeg Poetry Slam Team!

  • We are Chimwemwe Undi, Steve Locke, Ulysses Knope, Steve Currie and Mike Johnston and we want to build a pillow fort for you!
  • Winnipeg Poetry Slam needs a place to stay in Victoria and, with your support, we can rent a hotel room and build within it the most boss super duper pillow fort the world has ever seen. 

Without your support, we'll have no place to build incredible pillow forts while we're in Victoria. With your support, I daresay we'll build the best poet pillow for in the WORLD. 

Our needs are simple!

We need your generosity and support! We need your dolla dolla bills, y'all so that we'll have a place to build our incredible pillow fort! We will rent out a hotel room and request an unreasonable amount of extra pillows as to be able to build a fort that will shame all others before it! What you get in return (aside from eternal gratitude and forever good karma) is knowing that you've given travelling artists a place to lay their heads and something incredible for the hotel staff to walk in on the next day.

story:
We are the Doyles. We believe in grassroots and global living!

David and Deborah Doyle and their 10 children (biological and foster) believe in connections to one another, to community, to the world. We have purchased two buildings in Western Maine, called it the ultimate recycle, and now use one as an international hostel, licensed by Hostelling International. Our hostel is close to Sunday River Ski Resort, the White Mountains, the Appalachian Trail, the Androscoggin River, many lakes, swimming holes, trails, hikes and more.

We would like to purchase local art and furniture for the hostel to inspire our visitors and to encourage our local arts community. Hostelling is a unique and authentic way to travel. People eat together, share information and travel stories, and visitors intentionally try to learn. (Hosts learn as well, I can assure you!)

Hostellers explore culture as much as they explore places. Here in rural Maine, our geography/climate is wonderful and inspiring....mountains, lakes, forests, seasons. Our people are equally as inspiring...working, farming, playing, celebrating. Connecting our international guests to our community and our community to international guests is our small way of building relationships with impact.

As we know one another, we begin to see differences as special, exciting, even essential rather than, well...just different. We believe we can spark these connections further through travel partnered with art.

Hostelling keeps travel accessible to all people even in a difficult economy. One night for one person at our hostel is $25! You cook your own food here and we all share a common area for good conversation, share our stories with a cold beer on occasion. We'd love to add local art and furniture to the experience.

What We Need & What You Get

Sara Hemeon of Elements Art Gallery, Bethel Maine, has agreed to help us with our purchases. We can start this project with just $10 and enjoy the fruits of connecting through art. If we surpass our goal we will use the funds to further beautify the hostel setting (lights, outdoor landscaping and gardens, a little paint, more paint, new flooring in the bathrooms). We love local craftsman and small businesses as much as we love our local artists!!!  At $5,000 all of our cosmetic and maintenance needs will be met.
 
We want you to know that we are willing (and that we do!) work hard to keep our vision for the hostel going. This month we spent $2,500 to upgrade our plumbing system. We hope to bring pellet stoves to the hostel this winter. We are putting this project out there because it always seems to get axed from the budget and we don't want to let it go. Philosophically, we are firm believers that both beauty for its own sake (art) and productivity (plumbing and heating) bring different yet incredible rewards to our being. Realistically, our children are always wanting to be fed three square! :) Sometimes we can only have one thing we hope for....when community comes together, we know we can have more. And so it is that our crowdfunding campaign is born.

The Impact

Real relationships are grassroots - continuing connections can be global. Imagine that one family can contribute to that effort even in a small way by introducing one traveler at a time to our neighbors, our culture and our own lives! One of the few times you can say (and really mean!) "It's all good!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Love us on FB...that means like us and then ask your friends to like us at Bethel Maine Hostel!

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it! All good!

story:
What Is the Kliptown Photography Project?

The Kliptown Photography Project is dedicated to teaching documentary photography and creating opportunities for the high school students of Kliptown, South Africa, one of the oldest informal settlements in Soweto.

We are running a photography workshop at the Kliptown Youth Program from June 30th through July 4th. We are teaching 12 high school students in Kliptown the basics of documentary photography and visual literacy. The workshop was developed by an American photographer who is teaching, along with three dynamic young African photographers. Our four photography instructors will teach the kids, as well as take their own photos, documenting the process. 

Two exhibitions of the work created by our students and instructors are planned -- one exhibition in Pittsburgh and one in Soweto. We believe it is important  that our students have the opportunity to see their own work in a gallery setting:  an exhibition of the work of the Kliptown Photo Project is scheduled to open at Mashumi Art Projects in Soweto on July 25th, 2014. 

Our second exhibition, in Pittsburgh, USA, will open in 2015; this exhibition is intended to introduce Kliptown to our own hometown.

Prints of the photographs will be for sale at both exhibition sites. This is really the culmination of our vision -- the idea that not only will our students learn skills, but will themselves be the agents of change for their community. Proceeds from the sales of photographs, both in Soweto and in Pittsburgh, will go to the Kliptown Youth Program. In this way, our students raise money for their own community, rather than accepting a philanthropic gift. 

We want to empower our students. We want our students to communicate visually through documentary photography. Our students will come away from this workshop able to use photography to become powerful voices for their community, to advocate for themselves, their families and their neighbors. We believe that learning photography is a way to foster creativity and connection. 

You can connect with them by helping us fund exhibitions of their work. 

With financial support from our donors, we have already been able to fund instructors and digital equipment which would otherwise be unavailable to the students. During the workshop, in addition to teaching basic photography skills and visual literacy, we are teaching our students how to publish their photos to blogs and websites. The cameras our donors have helped us to buy will remain with the Kliptown Youth Program so they may continue this initiative when our workshop is completed.

By helping us fund these exhibits, you will allow the students to realize the full potential of their work, both economically and as social capital. They will get to see their work in a gallery setting. And others will get a window into their world. 

You can help them generate funds for their community. 

By donating to our project you will be helping the students from a neglected and impoverished community get started on a path to creativity, entrepreneurship, and advocacy. We are teaching them skills which will help them succeed in the modern South African economy and by supporting our venture you can be part of this process.

All of us together—you as a donor, us as facilitators, the photography teachers, and the students—can all work together to develop a photography program at the Kliptown Youth Program, which will empower everyone involved and generate funds for the Youth Program. This is a small program with a big impact and your support is crucial to its success. 


What Does Your Money Pay For?

  • THE EXHIBITIONS
    Two exhibitions are planned, one in Soweto and one in Pittsburgh. We will be showing the work of our students and also, some of the work of our instructors, who will be documenting the week-long workshop. Photographs will be for sale and the proceeds from any sale will go to the Kliptown Youth Program. Your donation will defray the cost of printing and mounting these shows. We are bringing the cameras for the students to use and when our workshop is complete, the cameras will remain in Kliptown, for continued use at the Kliptown Youth Program. In this way, your money is not a one-time gift. Our greatest hope is that the project will remain sustainable under the guidance of the staff at the KYP, and we will be working with them to ensure that this happens. One aim of our project is to train students so that they can set up an on-line gallery to continue to document their lives and share their stories with the world. 


How Does This Benefit Kliptown? 

  • FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF THE KLIPTOWN YOUTH PROGRAM
    After the week-long seminar, KYP will be mounting exhibitions of the work. Prints will be available for purchase. All proceeds from the sale of photographs will go to the Kliptown Youth Program, which runs meal programs, tutoring, athletics and arts programs for the youth of Kliptown. Read more about the Kliptown Youth Program.

  • CREATIVE AND TECHNICAL SKILLS
    During our week-long seminar, our students will learn the elements of photography, not the least of which is to build a comfort level simply using otherwise unavailable digital equipment. The students will learn some fundamentals of shooting interiors, photographing portraits, and capturing social issues.

  • EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH DIGITAL CONTENT
    We will also be teaching the students how to work on online platforms, to upload photographs and create web-pages so they may continue to share their world with the rest of the world.

  • A PLATFORM FOR NEW STORYTELLERS
    One of the purposes of the Kliptown Youth Program is to eradicate poverty of the mind, body and soul. The Photo Project has taken that as our mandate, as well. Beyond learning new marketable skills, beyond sharing their world with us, beyond raising money, our greatest hope is that our students will learn to value their own stories and know that their voices matter.

Why Kliptown? 

Kliptown is one of the original areas established during the 1903 relocation process, when the ruling British minority forcibly moved African and Indian mine workers to an area outside of Johannesburg. Kliptown is part of the much larger area of Soweto, and was originally known as Klipspruit ("klipspruit" translates to "rocky river" in Afrikaans). The settlement was at that time nothing more than a squatters camp with the rocky river running through it. 

In post-apartheid South Africa, Kliptown itself has seen both major development and neglect. There have been over 1,000 units of affordable housing built near this site, yet there are also still 11 informal settlements or shantytowns in the area known as Kliptown. 

We are working in a large "informal settlement," or shantytown, which has been in place since the 1940s. The settlement lacks basic municipal services (water, sewage, electricity, etc.) and struggles with issues of air pollution, illegal dumping, and water pollution. Families live with up to four generations in small homes made from corrugated tin, cardboard and other found materials.The students must leave the settlement to go to school.

All residents must leave to obtain medical services and purchase food and goods. Despite such conditions, the community has been supported by initiatives like the Kliptown Youth Program. We hope that the Kliptown Photography Project can help foster similar support and growth. 


What If We Raise More Money Than Our Goal?

What if we exceed our goal? Well, that's a great problem to have. Very simply, any money not used to mount the exhibitions of the work goes straight to the Kliptown Youth Program. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but you want to help, let us know. You never know, we might find something for you to do. 

If you can't donate, or you can't donate much, one of the most helpful things you can do is promote this project. Put it on your Facebook account. Tweet it. Pin it. Load it on your Tumblr page. Get it out there. Please spread the word about our campaign.

We want our students to communicate visually through documentary photography. Our students will come away from this workshop able to use photography to become powerful voices for their community, to advocate for themselves, their families and their neighbors. We believe that learning photography is a way to foster creativity and connection. You can connect with them by helping us fund exhibitions of their work. With financial support from our donors, we have already been able to fund instructors and digital equipment which would otherwise be unavailable to the students. During the workshop, in addition to teaching basic photography skills and visual literacy, we are teaching our students how to publish their photos to blogs and websites. The cameras our donors have helped us to buy will remain with the Kliptown Youth Program so they may continue this initiative when our workshop is completed.By helping us fund these exhibits, you will allow the students to realize the full potential of their work, both economically and as social capital. They will get to see their work in a gallery setting. And others will get a window into their world. You can help them generate funds for their community. By donating to our project you will be helping the students from a neglected and impoverished community get started on a path to creativity, entrepreneurship, and advocacy. We are teaching them skills which will help them succeed in the modern South African economy and by supporting our venture you can be part of this process.All of us together—you as a donor, us as facilitators, the photography teachers, and the students—can all work together to develop a photography program at the Kliptown Youth Program, which will empower everyone involved and generate funds for the Youth Program. This is a small program with a big impact and your support is crucial to its success. What Does Your Money Pay For?
THE EXHIBITIONSTwo exhibitions are planned, one in Soweto and one in Pittsburgh. We will be showing the work of our students and also, some of the work of our instructors, who will be documenting the week-long workshop. Photographs will be for sale and the proceeds from any sale will go to the Kliptown Youth Program. Your donation will defray the cost of printing and mounting these shows. We are bringing the cameras for the students to use and when our workshop is complete, the cameras will remain in Kliptown, for continued use at the Kliptown Youth Program. In this way, your money is not a one-time gift. Our greatest hope is that the project will remain sustainable under the guidance of the staff at the KYP, and we will be working with them to ensure that this happens. One aim of our project is to train students so that they can set up an on-line gallery to continue to document their lives and share their stories with the world. How Does This Benefit Kliptown? 

FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF THE KLIPTOWN YOUTH PROGRAMAfter the week-long seminar, KYP will be mounting exhibitions of the work. Prints will be available for purchase. All proceeds from the sale of photographs will go to the Kliptown Youth Program, which runs meal programs, tutoring, athletics and arts programs for the youth of Kliptown. Read more about the Kliptown Youth Program.

CREATIVE AND TECHNICAL SKILLSDuring our week-long seminar, our students will learn the elements of photography, not the least of which is to build a comfort level simply using otherwise unavailable digital equipment. The students will learn some fundamentals of shooting interiors, photographing portraits, and capturing social issues.

EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH DIGITAL CONTENTWe will also be teaching the students how to work on online platforms, to upload photographs and create web-pages so they may continue to share their world with the rest of the world.

A PLATFORM FOR NEW STORYTELLERSOne of the purposes of the Kliptown Youth Program is to eradicate poverty of the mind, body and soul. The Photo Project has taken that as our mandate, as well. Beyond learning new marketable skills, beyond sharing their world with us, beyond raising money, our greatest hope is that our students will learn to value their own stories and know that their voices matter.
Why Kliptown? Kliptown is one of the original areas established during the 1903 relocation process, when the ruling British minority forcibly moved African and Indian mine workers to an area outside of Johannesburg. Kliptown is part of the much larger area of Soweto, and was originally known as Klipspruit ("klipspruit" translates to "rocky river" in Afrikaans). The settlement was at that time nothing more than a squatters camp with the rocky river running through it. In post-apartheid South Africa, Kliptown itself has seen both major development and neglect. There have been over 1,000 units of affordable housing built near this site, yet there are also still 11 informal settlements or shantytowns in the area known as Kliptown. We are working in a large "informal settlement," or shantytown, which has been in place since the 1940s. The settlement lacks basic municipal services (water, sewage, electricity, etc.) and struggles with issues of air pollution, illegal dumping, and water pollution. Families live with up to four generations in small homes made from corrugated tin, cardboard and other found materials.The students must leave the settlement to go to school.All residents must leave to obtain medical services and purchase food and goods.

Despite such conditions, the community has been supported by initiatives like the Kliptown Youth Program. We hope that the Kliptown Photography Project can help foster similar support and growth. What If We Raise More Money Than Our Goal?What if we exceed our goal? Well, that's a great problem to have. Very simply, any money not used to mount the exhibitions of the work goes straight to the Kliptown Youth Program. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate, but you want to help, let us know. You never know, we might find something for you to do. If you can't donate, or you can't donate much, one of the most helpful things you can do is promote this project. Put it on your Facebook account. Tweet it. Pin it. Load it on your Tumblr page. Get it out there. Please spread the word about our campaign.

story:
UPDATE: 1ST STRETCH GOAL - $1400

WOW! Thank you guys SO SO SO much for helping me reach my goal of $800 only 10 days after starting this campaign! Since there are 15 days left, several people suggested I make a stretch goal for the remaining time, so I've been thinking of what I really need to help me with both my collection and my career.
My next stretch goal is to raise $1,400. My grandma gave me her old sewing machine (the model itself is about 17 years old, and it seems to be a limited run model) back in my freshman year of high school, and it has served me well for the passed 8 years amicably. Unfortunately, the bobbin winder has since broken, the spool stopper is too loose (you can imagine how fun it is to have spools fly out at an alarming velocity while sewing), and it's hard to find compatible parts (specialized presser foots for different hems/zippers, needles, etc), I've been wanting to get a new home sewing machine this year, as well as investing in a home serger machine in the future, so I thought this would be the perfect goal to make. Thank you again to everyone who has contributed, liked, shared, or just wished me good luck on this venture! It really means a lot to me and I can't wait to update everyone with my progress!
 

About This Campaign

 

Hello! My name is Cassandra Soriano. I'm currently finishing up my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Fashion Design at the Art Institute of Seattle, and plan to graduate in December. In order to graduate, however, each Fashion Design major must design, draft, construct, and present a senior collection. A collection consists of anywhere between 8-12 garments total, which brings me to why I started this campaign.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Each student pays for their materials and supplies out of pocket for every single assignment. Depending on the materials chosen, a single industry-quality garment could cost $50-$100 to make (not including cost of labor), mostly more for higher quality fabric and amount of yardage the garment takes. One of the most disheartening parts about being a designer is the fear (and more often than not, reality) of not having the funds to realize one's vision, to push one's dreams and skills the farthest it can go. To pay for my assignments, along with my mom's help, I currently work two part-time jobs on top of being a full-time student. I've been fortunate enough to be able to pay for my school supplies, food, bus fare, and hobbies rather comfortably this way, but it's not enough. 

 

 

 

 

Being my senior collection, I want to take this the farthest I can go with what I've learned, so I'm reaching out to the community for help. It would mean the world to me to graduate with a strong collection that reflects the skills I developed over the past four years and the vision I've had for even longer. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Where will the money go?

    My goal is to raise $800 in 25 days. Since I'm also showing at my school's quarterly Portfolio Week in late September, this money will first go to materials (fabric, buttons, zippers, interfacing). If I happen to exceed my initial goal, the money will also help cover the cost to create takeaway gifts, zines, and display materials for my booth. For a better breakdown of what your money is going towards, here's a list:

     

     

    • Fabric (Cotton, twill, suiting, wool, some synthetic blends)
    • Buttons 
    • Zippers
    • Trim
    • Other closures
    • Interfacing/interlining
    • Other notions
    • Dyes
    • Paints
    • Portfolio display materials (Tablecloth, signage, posters)
    • Fashion Illustration zine
    • Collection lookbook
    • Business cards

     

     

     

    The Perks

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    I would never want to ask something from others without being able to give back something in return, so my campaign comes with several perks! By donating a certain amount, you qualify for the following perks:

     

    The Digital Zine Perk

    $10 minimum. By donating a minimum of $10, you will receive a downloadable PDF of ASTERISM, a Fashion Illustration zine -- a 15-20 full-color page zine of original fashion illustration works by Cassandra Soriano. Plus all previous perks. 

    See more illustrations here.

    The Printed Zine Perk

    $30 minimum. By donating a minimum of $30, you will receive a personally-shipped printed version of ASTERISM, a Fashion Illustration zine -- a 15-20 full-color page saddle-stitched zine of original fashion illustration works by Cassandra Soriano. Plus all previous perks.

    The Zine + Lookbook DELUXE Perk

    $50 minimum. By donating a minimum of $50, you will receive all previous perks, plus the ASTERISM Lookbook, both in downloadable PDF and saddle-stitched booklet form.

    The Ultra Limited "POLARIS" Perk

     

     

     

     

    $100 minimum. By donating a minimum of $100, you will receive all previous perks, plus your choice of a limited edition, originally designed "POLARIS" graphic tote. 

     

    *FOR ALL SHIPPED PERKS YOU MUST PROVIDE A VALID ADDRESS FOR ME TO SHIP THE ITEM TO YOU SAFELY! 

     

     

     

    Why does this matter?

    ASTERISM has been a dream collection of mine since high school, and slowly but surely I've been working my way towards its production. I find a large majority of my inspiration in androgyny, especially in fashion that appeals to both genders. There's a growing trend and desire, even necessity, for more gender-neutral fashion, and I want to be a contributing part of this aesthetic and the impact it has in our culture. To sum it up, ASTERISM is a Fall 2015 Menswear collection that bridges the space between feminine prints, silhouettes and masculine lines and fabric, exploring the way we see and interpret beauty in others as well as in ourselves. 

     

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The only risk I face is not reaching my $800 goal within my 25 day timeframe. In 25 days I will have already begun drafting and constructing muslin test-fits of all my garments, and then I'll have 7 weeks to complete all of my garments and photograph them for my portfolio show. Even if I don't reach $800 specifically, all of the money raised still goes to producing my collection, as well as helping send out all of the awarded perks in mid-October through November!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't donate, spread the word instead! ANY help is appreciated, even if it's a simple share on facebook, twitter, whathaveyou! 

     

    For more of my work, visit my Portfolio website here.

     

    For a snapshot of the garments I'll be making, see below.

story:
The Quiet Front - Book 1

My name is Lawrence, for over two years I've been running a website called The Quiet Front, it's a reflection of the work that I love most in the world - provocative and artistic photography that moves me, makes me think and makes me dream. I believe in personal and creative freedom and nothing moves me more than seeing artists doing the work they love.

I have made some really fantastic connections with many people that share this obsession and with some of the artists that create the work. I want my site to be more than a reflection of what's out there and become a catalyst for those artists to create new and original work. I hold all of the contributing artists in the highest regard; I am honoured that they have committed to this project.

The books are going start out digital only, the idea being that we continue to produce these books with many other artists and at the end of each year we compile them into a beautiful physical book.

What We Need & What You Get

We are running this campaign to raise the money to pay the contributing artists and, except for fees payable to Indiegogo and Paypal, that is the entire budget. It's a very simple equation - you back this project and we give the artists the money to go out and create the work that they believe in with no regard for anything but their own vision.

The ebooks will be high quality PDF's (DRM free).

The rewards are pretty self explanatory but feel free to contact me for more details. For people considering being a "Major Supporter" please contact me for details about traffic to the site, etc. For people considering the "Portfolio Site" please contact me because there are some reasonable restrictions. 

Public Supporters

I've made our Supporters page; I'm going to leave the page live until long after the books are complete. 

Major Supporters

I've made a post that details our pageviews / unique vistors etc.

The Contributing Artists

In no particular order:

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't push work that is "social" but I would really appreciate you sharing this project with the artists and dreamers that you believe will appreciate it. Thanks!

story:
The Time is NOW!

Meet David from Vancouver, Canada, and Kanat from Almaty, Kazakhstan! 

We are two distinguished photographers seeking a platform to display our work and passion. Together, we have been working to create a unique vision on identity and culture in New York. 

Our goal is to present an exhibition this September, in NYC. 


Experience America Like Never Before

David's Project: Stoners of the World 

  • What does it mean to be a 'stoner'? Is a stoner, unproductive, lazy, and half-witted? David's project challenges to change the negative connotation that the word has in our society by expressing individuality in his subjects in various positive ways.
  • David has photographed artists, doctors, patients, growers, dealers in New York and New Jersey.
  • It's about weed, but not about weed.
  • www.stonersoftheworld.com


Kan's Project: Amerikaz 

  • With much misleading representation of Kazakh people in popular culture, Kan explores the modern day Kazakh identity in America. 
  • Kan has traveled around New York, Washington, Maryland, and California to complete this project.
  • Portfolio: http://www.flickr.com/photos/beisekeyev
  • Published: http://www.voxpopuli.kz/en/post/1601/kazakhs-adopted-by-americans
  • Published: http://www.voxpopuli.kz/en/post/1253/kazakhstan...



We Want Chelsea!

That's right, one of the world's most prestigious art venue, Chelsea district in NYC... and we ain't kidding around!

YOUR HELP can make our dream become a reality!

All funds will go to: 
  • Space Rental 
  • Large Prints 
  • Frames 
  • Lighting Equipment
  • Labour 
  • Venue decoration, amenities
  • Other production expenses


Let It Begin!

  • A generous donation will be much appreciated!
  • Please SHARE our cause with your family and friends via Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, Instagram, etc), email, or blog!!

story:
The Project:

  1. A true private work space.
  2. Comprehensive book of my work.
  3. Limited editions of mustache portraits.

The Studio. For the last seven years I’ve rented, shared, worked out of a bedroom in a house (not exactly safe now with two kids). Each move requires too much time to reorganize and reconfigure my equipment to fit the space. Currently my studio practice happens at work in a shared office space that doubles as a shared working studio. Although its proximity to my job is great it doesn’t afford me privacy to think, create, take risks all to further develop my practice.

The Book. To date I’ve been included in many books, most recently Humor in Craft by Brigitte Martin, all featuring one or more pieces. However, I’ve yet to produce a comprehensive book highlighting my favorite works, successful projects and bodies of work. I’m interested in this to not only mark my accomplishments but to offer collectors, colleagues and students something affordable to share in comparison with most of my works. 

The Limited Editions. The Mustache Portrait series is my most current studio project at this time.  The creation of these two editions gives the opportunity for me to continue working in this series, exploring process and aesthetics while also providing collectors with two affordable designs. The Wiggly Mustache Portrait No.2 edition is similar to previous works, but the Victorian Woman with Mustache, brooch is my first attempt to take this series into a jewelry format. 

Wiggly Mustache Portrait No.2

backside

Victorian Woman with Mustache, brooch

backside

The Budget. The following is a simple breakdown of the overall project.

  • materials and labor for a 10' x 16' studio space (foundation, framing, roof, windows, siding) - $5,400
  • materials for the limited edition mustache portraits - $150
  • commission fee for the graphic design for the book - $300
  • fee for the author of the forward statement in the book - $150

Total Budget - $6,000

I really hope you are as excited as I am about these new limited editions, the first book of my work and this next big step for my studio practice! 

Thank you!

story:
Nicaragua is a country rich in artistic traditions including the use of murals to educate and inspire, and the city of Esteli is an incubator of this culture of creativity. Known as a stronghold during the 1979 revolution, the city has rebuilt itself over the last forty years to include over 100 murals of community expression.

In partnership with ICAS/Juntos Adelante, the artists will complete original murals that showcase and encompass the hope and values of community, access to care and health for all. Imagine San Francisco's Mission District without its murals, or the Sistine Chapel without a ceiling. Murals breathe life and cultural heritage.  Without them public settings can be cold and mundane, and our stories and history can be lost.  The old government health center, Centro de Salud, had treasured murals that are now gone after the building was decommissioned. Currently, the new facility has been built and there is a desire for paintings to once again beautify and narrate the history of this vital center for the people of Esteli. 

Projects like these are at the heart of ICAS/Juntos Adelante's mission to promote health and human rights through cross-cultural exchange. And your support goes a long way towards providing the materials needed to once again revive Esteli's canvas. Every contribution counts, whether it's enough for a paintbrush or the value of a completed panel.  

Please take the time to donate today.

Thank you for your support!

Salud para Todos (Health for All) Mural Project

Esteli, a small city nestled in the Northern Highands of Nicaragua, is known for its leadership during the revolution and women’s rights movement, its fertile lands of coffee beans and tobacco plants, and its preservation of artistic traditions. Despite being the second poorest nation in the western hemisphere, Nicaragua is a country rich in artistic traditions including the use of murals to educate and inspire. For the last ten years, ICAS/Juntos Adelante has collaborated with local health activists, civic leaders, and local muralists in Esteli, Nicaragua. With your help we are excited to embark on our next project, to sponsor and complete five murals in the the Centro de Salud Government Health Center. We thrilled to report that two murals are already finished. 

About us

Juntos Adelante’s mission is to promote health and human rights through sharing resources cross-culturally. Our goals are to encourage self-sustainability and act as liaisons by sharing resources found in abundance in the developed world, with developing nations that don’t have easy access to such opportunity. This particular region lacks material resources due to impoverishment but has an abundance of creativity, talent, expertise, innovation and resilience.

In Esteli, we specifically seek out innovative proposals from local leaders that are community-initiated grassroots projects that strengthen the health infrastructure, promote human rights, and are sustainable. Nicaraguans are the ones who identify the needs of the community, develop proposals, request funding, and carry out the implementation of projects. Our previous projects include: a free standing midwifery clinic, extensive donations of medical supplies to the public health system focused on maternal health, diabetes, HIV, and other leading health problems, a cervical cancer prevention program, an HIV-prevention mentoring project, and health and human rights murals. 

History

Esteli has a rich tradition of telling its history and displaying its values through murals. There are over 100 murals within the city limits and two prominent professional muralist groups. These murals showcase political struggles and focus on social justice themes. They offer a visual pictorial of the challenges that face the community. Like many urban areas, the afflictions of poverty can be felt throughout the city: high teenage pregnancy rates, poor health and high morbidity, lack of access to clean water, to name a few. Positive solutions are often incorporated in the murals about how to overcome the challenges such as the need for a clean environment and fresh water, how to prevent HIV, and how to promote health and well-being through exercise, diet and healthy lifestyle and important health exams such as pap smears. The nuances of the murals are clearly understood by the locals but may go undetected by a foreigner; these include poetry from local artists, imagery of thriving crops, and inspiring war iconography that depict peace rather than revolution. 

In 2008, Juntos Adelante was approached by Julio Moreno, who as a youth in the 80’s was selected to maintain the rich tradition of murals as a member of a group of professional artists. Today, he is the leader of a group that works locally, nationally and internationally. Julio is also committed to keeping young teenagers out of gangs and the illegal drug trade, and offers them a chance to participate in the mural process. 

In Julio’s own words, the Colectivo de Muralistas is a “group of five main members who are committed to the rescue of our values, identity, culture and committed to social awareness through murals”. In developing a mural the group works with the community from start to finish including brainstorming ideas, draft sketches, educating others on the theme of the mural while painting, and the actual work of painting itself. Originally, ICAS/Juntos Adelante brought the members of the Colectivo de Muralistas into active dialogue with local women’s health providers and activists to ensure inclusion of gender equality, and maternal and reproductive health topics in the murals. ICAS/Juntos Adelante has financially sponsored seven murals that promote gender equality and include cervical cancer prevention, adolescent wellness and pregnancy prevention, healthy families and communities. Every funded mural has been completed efficiently and within budget.

Email Bethany Golden bngolden@yahoo.com for more information about the project or check out www.mamasclinic.org to see another one of our projects in Esteli. 

Together, we look forward to restoring this culturally rich art that portrays both history and the possibility of the future.

Photo Gallery of past murals

Cervical Cancer Prevention Mural

The making of the Cervical Cancer Precention Mural

 Adolescent Health Mural

Casa Maternal Mural

Muralistas at work
story_txt: Nicaragua is a country rich in artistic traditions including the use of murals to educate and inspire, and the city of Esteli is an incubator of this culture of creativity. Known as a stronghold during the 1979 revolution, the city has rebuilt itself over the last forty years to include over 100 murals of community expression.In partnership with ICAS/Juntos Adelante, the artists will complete original murals that showcase and encompass the hope and values of community, access to care and health for all. Imagine San Francisco's Mission District without its murals, or the Sistine Chapel without a ceiling. Murals breathe life and cultural heritage.  Without them public settings can be cold and mundane, and our stories and history can be lost.  The old government health center, Centro de Salud, had treasured murals that are now gone after the building was decommissioned. Currently, the new facility has been built and there is a desire for paintings to once again beautify and narrate the history of this vital center for the people of Esteli. Projects like these are at the heart of ICAS/Juntos Adelante's mission to promote health and human rights through cross-cultural exchange. And your support goes a long way towards providing the materials needed to once again revive Esteli's canvas. Every contribution counts, whether it's enough for a paintbrush or the value of a completed panel.  Please take the time to donate today.Thank you for your support!Salud para Todos (Health for All) Mural ProjectEsteli, a small city nestled in the Northern Highands of Nicaragua, is known for its leadership during the revolution and women’s rights movement, its fertile lands of coffee beans and tobacco plants, and its preservation of artistic traditions.
