story:
JESSE’S STORY:

  My name is Jesse Rising Crow McKinney. I’m an artist with severe Cerebral Palsy.  After surviving many hardships including divorce, homelessness, living alone without my daughter, and several unsuccessful relationships, I gave up trying to find someone to spend my life with.  However, I had forgotten that my profile was still up on one disability dating website.  On March 31, 2014 however, out of the blue, I received the following message and had no idea that I was reading the words of my soul-mate!..

“Hi my name is Laura, my email is ***** and my Skype is ***** I don't have yahoo messenger although. I too have staff that come everyday for 12 hrs. but I can be left alone for a few hrs. and am not looking for a caregiver either just someone who can except me as I am cause I can't change it. LOL.”

  Laura is the woman that I have waited my whole life to meet.  I know this sounds cliché but it is TRUE!  I want to spend the rest of my life with her. I love her.  She brings joy to my heart and love to my life.  It is hard enough for non-disabled people to find their soul-mate.  So imagine how difficult it is for two people with CP to meet, be compatible, and navigable the logistics of a relationship.  .Plus, we live in two different states.  Therefore, we’ve created this fundraiser in order to make it possible for me to relocate from Williamsport, Pennsylvania to Portland, Maine.  So Laura & I can live and sell  our paintings together in the Portland area. However, enough from me, let my sweet Laura tell her side of the story.

BE SURE TO WATCH BOTH OF OUR SHORT DOCUMENTARIES IN OUR GALLERY SECTION.

LAURA’S STORY;

Back in March I joined a disabled dating site and within three days I messaged a man with CP who caught my attention and he wrote back to me right away. We hit it off right away. We both have the same kind of Cerebral Palsy. We also have so much in common as far as dreams and hopes for the future. So we Skyped every day most days for hours non-stop and found out that we both have been in really bad relationships. Although our pasts haven't been so good, we both believe that our future could be beautiful and amazing. He came to visit me for five days in May and it was the most wonderful time in my life. I never thought I could love someone so completely and feel so safe, as I do with him. I truly believe that he is my soul-mate. And I want to be with him for the rest of my life. When he left to go home it about broke my heart. Because the time just went so fast. But we both have a lot to work on because we want to live and start painting and selling our work together by the Holidays. And in order to make this happen, Jesse has to move up here for 30 days before he can qualify for any type of services, like Mainecare, and so we are working on this fundraiser so that he will be able to pay out of his own pocket for the thirty days.  I am also asking my family and friends to help out in any little way possible. It will cost Jesse about $3500.00 for the first month on his own. That is why we are doing a fundraiser.

With Jesse, I could truly be myself, and not be shy or timid at all. This may be a little bit personal, but he was the first man who ever truly made love to me, in every sense of the word. And now I know what it means to be truly loved by a man. We laugh a lot, and our sense of humor is pretty much the same- I'm not saying that we are complete carbon copies of each other- we do have some differences. But I can't imagine my life without him.

If you are able to contribute, please donate via this site.

Thank you for your time, and we both appreciate any and all help that you can give us.

Love,
Laura

THIS CROWD FUND ENDS AUGUST 1, 2014.  TO MAKE DONATIONS AFTER THIS DATE OR IF YOU  HAVE  QUESTIONS, EMAIL JESSE AT:
ironmonk68@yahoo.com

story:
Breve riepilogo

Collaboratori finanziare idee che possono essere appassionati e alle persone di cui si fidano. Qui ci sono alcune cose da fare in questa sezione:

  • Presentatevi e lo sfondo.
  • Descrivi brevemente la tua campagna e perché è importante per voi.
  • Esprimere la grandezza di ciò contribuenti vi aiuterà a raggiungere.

Ricordate, tenerlo conciso, ma personale. Chiedetevi: se qualcuno ha smesso di leggere qui sarebbero stati pronti a dare un contributo?

Che cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa ottenete

Scomposizione per la gente più in dettaglio:

  • Spiega quanti fondi avete bisogno e dove sta andando. Essere trasparenti e specifici-persone hanno bisogno di fidarsi di voi a voler finanziare voi.
  • Dire alla gente circa i vostri vantaggi unici. Farli eccitato!
  • Descrivere in cui i fondi vanno, se non si raggiunge l'intero obiettivo.

L'Impact

Sentitevi liberi di spiegare meglio la campagna e lasciare che la gente sa come la differenza il loro contributo farà:

  • Spiegare perché il progetto è prezioso per il contribuente e per il mondo.
  • Puntate il vostro track record di successo di progetti come questo (se ne avete uno).
  • Renderlo reale per le persone e costruire la fiducia.

Altri modi per aiutare

Alcune persone semplicemente non possono contribuire, ma questo non significa che non possono aiutare:

  • Chiedi gente per ottenere la parola e fare qualche rumore sulla vostra campagna.
  • Ricorda loro di utilizzare gli strumenti di condivisione IndieGoGo!

E questo è tutto ciò che devi fare.

story:
My Goal Has Been Met!!!! Thank you.

I'm really moved by the support you all have shown me. If you really wanted to get one of the drawing perks you still have some time and I still have other expenses related to the conference (biz cards, portfolio materials, and additional trip expenses).

Short Summary

If you're reading this, you probably know me already but in case you don't my names Erika and I draw ALL.DAY.LONG. Well, I do some other stuff too but drawing and illustrating is my full-time job. I draw in ink and gouache mostly and my drawings typically depict fantastical dreams, vicious pets, and my life distilled into colorful and highly patterned imagery.

As a career path, art is hard but I've been making great headway over the past few years. I submit my work to various projects, publications, and galleries every week. I try to be as focused on building my career as I am on the drawing.

What I Need & What You Get

The next step in my career is getting more involved in commercial illustration and the illustration community as a whole. I can do much of this over the magical interwebs but I really need to connect with other artists and the people who pay the artists.

This is where Icon8 comes in. Icon8 is an illustration conference that is filled with educational workshops as well as chances to meet and talk to industry leaders. It also has many of the illustrators I look up to presenting such as Carson Ellis, Lisa Congden, and Susie Ghahremani. I feel that attending this conference is vital to helping me move forward as a professional illustrator.

I'm asking for $2,200. The conference itself is just under $600 just to walk in the door. There are also a few workshops I'd like to attend that have additional fees (with titles like Publishing for Illustrators and Pattern Design). 

In addition to the cost of the conference I require funds for a train ticket, a hotel room (during peak time in summer), and of course food (with celiac there will be no surviving on top ramen for me unfortunately). The conference is 5 days long so that's a lot of hotel time and meals.

In return I'm offering some amazing offerings including custom made artwork and printed goodies. If you've ever wanted me to draw you a piece of art this is a great time to get the drawing of your dreams and for me to get to attend something that will really help my future development as an artist.

The themes for the various drawings are flexible. So if you'd like, for example, a 9" x 11" portrait of a family member instead of a pet portrait that's fine! I'll be contacting all contributors after the fundraiser is complete and getting the exact details for your drawing.

story:
I am Stefan, a self taught visionary artist and thinker and I am very passionate about my work. When I was little, I was fascinated with the way the landscapes could be conveyed on simply a flat surface. I always would strive to increase the depth and complexity of my pieces. My art has always been visionary because I have always been producing work from my fictional mind.  In more recent years, I have been honoring these skills and thinking about a career path that I can take with my fictional mind.  I'd like to eventually work towards my own animation studio, for I believe that that it would be the best way for me to convey my internal worlds to the external world. I hope to progress enlightenment and peace in others by presenting my ideas and encouraging others to do the same, but I still have a long way to go.

I am asking for funds to help pay a portion of the tuition required to attend THe Oxbow School in Napa, California.  This school is considered to be one of the best high school art programs in the country and I have applied and have been accepted to spend  my second semester of my senior year there. This is an opportunity for me to receive an education doing what I love as an artist.  I believe that with the Oxbow experience my skills will exponentially skyrocket and make this animation studio an eventual possibility.  When I succeed in the art world, I also wish to start an organization that travels around the world encouraging people to express themselves truthfully and artistically.  Throughout my experiences in life I've found that the best way to help the greater good is to first help the individual. And through their art this can be an expression for that individual. 

Thank you for your support.

Stefan

story:
The Idea

“Jenny’s skirt” is a huge skirt that invites participants to look at life with different eyes. The art project is inspired by the lyrics of a song by Fabrizio De Andre’, an Italian songwriter who died in 1999, and by the infinite sense of freedom, self-expression and sharing experienced at Burning Man.

The philosophy of the project is powerfully enclosed in one sentence from the song’s lyrics:

"In un vortice di polvere gli altri vedevan siccita', a me ricordava la gonna di Jenny in un ballo di tanti anni fa"

“In a whirlwind of dust others saw dryness, while it reminded to me of Jenny’s skirt in a dance of many years ago”

The whirlwind of dust could be interpreted also as a dust devil, but really is the dance of the person you love, seen when living life at a different speed. The metaphor of the skirt refers at the way to look at things, wishing there was more poetry in life.

The ART project

The art project is conceived as a huge skirt made of translucent red fabric. 

The art has both an interactive and a useful purpose. 

The interactive part is related to the fact that people can climb the installation through the legs to wear the skirt. People from the outside can interact with the person wearing the skirt as well as they can gather inside the skirt around Jenny’s legs.The skirt is lighted during the night creating shadows of people enhancing further interaction among shadow effects. The entire legs structure is  made of wood where people can write or paint on it.

On the other hand, the useful purpose is to protect people from the hot days , the possible white-out and/or create a  nest during the night. 

Come to interact with Jenny!

The Burn

Jenny will be burned on BM Playa on Thursday night at 8 pm.

The Team

Our team is a transnational mixture of Burners from California, Colorado, New York, Connecticut and Italy that met each other at Burning Man and collaborated during the year to make this project happen.

Some other team members are great people that will come to Burning Man for the first time and they are willing to volunteer during the entire week ensuring safety of the structure.

Your support

We have some support from Burning Man and we are trying to gather funds trough a fundraising event in San Francisco. However, this is not enough to cover all the cost for the material of the legs, burn and lights and we really need your support to make our ART shining and dancing as we dreamed it.

We will use your contributions to complete the structure of the legs, the burn and the lighting of the ART.

Please, give whatever you can – every contribution helps us to succeed in building our beautiful collective art project !

You can also help by spreading this message about our project – tell your friends, spread the idea, get excited and involved! 

Please share the link to our page!
story_txt: The Idea“Jenny’s skirt” is a huge skirt that invites participants to look at life with different eyes. The art project is inspired by the lyrics of a song by Fabrizio De Andre’, an Italian songwriter who died in 1999, and by the infinite sense of freedom, self-expression and sharing experienced at Burning Man.The philosophy of the project is powerfully enclosed in one sentence from the song’s lyrics:"In un vortice di polvere gli altri vedevan siccita', a me ricordava la gonna di Jenny in un ballo di tanti anni fa"“In a whirlwind of dust others saw dryness, while it reminded to me of Jenny’s skirt in a dance of many years ago”The whirlwind of dust could be interpreted also as a dust devil, but really is the dance of the person you love, seen when living life at a different speed. The metaphor of the skirt refers at the way to look at things, wishing there was more poetry in life.The ART projectThe art project is conceived as a huge skirt made of translucent red fabric. The art has both an interactive and a useful purpose. The interactive part is related to the fact that people can climb the installation through the legs to wear the skirt. People from the outside can interact with the person wearing the skirt as well as they can gather inside the skirt around Jenny’s legs.The skirt is lighted during the night creating shadows of people enhancing further interaction among shadow effects. The entire legs structure is  made of wood where people can write or paint on it.On the other hand, the useful purpose is to protect people from the hot days , the possible white-out and/or create a  nest during the night. Come to interact with Jenny!The BurnJenny will be burned on BM Playa on Thursday night at 8 pm.The TeamOur team is a transnational mixture of Burners from California, Colorado, New York, Connecticut and Italy that met each other at Burning Man and collaborated during the year to make this project happen.Some other team members are great people that will come to Burning Man for the first time and they are willing to volunteer during the entire week ensuring safety of the structure.Your supportWe have some support from Burning Man and we are trying to gather funds trough a fundraising event in San Francisco. However, this is not enough to cover all the cost for the material of the legs, burn and lights and we really need your support to make our ART shining and dancing as we dreamed it.We will use your contributions to complete the structure of the legs, the burn and the lighting of the ART.Please, give whatever you can – every contribution helps us to succeed in building our beautiful collective art project !You can also help by spreading this message about our project – tell your friends, spread the idea, get excited and involved! Please share the link to our page!

story:
Alabama Song is...

Alabama Song Art Space, founded by Houston artist and teacher Gabriel Martinez, provides the community with a flexible platform for the production, discussion and presentation of ideas. Hosting everything from reading groups to artist residencies to pop up events of all kinds, Alabama Song is perfectly poised to respond to the needs of an interested and interesting community.  

In the past several months:

  • writer Nick Flynn taught a class in association with the University of Houston,
  • a Laconian reading group has met weekly,
  • Malawian artist Massa Lemu created an entire series based on luggage,
  • artist Torkwase Dyson let us in on her Black Light project during her stay at Alabama Song while she worked on the project in Galveston,
  • a class at UH taught by author Mat Johnson exhibited their comic book art,
  • we provided studio space for several local artists as they completed works that were then presented in “Coming Through the Gap in the Mountain on an Elephant” at Texas Southern University,

among many many other projects and creative moments.

 

How you’re helping...

This campaign helps Alabama Song continue its work in the Houston community, providing essential operating funds that allow the space to offer events, classes, unique experiences, and an ever-expanding array of resources to artists and the public for free.  Some of the things your generous contribution will help Alabama Song get are a handtruck, a project, a sound system, plants for the garden (and future Alabama Song dinners!), among many other things.

 

Big picture…

A donation of any size allows Alabama Song to:

say yes to every good idea and opportunity that comes our way;

give the public access to those opportunities always free of charge;

provide a resource for both locals and visitors, whether they be artists, scholars, experts or folks just interested in learning something new or having a good time with good people.

Houston is buzzing with a dizzying number exciting projects, spaces, and cultural leaders. Alabama Song is ready to be a resource for all of Houston's happenings and we hope you'll help us continue that mission.

And in exchange for helping Alabama Song out, you could get awesome perks like:

A Snack 

A moon sticker

An Alabama Song t-shirt tote!

 

THANK YOU!

story:
About Little Ms. Aprill:



Little Ms. Aprill is an illustrator, that has an immense passion for telling narratives and sharing stories with her work. Her latest work Viva La Femme aspires to uplift, empower, and celebrate women of color from all over the globe. Embracing the radical notions of self-love, femininity, and celebrating diversity. Show her your support, by donating funds to help expand her brand-- Viva La Femme --and promote a positive platform showing girls from all over the world they are amazing!


What We Need Funding For:

  • prototype and product development
  • printing costs
  • production costs
  • material costs
  • supplies for the production of prototypes
  • package design fees
  • packaging, shipping, postage fees
  • marketing fees
  • distribution costs
  • $400 for the table rental fee at Crafty Bastards Arts & Crafts Fair
  • $300 for a button machine to make Viva La Femme Buttons!
  • Funds to make Stickers, T-Shirts, Buttons, Pocket Mirrors, Prints, Garlands, Tote Bags, Cosmetic Products, Bracelets, Notebooks, Mugs, and Phone Cases.


The Impact:

Donating to fund Viva La Femme will help Little Ms. Aprill share her artwork and vision around the world. Showcasing positive representation of women of color from all over the world. Embracing every girl in every size, shape, and shade, telling the masses they are amazing beings just as they are! Viva La Femme supports the radical notions of self-love, femininity, and celebrating diversity. This brand aims to embrace, love, empower, and support all the girls of the globe!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this video!! Share Little Ms. Aprill's artwork with everyone you know!

Tweet it, Like it on Facebook, Reblog it on Tumblr, Broadcast it on Youtube!!!

 Please help support Little Ms. Aprill by also supporting her on Facebook as well. Share with your friends, family, and anyone you know that will help support this great cause to share this artist's vision with the world!

story:
What?

I am a senior at Evanston Township High School and this is an independent project I am executing through a class I take at school.  To me, poetry is a way of expression and creation that is easily attainable in everyday classrooms, but isn't necessarily given as that.  Many classrooms teach poetry as just another assignment, something you need a grade for, therefore kids don't really get the right outlook on it.  Poetry is about accessing your emotions and descriptive language to further your writing in general, which I believe to be something very important to all students.  I am publishing an anthology of poetry with works from myself and from the students I am working with everyday.  Together, we can create something that the students will work towards rather than getting a grade for it but for the purpose of producing poetry that means enough to them that they will want to publish them and show them to the world.  

How?

I need at $600 to pay for the actual publication of the book, which should be released in the middle of May. It is this expensive because I am giving all of the students that offer their poetry a book of their very own, so that they may one day show that they have given an expression of themselves to the world. 

Why?

I chose this project because of my history with poetry and writing in general.  I have done a unit on poetry every single year during school, and every time I treated it just as another unit rather than what it actually was; I never gave it the power it deserved.  During my junior year I was asked to submit my work to student produced show called Writers Showcase, which I didn't think much of, but I submitted anyway.  A few months later a teacher of mine congratulated me on my piece being accepted.  I was confused but realized that the board of students that chose pieces had actually picked mine.  I had many friends in the show, so it was exciting to know that they would later perform my work.  Weeks went by, and I got compliments from everyone in the show telling me how it was their favorite act and how they had to decided to end the show with it because it was the best, which was extremely flattering, but I didn't really believe it.  When I finally got to see the show, I waited for my piece and, surprisingly, was sweating a lot; I was so nervous to see my work being performed.  After the show, I was so impressed with the performance and how well they had interpreted the material.  I heard mumbling among the audience saying things like "that last one was lovely," "I loved the last one," "It was so cute," and many more things.  It was not just flattering but all of this made me realize the power of poetry and how it can be read and understood.  By writing my poetry and sharing it, there was am impact. I was affecting myself and the people the poetry was shared with.  This experience changed my whole outlook on poetry, so now I know to write and share as much as possible because it isn't just about me anymore.  

Risks & Challenges

In this project there is a risk of not raising enough money to publish enough books for everyone that contributes and supports it.  I believe that, with enough contributors, it will be an easy challenge to overcome, but I need your help! I need as many donors as possible, so if you decide to donate, please share and pass this project along! Even if you are not able to support us with money, please share and pass this project along! The power of one impact can ripple into an earthquake of change, but we need to start the impact here.  Share on facebook, instagram, twitter, by email, text, snail mail, and whatever other forms of communication you would like. 

Thank you for helping start the ripple.

story:
Romanian illustrator and artist Aitch brings a new collection of 52 beautifully hand-painted watercolour illustrations and patterns, which will be assembled together in a small book called Aitch’s Veggie Fruit Alphabet.

The book is a playful approach on the traditional alphabet book. Each letter features a fruit or vegetable, depicted as a morph between the fruit’s or veggie’s shape and the female body, a beautiful tribute to natural diversity. Each character has a companion page featuring an illustration of the letter itself and a hand painted pattern based on the fruit or vegetable.

Here is a glimpse of the digital print prototype of the book which, with your support, will be produced as an offset printed book containing  58 pages, in A5 format,  with cardboard hardcover, everything sewn together in a limited edition of 300 copies.


**** Please check the Gallery section, found right under the project's title, for more images of the book and of the linocut prints.****

story:
We work with an NGO in Bandung, West-Java named Rumah Cemara. We deal with drug users and people with HIV/AIDS. A lot of these cases come from, or end up in prison. These subjects are very taboo in the cultural society that is here in Indonesia. Our main goal is to educate people and create awareness about the situation and reduce the enormous stigmatisation that makes these peoples lives very difficult inside and out of lock-up. 

We have an ongoing art therapy project at a local prison. We encourage the inmates to express themselves through art and creativity to give them a voice in a medium and environment where that does not exist. Some of the drawings the inmates produce are very strong and clearly show the struggles they are going through. Albeit technical skill is sometimes lacking, the effort and symbology of the work produced is what matters. 

We believe in giving people in need the means to help themselves instead of handouts. We believe that a change in mindset and habits can go a very long way in the quality of life for a lot of marginalised people here in Indonesia.  

Our project aims to create a stream of revenue to help our efforts at the fringe of this cultural taboo. We are going to make and sell T-shirts and prints with art that the prisoners make themselves. All of the revenue will go towards funding our rehabilitation centre. Funding different projects that involve improving the quality of life for prisoners, drug users, people with HIV/AIDS and to educate the general masses about various issues that are an outcome of nothing else but ignorance and poor education. 

If these issues strike a cord with you please help us see our vision come to fruition. If you like art that is raw and has a very real struggle behind it this will be something for you! 

We are going to keep it simple. The art will be available as prints or T-shirts. We are going to create a website about our project with an online store to process orders and to provide a vehicle for education and revenue.

Closer look at the design


Closer look at the design


Closer look at the design


Closer look at the design


We need your help to help to finance the production and distribution of our project :

  • Our goal is $5000
  • With this money we intend to produce the first stock, create and market an online store to keep the revenue flowing.

Every piece sold will contribute directly to the quality of life for the marginalised people and drug users that are going through a very real struggle to better themselves in our rehabilitation centre, prisons and the streets of Indonesia. 

We don't just value your contribution in monetary form. Please share our project with friends and the people around you! Feel free to contact us with any questions you might have regarding our endeavour.

story:
Short Summary

We are an ad hoc group of La Peña Cultural Center community members who came together last summer to make sure that the mural at this much loved and respected cultural institution remains on its facade.  Newly painted and ready to withstand the test of time for another two decades we want to see a third rendition of the Song of Unity mural. 

The mural's cultural significance and content transcends time and the figures on the mural which were once chosen to represent the hopes of so many Latin American expatriates, exiles and immigrants cannot simply be put aside for new symbols hence our commitment to work together to raise the funding needed to pay the artists and obtain the materials needed for the mural renewal.

The figures of Victor Jara, Pablo Neruda, Gabriela Mistral, Cesar Sandino, Arzobispo Romero, Malvina Reynolds, Woodie Guthrie, Cesar Chavez, Violeta Parra, and Paul Robeson currently on the mural will remain on its new and third rendition with new figures added as selected in a random drawing of pre-qualified community suggested figures on February 8th, 2013.

Musicians such as John Santos, Rafael Manriquez, Holly Near, Los Peludos and Lichi Fuentes have come out to show their support through benefit concerts at La Peña and our families have come out to show their support both through ticket sales as well as through volunteer work.

This new rendition of the Song of Unity honors the legacy of La Peña's history while adding new figures and is the first time that the community at large has participated in the selection of new additions and is the organizing body around the fundraising efforts.

Please help us raise funds to pay the artists for their incredible work and make the dream of renewing this historic landmark a reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

While a lot of labor is being donated by different members of the community with people carting about boards, doing sound, graphic design, painting the boards with sealant, etc. just to get things done, we do need to raise funds to pay the artists honorarium and to pay for materials, removal of the old mural and installation of the new mural. 

The original La Peña Cultural Center budget for this renewal was over 80,000 dollars because of our community involvement we've been able to reduce the overall number to 40,000 dollars of which 14,000 is already being supplied through a grant from the Fleishhacker foundation. As a group we need to raise 26,000 dollars which will be raised with the campaign as well as benefit concerts at La Peña Cultural Center and any other creative means people think of to raise awareness and funds.

We will be offering posters, mural t-shirts, cds and artist sketches to donors depending on the size of their gift and we will continue fundraising until we reach our goal.

We will be posting updates throughout the campaign to let you know where we are and hope you will come with us on this journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to contact us at peopleunited4songofunitymural@gmail.com with fundraising ideas or if you'd like to volunteer for events or removal or installation of the mural. Also please let everyone know about this effort.Thank you so much for your time and attention.

story:
We are a closed knitted group of 8 students from Laval University currently studying towards a Master Degree in visual arts.(Quebec city, Canada). We are EXTREMELY MOTIVATED and presently seeking you financial help to fund a study trip to this year's Miami Art Basel that will be held next December. 

WHAT IS ART BASEL MIAMI AND WHY WE NEED TO GO???

Art Basel Miami is one of the largest international art fair that represent more than 250 galeries from all over the world. Let's just say it's THE BEST OF THE BEST. Having the chance to visit this event is for us a big opportunity to expand our knowledge, to experience what is going right now and to establish connections with working artists and key agents of the actual international art sphere that will all help us in our futur career. 

------

Nous sommes un groupe de 8 étudiant(e)s à la maitrise en arts visuels avec mémoire de l'Université Laval (Québec, Canada)Nous sommes EXTREMEMENT MOTIVÉ et présentement à la recherche de fonds pour financer un séjour étudiant au Art Basel Miami 2015 qui aura lieu en décembre prochain.

C'EST QUOI ART BASEL MIAMI ET POURQUOI AVOIR BESOIN D'Y ASSITER??? 

C'est l'une des plus grandes foires d'art contemporain qui regroupe plus de 250 galeries provenant des quatre coins du monde. Bref, on y retrouve LA CRÈME DE LA CRÈME! Avoir la chance de visiter cet évènement est pour nous une occasion en or d'approfondir nos connaissances, de nous mettre à l'affut de ce qui ce fait actuellement et d'établir des liens avec des artistes reconnus et des agents clés du monde de l'art actuel international qui nous aiderons dans notre future carrière. 

What we need and what you get/ Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

In total, for this study trip, we need to collect about 8000$ for the plane tickets and the accommodation. Here, we are asking you for an amount of 1500$ that will used to cover the entry fee for the entire duration of the event. The entrance passes for all 3 days costs 100USD$ per person.

  • For a 5$ donation : you will have our infinite gratitude
  • For a 20$ donation : we will send you a personalized postcard from Miami
  • For a 50$ donation : you will have an original collective artworks created in Miami.
  • For a 100$ donation : you will pay the entry fee for one student.

------

Au total, pour ce séjour, il nous faut amasser une somme d'environ 8000$ pour couvrir les billets d'avion et l'hébergement. Nous vous demandons ici qu'une somme de 1500$ qui servira à couvrir les frais d'entrée pour toute la durée de l'évènement. La passe d'entrée pour les trois jours coûte 100USD$ par personne. 

  • Pour un don de 5$: vous aurez notre gratitude infinie.
  • Pour un don de 20$: nous vous enverrons une carte postale personnalisé de Miami
  • Pour un don de 50$: vous aurez une oeuvre originale collective crée à Miami.
  • Pour 100$ : vous parrainer l'entrée d'un étudiant au Art Basel

Others ways you can help/D'autres façons d'aider

You can also help us by only sharing our funding campaign into the social networks or by sharing the world with you family and friends.

Vous pouvez aussi nous aider seulement qu'en partageant notre campagne de financement sur les réseaux sociaux ou en faisant circuler le mot à vos proches!
story_txt:
We are a closed knitted group of 8 students from Laval University currently studying towards a Master Degree in visual arts.(Quebec city, Canada). We are EXTREMELY MOTIVATED and presently seeking you financial help to fund a study trip to this year's Miami Art Basel that will be held next December. 
WHAT IS ART BASEL MIAMI AND WHY WE NEED TO GO???
Art Basel Miami is one of the largest international art fair that represent more than 250 galeries from all over the world. Let's just say it's THE BEST OF THE BEST. Having the chance to visit this event is for us a big opportunity to expand our knowledge, to experience what is going right now and to establish connections with working artists and key agents of the actual international art sphere that will all help us in our futur career. 
------

Nous sommes un groupe de 8 étudiant(e)s à la maitrise en arts visuels avec mémoire de l'Université Laval (Québec, Canada)Nous sommes EXTREMEMENT MOTIVÉ et présentement à la recherche de fonds pour financer un séjour étudiant au Art Basel Miami 2015 qui aura lieu en décembre prochain.
C'EST QUOI ART BASEL MIAMI ET POURQUOI AVOIR BESOIN D'Y ASSITER??? 
C'est l'une des plus grandes foires d'art contemporain qui regroupe plus de 250 galeries provenant des quatre coins du monde. Bref, on y retrouve LA CRÈME DE LA CRÈME! Avoir la chance de visiter cet évènement est pour nous une occasion en or d'approfondir nos connaissances, de nous mettre à l'affut de ce qui ce fait actuellement et d'établir des liens avec des artistes reconnus et des agents clés du monde de l'art actuel international qui nous aiderons dans notre future carrière. 

What we need and what you get/ Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez
In total, for this study trip, we need to collect about 8000$ for the plane tickets and the accommodation. Here, we are asking you for an amount of 1500$ that will used to cover the entry fee for the entire duration of the event. The entrance passes for all 3 days costs 100USD$ per person.

story:
About me and the fundraiser!

My name is Charles Ingalls and I produce/perform electronic music under the name CharlestheFirst. I have a serious passion for composing songs and playing them for smiling faces! I've got lots of upcoming West Coast dates in the next two months and I'm also beginning work on my newest album to be released in spring 2016. You can get to know my music here.

The only thing making music production and performance difficult for me right now is my computer. It's been crashing and moving really slowly despite my efforts to fix it. The trackpad also went out, so I have been producing/performing with a wireless mouse. The screen is cracked all over too, and well, I think you get the point.  The computer I need to tour and produce comes to a grand total of $2,479.00. As a 19-year-old a musician, I would GREATLY appreciate any help from you beautiful people!

I have some cool options for donating specific amounts, but any amount that you can give will help! 

Your Money Will Go Towards...

  • A new laptop for writing music/performing. 
  • Any extra money will go towards my next album.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a place to contribute, that is totally okay. I understand how that goes! If you still want to help, sharing this can make a big difference! Thank you!!

-Charles

story:
After the VAMPIRE QUEEN and the WEREWOLF QUEEN, "Michael Kontraros Collectibles" is proud to present its new release, the next Queen.

MUMMY QUEEN (54mm Elite series).

Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figure to be molded, copied, packaged and released.

MUMMY QUEEN

Sculpted by Michael Kontraros

Painted by Christos Panagiotou

Photos / Video by Stelios Demiras (Mr Black Publications)

The unpainted kit contains:

The Mummy Queen and the rising mummy (size: 54mm)

and an "egyptian ruins" High quality scenery!

Only 5 pieces of High Quality Resin Casting in a metal box.

story:
DISMAL NICHE 

Est. 2013 in Columbia, Mo and Chicago as a small batch, artist operated tape label and community arts network, Dismal Niche is a labor of LOVE committed to facilitating and archiving the expression of both the traditional and more esoteric accents of our local music and arts community.

THE FEST 

For our second festival we will once again host around 20 bands/artists over the weekend - including both local and regional artists as well as established national and international artists whose work has helped to inspire and shape the world of experimental art and music - at a number of downtown venues. We hope for the festival to be a celebration of both a thriving local and regional as well as national and international arts community by way of a thoughtfully curated showcasing of experimentation with art, music, theory and action. Our overall mission is to curate a creative, inclusive, educational and ecstatic experience for our small town once again.

Venues:

Cafe Berlin. Eastside Tavern. Firestone Baars Chapel at Stephens College (+ More TBA)

Initial Lineup (+ More TBA)

  • Laraaji (NYC) 
  • Zelienople (CHI)
  • Scott Tuma (CHI)
  • Neatly Knotted (CHI)
  • Dylan Golden Aycock (Tulsa)
  • Lake Mary (Colorado)
  • Bob Bucko Jr. (Iowa)
  • Jennifer Simone (Cinci)
  • 18&Counting (STL)
  • The Conformists (STL)
  • Hylidae (STL)
  • Blank Thomas (STL)
  • Solid Waste (STL)
  • Enemy Airship (CoMo)
  • New Tongues (CoMo)
  • Nevada Greene (CoMo)
  • Maxito Lindo (CoMo)
  • Lonesome Pines (CoMo)
  • Tim Pilcher and Monica Lord (CoMo)
  • Trivia Night (CoMo)
  • Sterling/Pale (CoMo)
  • Steve Senger (Springfield, MO) 
  • Vulvette (CoMo) 
  • Oxherding (STL)
  • Biggie Stardust (STL)
  • Jake Leech (STL) 
  • Fullclipsemptied (CoMo)


WHAT WE NEED! 

This festival could not be possible without the support of our community and the bottom line is we really need you to buy tickets, merch or just donate to the fest so that we can ensure payment of all the artists and venue rental fees so that we don't go completely broke making this special thing happen. This campaign is acting as a ticket and merch pre-sale - offering discounted tickets to meet only the absolute minimum of what we need to make the festival happen.

story:
Short Summary

I just want to help my wife. She has campaign on indiegogo, but she don't have enough views and contributions.She is a wonderful person, always trying to help everyone, she is loving, she is a caring mother, a great friend, she's my wife. She is full of life energy, she radiates with positive, she is a flower in the spring, she's my wife. She is the sun after the rain, she is  grass after the snow, she is the soul after death, she is my wife.She is everything the human eye wan't to see, it's all the human mind wants to imagine.She is my wife.

The new goal :).  Half of what we collect, we donate to the 5 campaigns which have collect a minimum donation under 500. Only  HEALT, ART, ENVIRONMENT, DANCE, RELIGION, NON PROFIT and SMALL BUSSINES categories included. Let's make a chain :)

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help to project my wife realizes, we live in sheat country, where there is no work,we're on our own.My wife decided to take the initiative, and to care for her family, but she needs help to make her project managed. link:    http://igg.me/at/NaturalCleaning/x/4515138

The Impact

If you help, you will make a great big help. You will help a young family that will forever be grateful, and we will never forget.Progress of your donation will be transparent and explained to you in detail. Looking just a little bit of your faith

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help: If you can't contribute, please SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE :) :) :) :)

story:
Hello, and welcome to our Indiegogo Campaign!


Who We Are...

We are working professionals with a common interest in making art. 

"Bricks and Clouds" is a Visual Arts exhibition to showcase our artwork and to explore the idea of living out one's artistic goals alongside professional ones.  For most of us, this is a big first step toward becoming full-time artists.  We hope to inspire other art enthusiasts to pursue their creative interests, and thus contribute to Singapore's growing arts and cultural scene.


Exhibition Details

Venue: Claire Loves Gallery, 14 Lorong Telok (Boat Quay), Singapore 049027

Opening Reception: Friday 25 April, 7.30pm

Dates: 25 April - 11 May, 2014 (closed on 27 April, 1 & 4 May)

All are welcome!


What We Need...

In order to create a memorable and engaging experience for our audience, we will need a total of US$4,600.  This will be used to pay for the venue rent for one week, and the art installation fees.  In addition, we want to provide a selection of drinks for our audience during the opening reception.  Last but not least, we want to engage as many people as we can with beautifully designed posters, flyers and postcards.

Here is a breakdown of our projected costs:

Venue rental:                      $1,500

Installation costs:                $800

Publicity materials:              $800

Reception refreshments:     $1,500


Should the exhibition cease to happen (touch wood!), we will find another venue and/or a new set of dates, and the funds already collected will still be used as mentioned above. No matter what, we will have this exhibition because it is something most of us have been wanting to do for a very long time, and so we won't give up without a fight!


What You Get... (The Perks!)

As you can see on the right, there are various perks we are offering, ranging from a Thank You card personally signed by each artist, to a postcard/greeting card set depicting an artwork from the show by each artist, to customized artworks and portraits. 

Some of the postcard images:

        

           


Customized artworks:

Choose anyone of us to draw something for you! Indicate in the comments section of the customized artwork perk which artist you have chosen.


Single Portraits (1 person in a drawing):

Choose from the following artists to draw your portrait, or a loved one. Indicate in the comments section of the Single Portraits perk which artist you have chosen, and email a high resolution reference image to bricksandcloudsartists@gmail.com

samples by Damien (only 10 available):

  

samples by Stephanie (only 7 available):

   

samples by MaryAnn (only 5 available):

   


samples by Ratna (only 5 available):

  


samples by Yufina (only 15 available):

           



Double Portraits (2 people in a drawing):

samples by Stephanie (only 3 available):

   

samples by Ratna (only 5 available):

  



Get to Know the Artists...

Click here to check out the "Bricks and Clouds" Facebook page, and "LIKE" us!

To find out more about each artist, click on the links beside our names:

  • MaryAnn Loo -- website, Facebook page
  • Ratna Indraputri -- Facebook Page, instagram
  • Damien Thomasz -- website, Facebook page
  • Eva Yen -- portfolio
  • Evelyn -- Facebook album
  • Jaxton Su -- website, instagram
  • Stephanie Lee -- website, instagram 
  • Yufina Senohady --


More about "Bricks and Clouds"...

“Bricks” represent the practical foundations and structures that ensure one’s survivability in modern society, while “Clouds” represent one’s dreams and desires and contain an element of freedom and unpredictability.  Conversely, “Clouds” can also be the blurry distractions that prevent one from seeing reality, represented by “Bricks”.

We seek to explore the opposing yet complimentary forces between thinking and feeling, between what’s logical and illogical, between analytical thinking and following one’s heart.  Our artwork aims to create a visual experience for our audience through paintings and illustrations in various traditional art mediums.


Other Ways You Can Participate...

Share our campaign with your family, friends, and social media followers. We want to reach all who have a passion for creating art, but are hesitant about pursuing their dream of showcasing their work and their talents.

Come to the opening reception on Friday 25 April and meet us! We would love to meet you! And invite your friends, family and everyone you know to attend as well. Even if you can't make it to the opening, just come on one of the other days.


Here are the exhibition details again:

Venue: Claire Loves Gallery, 14 Lorong Telok (Boat Quay), Singapore 049027

Opening Reception: Friday 25 April, 7.30pm

Dates: 25 April - 11 May, 2014 (closed on 27 April, 1 & 4 May)


Thank you for your interest, and your participation in our campaign! See you at the show!


Love,

the "Bricks and Clouds" artists

story:
THE SECRET CITY: WE WORSHIP ART

The Secret City is a radical and unique organization. No one does what we do. We are an Obie-award winning arts organization that serves the spiritual, social and human needs of artists. How do we do this, you may ask -- by holding a monthly service that is part tent revival, part salon, part cabaret. We lift the spirits, inspire the soul, encourage the rebel and the renegade and believe passionately in the power of art and creativity to make the world a better place.

Over the past four years at our monthly gatherings, we have presented hundreds of performers, musicians, visual artists, chefs, jugglers, magicians, clowns, dancers, poets, and films. Since our founding in 2007, we have grown into an amazing community of artists, activists, spiritualists, radicals, friends, performers and seekers of beauty. This September will be the beginning of our fifth year, and we're raising money to keep our mission alive. And we need you!!


The Impact

We are a small grass-roots organization. We do now have a board of directors and will be applying for non-profit status this season. In the meantime- we rely solely on individual donations.


As a community-serving organization, we are dedicated to keeping our services pay-what-you-can. The donations received at our service do not cover the costs, thus most of our annual income must come from other donations and campaigns throughout the year.

Our expenses are not great, especially considering the impact of our work and mission. But, we do have one full-time paid staff member, and expenses to cover, including boring things like rent and supplies, and sexy things like fabric for choir robes. The money from this campaign will go to those costs. Also, with your help, we will begin to pay fees to our guest artists. 

Oh, and thanks to our fiscal sponsor, The Field, your contribution is tax-deductible to the full extent of the law.


Membership -- BECOME A CITIZEN OF THE SECRET CITY!!

Do you just LOVE The Secret City? Well, this year we're introducing a new feature: membership. For a pledge of $150, you will become a Citizen of The Secret City, which will entitle you to member benefits throughout the year, including discounted tickets to Secret City events, discounted tickets to performances by artists who are friends of The Secret City, and other little perks along the way. You'll also be the first to get the newly designed Secret City T-Shirts, debuting this fall. Please consider giving at the $150 level to ensure the life and well-being of The Secret City.

Other Ways You Can Help

$25,000 is a lot of money, especially for a small, grass-roots organization such as ourselves, but we're aiming big because we have big plans in store for next season. So, in addition to giving, we're asking our friends and families to spread the word about this campaign -- via facebook, twitter, personal email lists and more. In only 4 short years, The Secret City has become a unique and vital part of the New York City cultural landscape, please ensure that we continue to thrive by taking an active role in this campaign. Make a pledge, spread the word -- and thanks!! We're connected!!

Do you just LOVE The Secret City? Well, this year we're introducing a new feature: membership. For a pledge of $150, you will become a Citizen of The Secret City, which will entitle you to member benefits throughout the year, including discounted tickets to Secret City events, discounted tickets to performances by artists who are friends of The Secret City, and other little perks along the way. You'll also be the first to get the newly designed Secret City T-Shirts, debuting this fall. Please consider giving at the $150 level to ensure the life and well-being of The Secret City.

Other Ways You Can Help
$25,000 is a lot of money, especially for a small, grass-roots organization such as ourselves, but we're aiming big because we have big plans in store for next season. So, in addition to giving, we're asking our friends and families to spread the word about this campaign -- via facebook, twitter, personal email lists and more. In only 4 short years, The Secret City has become a unique and vital part of the New York City cultural landscape, please ensure that we continue to thrive by taking an active role in this campaign. Make a pledge, spread the word -- and thanks!! We're connected!!

story:
Dear Friend, Fan, or Family...

Karaoke Burlesque is a hot, successful event, but it doesn't make much money-the performers make tips, and the rest of the cash made from a cut of the bar is put directly back into poster making, paying photographers and helpers and promoting the next one...

I want to make the "Spanking Lounge" a permanent part of Karaoke Burlesque, but to do so, KB needs to own some "room dividers" or "pipe and drape" to create the necessarily private space at our host venue Hamburger Mary's.

Also, I'd love to advertise in PQ Monthly for our big ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY PARTY in JUNE, and help make June's KB our biggest and best party so far. If the money is enough, perhaps the Portland Mercury as well.

Maybe with help, we could buy a headset mic for the event, so we don't always have to be figuring out how to get off our clothes with one hand when we are singing.

So, at the suggestion of many friends, I am doing my first experiment in "crowd funding" in hopes that all the Karaoke Burlesque PDX fans, Nikki Lev the Glitter Beast fans, and fans of all or hot performers (Tuaca, Miss M, Marla Jaine, Daemon, Danni St Athens, Shugatits, Lascivious Lenore and MANY MORE) will help us make these goals happen as quickly as possible. To sweeten the pot, you will have all kinds of sexy thank you gifts for your donations.

Your loving Gitter Beast,
Nikki Lev

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Mein Name ist Ingo Lamb und ich bin ein Berliner Fotograf, der mit einer festen Brennweite ohne Blitz auf Berliner Partys und im alternativen und meist queeren Nachtleben unterwegs ist. Dabei entstehen oft Aufnahmen, die die Schönheit, die Lichter und vor allem die einmalige Stimmung der Berliner Clubs wiedergeben. Im alternativen Bereich können Berliner Clubbetreiber und viele Showacts leider selten überhaupt Gagen zahlen – dennoch wünsche ich mir sehr, meine Werke in naher Zukunft in einer Ausstellung zu sehen, denn nur so werden sie vielen Menschen auch außerhalb der virtuellen Welt zugänglich.

Crowdfunding ist für mich daher der Weg, die notwendige Unterstützung zu akquirieren, die ein solches Community-orientiertes Projekt benötigt. Die Produktionskosten dieser Ausstellung überschreiten momentan meine eigenen finanziellen Mittel. Das positive Feedback zu meinen Aufnahmen hat mich aber bestärkt, sie zur Basis meines Crowdfunding-Projektes zu machen. Neben einer Ausstellung möchte ich mit dem Anteil, der darüber hinausgeht, meine Fotoausrüstung aufstocken, um so noch viele funkelnde Momente einfangen zu können.

Wer mich nicht bereits kennt, findet mich bei Facebook unter dem Namen Ingo Lamb - dort poste ich viele der Bilder, ähnlich einem fotografischen Tagebuch. Manche Arbeiten an themenbezogenen Fotoshootings sind auch direkt auf Partys inspiriert worden. Professionalität und Leidenschaft fließen stets in meine Bilder und Schnappschüsse ein. Neben dem ästhetischen Faktor halte ich es aber gleichzeitig für wichtig, den auch in Berlin immer wieder vorkommenden Übergriffen gegen Queers mit meinen Bildern einen Gegenentwurf vorzuhalten, der die bunte Schönheit und die Vielfalt des queeren Nachtlebens zeigt. Meine Bilder werben für Toleranz und ein friedlicheres Miteinander, bei dem wir uns alle friedlich begegnen.
Für Eure Unterstützung danke ich Euch bereits im Voraus.
PS das Shooting für den Alu Dibond- Perk sollte natürlich in Berlin stattfinden.
Alles Liebe, Ingo
 
English version:

Hello my name is Ingo Lamb and I am a Berlin-based photographer, who takes photos with a fixed focus lens and without flashlight. My heart belongs to all the shining places of the Berlin queer underground places and I just love those colours of the night, the locations, the atmosphere and the people having a great time at the party. However, most alternative promoters and show acts in Berlin usually can't pay much to nothing for taking pictures of their extravagant events and crews.
Crowdfunding is thus the right way for me to seek support for my personal wish – that is, to have an exhibition of my own pictures – to let a wider audience enjoy Berlin's queer glamour. The production costs currently exceed my own financial means. Yet as I received so much positive feedback for my pictures, I decided to make them the basis of my crowdfunding-project. With any excessive funding I will stock up my photography equipment to capture even more and even richer moments.

If you don't know me yet, you can learn about my person and work on my Facebook profile (Ingo Lamb). This is also the place where you can see the photographic diary of my past party shootings. Sometimes I am also inspired for more ideas for special photo-shootings at just those partys. The last series were two shootings with queer adaptations of some of my alltime favourite movies.
As a person I also see that there is a still lot of harrassment and violence against queer people even in my beloved home city. I hate it and if things like that happen in the capital, you might imagine its dimensions in smaller cities and rural areas. My aim is thus to fight also with my art against all those prejudices that are sadly a daily part of many queers throughout Germany. My exibition shows the contrary - the harmony and the beauty of queer life in Berlin – to encourage people to get out, to be active for the visible diversity of this city and not only to attend the colourful CSD once a year. From my photographer's point of view it's all the same: if a man and a woman, two men, two women or two queers are kissing passionately, if they feel it, it's their right to show it to everybody. My art aims to improve visibility and tolerance and to encourage everyone to live and meet peacefully together.
I am truly grateful for all your support and hope the perks will get used a lot.

(the shooting for the alu dibond perk should be in berlin.)
Yours, Ingo

story:
Short Summary

We're a group of Photography graduates from UCA Farnham who are going to be exhibiting work at the Truman Brewery as part of the Free Range show (taking place between the 20th and 25th June).

This show is funded entirely by us, and so we are looking for you to help us out with some extra money to help pay for it. This exhibition is, and has been so far, a lot of work and requires a lot of money which we have been working on raising, but any extra money from you would be extremely helpful and greatly appreciated.

This exhibition is very important to those involved as this is our way of getting ourselves into the Art world, so you would be helping many aspiring photographers move forward in their working lives.

What We Need & What You Get

The money you donate will be going towards: publishing catalogues for the show; building materials, paint, etc. for setting up and preparing walls in the exhibition spaces; vans and drivers for transporting materials and the work to the gallery; refreshments for the opening night; publicising; etc.

This is all far too expensive for us to fund out of our own pockets, so your donations will make it easier for us to create the amazing exhibition we are striving for!

The Impact

This exhibition will give us UCA photography graduates the opportunity for our work to be seen by a wider audience. This will improve our chances of employment and provide new and exciting opportunities for us all. The more exciting and professional we can make this exhibition, the more likely we are to draw influencial people in to see our work, so we need you to help us make this possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word about the exhibition is also vital, so please give our website a gander http://www.folka.co.uk/and pass it on to others. You can also follow us on twitter @whatthefolka
Thank you for your time and help and please donate!

story:
Part 1: Welcome to the Rust Belt

This past fall, our project began with a week long intensive workshop involving us graduate students from the Sculpture Department of the Tyler School of Art and MFA students from the Royal Institute of Art in Stockholm. The workshop involved lectures and panel discussion with artists and organizations engaging with America's industrial heritage, as well as excursions to significant sites along the Rust Belt including: the Steel Stacks, Bethlehem, the Global Dye Factory, Philadelphia, the Warhol Museum, the Lackawanna Coal Mine, Lackawanna, and the Mattress Factory, Pittsburg.

 

Part 2: Sweden and beyond.

This May, the project will continue and the same group of graduate students and professors will come together again to further our research and create an exhibition and publication of our investigation and artistic collaborations.
For the first week, we will embark on a second intensive workshop exploring sites of Sweden's industrial heritage in and around Stockholm including:
the Ironworks, World Heritage Site in Engelsberg
Sweden's weapons industry town Grängesberg, and The Nobel Museum

We will then spend the remainder of our trip in Berslagen, home to the historic Stripa iron ore mine using the mine as a platform for artistic collaboration and further development of the ideas and plans initially conceived in Philadelphia.


Our research and conversations will culminate in a collaborative art exhibition and presentation at the Royal Institute of Art, accompanied by a publication documenting the project and the art works that come out of it.
In addition to the exhibition, we are also developing a program with the curator of the museum, Ing-Marie Nilsson-Tarkkanen, which will allow forindividual and collective work, lectures, seminars, and meetings with representatives from the local business community.

 

The Team:

Organized by Karyn Olivier, Professor at the Sculpture Department, Tyler School of Art, Sigrid Sandstrom and Carl Johan Erikson, professors at the Royal Institute of Art, Stockholm, our team includes Tyler MFA Sculpture candidates Adam Brody, Dani Frid Rossi, Jebney Lewis, John Emison, Misha Wyllie and Theresa Sterner, and the Royal Institute MFA candidates Gustaf Londre, Hanna Jagare, Linnea Rygaard, Linus Spangberg, Lisa Gideonsson and Ulrika Lublin


Funding and Expenses:

For the second part of this inter-cultural collaboration, thus far we have happily received support from the Tyler School of Art including a $400 Dean’s travel grant to partially cover airfare for each Tyler graduate, $945 Vice Provost’s arts fund grant to cover part of our expenses which include:
$6,000 airfare
$400 in-country travel
$1,500 publication
$1,000 exhibition materials

At this stage we still need support and funding for the publication, and getting there ofcourse!

As emerging artists working towards terminal degrees in our fields and entering into the global conversation on visual culture, we Tyler Sculpture students are so thrilled to share this project with you, and appreciate any support you can offer as we embark on this exciting international collaboration between institutions and individuals, hopefully the first of many to come!

story:
White Lies is a new multi-media production coming this June to the 2013 National Queer Arts Festival.  The cast is composed of San Francisco Bay Area queer activists, artists, poets, musicians and actors. Our production aims to bring humor and hope to conversations about race and racism by blending together many mediums in a night of performance and conversation.

Our cast is composed of many movers and shakers in the San Francisco Bay Area LGBTQ arts scene including nomy lamm, StormMiguel Florez, Jezebel Delilah X, Eli Conley, Susie Smith, Jolie Harris, Mel Chen, Meredith Fenton, Kentucky Fried Woman and Open Mike. 

Our cast is developing the performance in a collaborative process of discussion, workshops, music and script development, film production, and more traditional rehearsals. Because of the sensitive nature of the topic of whiteness and race, we are using personal narratives and social justice discourse as the basis of our production to be able to speak from personal places that will make our content more resonant with our audiences. We are confident that the result will be a dynamic, multi-media, full-length performance.

White Lies will debut as part of the National Queer Arts Festival at the African-American Arts and Culture Complex on June 23rd, 2013.

Your support will help us pay for costumes, props and rehearsal space, provide ASL interpretation during the performance, and pay our artists and crew. With any extra funds, our intention is also that White Lies, after debuting in June, can be performed in a series of performances coupled with discussions about racial justice in LGBTQ communities around the Bay Area and beyond. 

Because conversations about race and racism are so crucial to our communities, we want to ensure that White Lies is accessible to as many people as possible and are committed to finding diverse means to fund this production.  Your support via this Indie-a-Go-Go campaign is a huge piece of our success.

To learn about other ways to support and engage with White Lies, follow our Facebook page at facebook.com/WhiteLiestheShow.

story:
Short Summary

"I want to do that!" With all the thought and insight that a 13 year old could muster, those were the words middle school aged Matt DeYoung said that started his journey into photography. Matt was looking at old negatives and photos his dad had taken of his drag racing adventures and some nature shots. Still holding on to that first love to this day Matt's passion is capturing the excitement of the track, the open road, the cars that drive them past and present along with nature in the still frame of a camera lens and making it come alive to the viewer.

As Matt has grown in talent and intellect since then he has also seen his dream evolve into making a difference with his craft. His upcoming Light gallery being displayed at various venues around the Phoenix area is a culmination of his art and faith coming together to provoke thought and offer a spiritual challenge to even the casual observer. Matt studied Photography at Arizona State University. "I'm one of those individuals who loves people. I want my work to reflect the Light in my life and encourage other people to do the same in their own way. One of my favorite parts of taking pictures is seeing peoples faces, when they look at a piece of art, or a picture and seeing their reaction. Sometimes such a simple thing can really change a life." - Matt

Our Light

Have you ever wondered how many people see you a day? Take a minute tomorrow and look around at one point in your day and see how many people are around you. The Our Light Series is a series that is installed in a location that contains thousands of different peopleís portraits(printed in small black and white format.) When you walk through the Exhibit of these portraits that are hanging from the ceiling you get the over whelming feeling of people looking at you. The verse Matthew 5:16 is displayed on the wall in this dimly lit, calm space (In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good deeds and praise your Father in Heaven). How you are living your life each day? How do people see you? Are you truly letting the light that God has given you shine to its greatest ability?

Kylie and I need the funds to be able to print these thousands of photographs and have them read to be hung in The New City Studio on November 2nd 2012. We would greatly appreciate your help! Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

Kylie and I are currently raising the funding to print all of the images for the Our Light gallery which be be at The New City Studio for the month of November (Opening Night, First Friday, November 2nd).  With every donation of at least $50.00 you can choose from haveing one of the prints that Kylie and I have made in the past, or a copy of the opening night poster signed by me and Kylie.  We would like to take a minute to thank you all for your support so far in our careers, and would like to thank you in advance for your future support!

The Impact

This is a big task with a very simple meaning that we hope will simply bring out the best of us in this world. Kylie and I simply want to let our light shine within our community and see where God takes us from there.  This gallery will have a huge meaning and we hope for it to impact the viewers as much as it impacts us on a day to day basis while we are working on the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you all may not be able to help us out fincaially but you can help us out by telling your friends and fmaily about this fundraiser and seeing if they can help support us.  We also need prayers from all you, we have had this gallery project on our hearts and minds for a couple years and God has finally opened doors for us to run with it, we ask that you join us in prayer to let God use this gallery for what He wants to. Thank you so much for your support!

Kylie and I are currently raising the funding to print all of the images for the Our Light gallery which be be at The New City Studio for the month of November (Opening Night, First Friday, November 2nd).  With every donation of at least $50.00 you can choose from haveing one of the prints that Kylie and I have made in the past, or a copy of the opening night poster signed by me and Kylie.  We would like to take a minute to thank you all for your support so far in our careers, and would like to thank you in advance for your future support!


The Impact
This is a big task with a very simple meaning that we hope will simply bring out the best of us in this world. Kylie and I simply want to let our light shine within our community and see where God takes us from there.  This gallery will have a huge meaning and we hope for it to impact the viewers as much as it impacts us on a day to day basis while we are working on the project.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that you all may not be able to help us out fincaially but you can help us out by telling your friends and fmaily about this fundraiser and seeing if they can help support us.  We also need prayers from all you, we have had this gallery project on our hearts and minds for a couple years and God has finally opened doors for us to run with it, we ask that you join us in prayer to let God use this gallery for what He wants to. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Hello!

We are Victoria and Noah Barratt, young parents living in Asheville, and we know just what this city needs -- The Rumpus Room! We offer a safe, stimulating environment where all children can enjoy and be challenged by arts workshops and performances. And our drop-in service lets parents take time to relax, run errands, or even go on a date!

Victoria is a teacher, licensed in North Carolina. In addition to teaching for Asheville City Schools, she has worked as a private tutor and as a summer camp director. She has a passion for "learning through doing" and has extensive experience working with children of all ages.

Noah is an Asheville-based musician with experience working with people with special needs. Noah works one-on-one with people with Autism to fulfill personal goals and maximize independence. After leading the local band Slamming Door Orchestra in the production of two albums, he is currently making his first solo album.

Sparrow is our one year-old daughter. She loves taking care of her dogs and cats and rabbits and chickens and fish!

 

The Rumpus Room works like this:

Tuesday-Friday

9:30-11:30- Toddler Time- (walking to 2 years)

“Toddler Time” focuses on movement. The little ones will be up and moving in dance, acting, song, exploration, tumbling and much more. Snack will be included.

  

12:30-2:30- Pre-K Play (2 years to Kindergarden)

“Pre-K Play” is all about creativity. The pre-k groups will explore the arts though acting, painting, collage, dance, puppet making, miming, and more. Snack will be included.

 

 3:00-5:00- Arts After School (Kindergarden to 5th grade)

“Arts After School” is the perfect after school activity. Students will begin the session by starting their homework from school. Assisted by a licensed teacher, children will get their work out of the way before the creative activity begins. Arts After School will often be led by a local artist and will feature daily projects such as improvisation, sculpting, found-object art, collage, playwriting, and much more. Snack will be included.

 

Friday and Saturday

6:45-9:00- Live Shows (All ages welcome, Pre-kindergarten students should be accompanied by an adult)

On Friday and Saturday nights, The Rumpus Room will host live performances for kids, showcasing the immensely talented artists of our community. Grade school children may be dropped off for these shows, and preschool children are welcome to attend with an adult. The whole family is invited! Concessions will be included with the purchase of a ticket.

 

Everyone Is Welcome!

The Rumpus Room is pleased to provide scholarships for families in need. Through the aid of fundraising events and community donors, we are committed to providing arts-enrichment for every child. We will deliver scholarship applications to local schools and community centers to ensure that families in need know they are welcome.

Additionally, The Rumpus Room staff is trained to assist children with special needs. We will strive to accommodate every face of our community.   

 

We Need You!

With your help, The Rumpus Room will soon be an option for the families of Asheville. We plan for an early 2013 grand opening in a central location. Your donation will help this project become a reality.

We need $4,000 before our doors can open. The money we are asking for here will be used toward the cost of seating, theater lights and curtains, educational toys, art supplies, healthy snacks, diapers, and tables. We plan to support local businesses as best we can in these purchases.

Remember: you're not just investing in one family, but in all families of our community!

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate right now? Don't worry -- You can still join the cause! Please tell people about The Rumpus Room and encourage them to visit this page to help out! Use the share tools to let your facebook, twitter, etc., pals in on Asheville's new standard for childcare.
