story:
Who am I and what am I doing?

My name is Jeanette Jobson.  I am a visual artist, living on the northeast coast of Newfoundland and Labrador.  Being surrounded by water, it, and the creatures that swim and live in it strongly influence my work, either through paintings of water and boats or my work with gyotaku (fish printing).

Fishy Bits! is an extension of my previous work with fish, which is documented  visually through images, video and print in The Gyotaku Project on my website. This series of relief print in 2013 will broaden my experience in the technical aspects of printmaking and provide exposure for others to the range of cold water marine fish that live in these northern and island waters.

Each month in 2013 I will produce an original print of a different fish found in local water, creating a series of twelve unique pieces.  Each print is developed from my original drawing which is transferred or drawn directly onto a piece of lino and hand carved using traditional techniques and tools. The design and production of twelve prints in this 2013 series will give an “up close and personal” view of twelve individual species of cold water marine fish.  While stylized, the prints produced are based on real fish and are original representational pieces of art.

I use a variety of Japanese washi papers for printing, as well as printmaking papers and specialty handmade papers. My preference is for Japanese papers for the quality of prints they produce and the tradition behind them. Oil based inks are used to print from the carved plates, providing a crisp image with a lasting archival footprint. Each print measures 4” x 6” and has a generous border to allow for signature, framing and showcasing the piece.   The choice of paper type and ink colours will be my choice and will vary in each print run. 

 

What do I Need?

Currently, I am producing my prints without a printing press, relying on a simple baren or wooden spoon to adhere the ink to the paper’s surface and hand pull the prints.  While this does provide a quality print, it is more time intensive and consistency of print images is not reliable, with more rejected pieces and waste of resources.  It also limits my range of printmaking to relief prints only.

A printing press would allow me to achieve consistent print quality and expand my range of printmaking into etchings, as well as enabling me to share.  Your contribution to this project will allow me to purchase an entry level Jack Richeson Baby printing press to ensure a consistent printing quality, as well as enable the purchase of additional supplies of lino plates, professional cutting tools, inks and Japanese papers to complete the project at the professional level that I strive to deliver to all my collectors.

 

My Promise to Deliver

I am committed to complete this project in 2013 and deliver all perks as promised, whether full funding is received or not. Two fish prints are complete and the March print is being carved, ready for printing and release on the 15th of the month. A short video on the carving of the March block can be seen here and more information in the form of photos of new prints and process video will be provided monthly as the project unfolds and new prints are released.

I completed a year long project on gyotaku in 2010-2011, funded through the Newfoundland and Labrador Arts Council, successfully producing more than 40 original gyotaku prints from a variety of local fish as well as a book, The Gyotaku Project, documenting the process. More information about this project and samples of my work can be viewed at on my website www.jeanettejobson.com

I am a prolific artist and this project is a portion of the art that I will produce in 2013.  I am represented in two local art galleries and have several exhibitions each year.  I am also a founding member of Arts Northeast, a local art group for networking and learning.  I have served on boards of art associations and as online mentor and moderator in art forums and teach workshops and classes in a variety of art techniques.  I take pride in providing professional service and quality and guarantee all my work.

 

The Impact of your Contribution

Your contribution supports the professional quality and production of a series of unique prints as well as helping me expand the range of printmaking that I can offer. Access to professional equipment and supplies opens a whole new avenue for printmaking, not only for me, but in teaching others the printmaking process in local workshops.  Having the right tools and equipment to ensure consistent results can inspire others to expand their artistic horizons.

Your contribution exposes more people to the world of cold water marine fish found in island and northern waters, with an opportunity to own an original piece of art that is within the price range of most budgets.

 

How to monitor your investment - updates

Each new print will be released on the 15th of each month and will also be available for purchase on my website www.jeanettejobson.com under the Fishy Bits! Header until December 31, 2013.  As each print is released, an update and image will be provided as a “heads up” for perk recipients and collectors to watch their mailboxes for the newest fish.

Budget– Where does your money go?

Jack Richeson Baby Press              $815

Pusher & Catcher                          $ 45  

Lino plates                                  $  60

Cutting Tools                               $100

Oil based inks                              $  85

Japanese paper                            $175

Shipping & admin fees                   $400

TOTAL                                                     $1680

 

What happens if funding goes over or under expectation?

If the full funding amount is not raised, the project will still go ahead and I’ll look at other options for less expensive printing equipment and supplies.   If funding exceeds the requested amount, I’ll investigate the next level up in printing equipment and traditional Japanese cutting tools as well as other professional printmaking supplies and work expanding the range and type of prints I can offer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution doesn’t have to be financial. 

Sharing this project with friends and colleagues spreads the word to other investors. Put it on your Facebook page, Twitter feed, share it on your website, let people you work with know about it.  The more people who see the project, the better chance there is of reaching my goal.

Indiegogo also has a range of tools available to help share the message.  Check them out.

 

Thank you for considering this project for a contribution!

story:
Short Summary

In 2010, this massive danceable art piece was built to be adorned by San Francisco artist Ian Ross. During its inaugural exhibition, several hundred people experienced dancing on this incredible piece.  

It was discovered, however, that the foundation for the dancefloor requires additional engineering to make it fully safe and functional. Additionally, parts of the mural were damaged during transportation.  It needs restoration and a new transportation rack. 

This piece is too beautiful to be left unused. Please help us reinvigorate it for future exhibitions!

The Ian Ross Dance Floor Mural was originally commissioned by Rosie Lila with the support of the following donors and supporting contributors: Ken Masters, Nola Turner, Dave Schiessl, "Fancy Dave", Bobby Fantastic,  Shane Demorais, Sergio Lialin, and other community members.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $3500 in the month of May for the following tasks:

  • Space rental to work on the floor
  • Commissioning Ian for the mural repairs
  • Paint supplies
  • Truck rental costs to transport the floor so that it can be worked on
  • Commissioning builders to work on the foundation of the floor
  • Commissioning builders to construct a new transportation rack for over 2,000 pounds of components
  • All work is to be completed in June, 2012
If we do not reach our goal, we will proceed with the project regardless, and will seek funding from additional private donors; however we hope that our community will support us in moving this project forward. 
 
Our perks include a limited edition Thank You Card with a print of an original painting by Ian Ross, commissioned specifically for this campaign. There are only 75 prints available in this serialed edition. 

We also have, for our higher level donors, VIP ticket packages for the Movement Play Microfestival (June 22-25, 2012 - Willits, CA), in addition to an exclusive uber-swanky very private Thank You Dinner in July prepared by award-winning "Best Young Chef In The World" Reilly Meehan.

 
 

The Impact

If you are a supporter of the arts, if you love dance, if you love helping people create their dreams, then this is THE opportunity for you to help bring a stunning project to public access where it can serve to inspire the masses with beauty and creativity. No contribution is too small (or too large) - every dollar helps.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are firstly seeking financial contributions, but you can also help in these ways:

  • Spread the word about this campaign through your Facebook, Twitter, and other communication resources
  • Come to one of our work days in San Francisco in June, 2012. Email hello@movementplay.com for details.

story:
Hello,

I am Jessica Patricia Kichoncho Karuhanga. I have recently been invited to present my work at the esteemed Black Portraiture{s} II: Re-imaging the Black Body in the West and Re-staging Histories. This is the sixth of a series of conferences organized by Harvard University and Tisch School of the Arts at NYU that will bring prominent artists and academics from around the world to discuss the image of the black body in the West. My panel is the first ever in the series to bring a Canadian perspective to this highly visible international platform.

This year the conference will run from May 28, 2015 - May 31, 2015 in Florence, Italy. 

You will find the most current itinerary here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/2015-black-portraitures-ii-conference-imaging-the-black-body-and-re-staging-histories-tickets-15142672140 

You may experience most of my work here:  http://jessicakaruhanga.com/home.html

What I Need & What You Get


I am requesting $3, 000 CAD to mitigate the expense of what will doubtless be a critically engaging and provocative experience. Your supporting my campaign will contribute to research, professional development, a round-trip flight from Toronto, Canada to Florence, Italy, accommodations, inner-city travel and  food, campaign hosting fees, online transaction fees as well as labor and production costs of the gifts you will receive as incentive. Gifts will range from artist multiples such as zines of poetry and drawings, video performances and for those living in the Greater Toronto Area, dinner with me at my home. Gifts will be delivered in Summer 2015.


Why Your Support Matters


Black lives matter. Black art matters. Black scholarship matters. This summer I found myself at the threshold of an apex. What I witnessed unfolding in other darkened landscapes, anti-blackness everywhere, is deeply and inextricably also mine. It moves. It aches. It's as though a fading fracture has split wide open. I'm also trying, still, to wrap my head around how these moments continue to obliterate, enfold or shift my intentions, efforts, and force within this opportunity to present in Florence and convene with artists and scholars across the diaspora. It is significant to be on a panel full of black self-identified women, especially from Canada, and the invariable on-going erasures we endure. 

I'm incredibly humbled to be sharing this panel with my inimitable and brilliant colleagues Ella Cooper, Dr. Andrea Fatona, and Camille Turner. Our presence at this conference is crucial. It is crucial to my growth as an emerging and aspiring artist, cultural producer and thinker. It is crucial to an on-going conversation that foregrounds Black Canadian arts and scholarship, at home as well as abroad. Together we will continue to unearth discussions on blackness from our varying and unique perspectives that emerge from a multitude of possible expressions. To claim that we are fully representing Canada would be a disservice to the multivalent, radical, radiant and nuanced forms of recognition that exist within the porous borders of our home landscape.  


Resilience amid adversaries and precarity


Currently, I support myself solely  from a full-time  minimum-wage job. This is barely a living wage when one considers the cost of living in a dynamic space such as Toronto. Beyond the  fixed or readily determined bills within a strict budget there are expenses one cannot anticipate (i.e health ). I have only recently qualified for recognition as a "professional artist" within most Canadian granting programs and organizations. Unfortunately, even if I do receive the grants I am eligible for they will likely manifest as reimbursement. I am simply not in a position to sponsor myself during the interim. This is why I am asking you dearest friends, colleagues and the public to support my campaign and ensure my necessary presence at this conference.


Other Supportive Gestures


I recognize some of you  cannot financially contribute. Know that your nourishment, engagement and thoughtful criticism  have been and still remain significant gifts to me. Also, there are many ways, beyond the monetary, that you can help or show your support. For example, you can share my campaign within your social spheres via email or social media (i.e. Facebook, Google+, twitter, Instagram, tumblr, etcetera).


Special thanks to the following for helping me put this campaign together:

Golboo Amani, Jane Devereaux, Maggie Flynn, Nayrouz Abu Hatoum, Serene Husni, Angela Crystal Tumuhairwe Karuhanga, Stephanie May Rutooza Karuhanga, Manolo Lugo, and Lido Pimienta

Credits:

* Still from performance  (A Still Cling To Fading Blossoms, 2014) documented by Paz Ramirez Larrain

* Video by Serene Husni featuring a performance (Bone Black Dust and Sky Lickers, 2014) documented by  Paz Ramirez Larrain.

also mine. It moves. It aches. It's as though a fading fracture has split
wide open. I'm also trying, still, to wrap my head around how these moments
continue to obliterate, enfold or shift my intentions, efforts, and force within
this opportunity to present in Florence and convene with artists
and scholars across the diaspora. It is significant to be on a panel full of
black self-identified women, especially from Canada, and the invariable on-going erasures we
endure. 
I'm incredibly humbled to be sharing this panel with my inimitable
and brilliant colleagues Ella Cooper, Dr. Andrea Fatona, and Camille Turner. Our presence at this conference is crucial. It is crucial to my growth as an emerging and aspiring artist, cultural producer and thinker. It is crucial to an on-going conversation that foregrounds Black Canadian arts and scholarship, at home as well as abroad. Together we will continue to unearth discussions on blackness from our varying and unique perspectives that emerge from a multitude of possible expressions. To claim that we are fully representing Canada would be a disservice to the multivalent, radical, radiant and nuanced forms of recognition that exist within the porous borders of our home landscape.  

Resilience amid adversaries and precarity

Currently, I support myself solely  from a full-time  minimum-wage job. This is barely a living wage when one considers the cost of living in a dynamic space such as Toronto. Beyond the  fixed or readily determined bills within a strict budget there are expenses one cannot anticipate (i.e health ). I have only recently qualified for recognition as a "professional artist" within most Canadian granting programs and organizations. Unfortunately, even if I do receive the grants I am eligible for they will likely manifest as reimbursement. I am simply not in a position to sponsor myself during the interim. This is why I am asking you dearest friends, colleagues and the public to support my campaign and ensure my necessary presence at this conference.


   Other Supportive Gestures 
I recognize some of you  cannot financially contribute. Know that your nourishment, engagement and thoughtful criticism  have been and still remain significant gifts to me. Also, there are many ways, beyond the monetary, that you can help or show your support. For example, you can share my campaign within your social spheres via email or social media (i.e. Facebook, Google+, twitter, Instagram, tumblr, etcetera).
  Special thanks to the following for helping me put this campaign together:Golboo Amani, Jane Devereaux, Maggie Flynn, Nayrouz Abu Hatoum, Serene Husni, Angela Crystal Tumuhairwe Karuhanga, Stephanie May Rutooza Karuhanga, Manolo Lugo, and Lido PimientaCredits:* Still from performance  (A Still Cling To Fading Blossoms, 2014) documented by Paz Ramirez Larrain* Video by Serene Husni featuring a performance (Bone Black Dust and Sky Lickers, 2014) documented by  Paz Ramirez Larrain.

story:
Statues Of New York

By Tommy Parker

Thank you for taking the time to read this brief explanation of my project!

New York has put tons of money in marketing the city to promote and keep tourism! One thing I am so surprised of is they haven’t used one of the most historical things that are right in peoples faces every single day.

The STATUES!

They are placed all over the city and have more history behind them them most people know!

As early as the mid 1800's these statues have been a fixture of New York city.

Well with my photography I plan to capture that history.

I am going to combine history art and technology all in one book! So let me explain!

There will be 3 Types books of Statues of New York!

How the book will look.

As you go thru the pages you will see beautiful color and black and white photos of all the statues! Underneath each photo will be a brief description. The description will have the name of the statue the name of the artist when it was built and a street crossing (example 53 &3)

also it will have an index reference number like (A23) you will go to the back of the book in the index area and look for that number and you will see a 5 sentence paragraph about the history of that statues!

This is how we combine ART and HISTORY together.

Now the TECHNOLOGY. There will be a QR scan code on the inside of the book. When the customer scans this code it will pop up a pin point map of all the statues all over New York City. Now you can go visit!

The 3 types of Books

First and most important book is the small least expensive travel book edition!

This is the book that will be in every gift shop airport library book store world wide.. this is the book that will be around for hundreds and hundreds of years!

Tourist will love grabbing this book at all the stores

Second Book

Now this book is going to be your Large Traditional Coffee table book edition

this book will have all the same stuff as the smaller book does but will be the one sold more online and library’s and Barnes and Nobles Amazon etc

this will also be a large selling book but more for looks

Third Book

Now this is the Special collectors edition book!

There will only be 300 printed each one in black velvet covers engraved in gold lettering with the title

each book will be presented with a set of white gloves and one signed and numbered print of one statue

I have hired on a historian for this book to work on the historical content of this book Danny Ivetic

I am talking to 2 different publishing companies right now who are guarantee me to be in Barnes and noble and over seas in Europe and Asia

also amazon and gift stores all over NYC and beyond. To help create a best seller!

Tommy Parker

story:
The Lab: Wilmington Community Darkroom is a soon to be 501c3 non-profit organization offering facilities and workshops available for public use.  We offer memberships to experienced darkroom photographers as well as classes and workshops for those who are new to traditional photography.

 

To provide Wilmington and surrounding areas with an affordable, nurturing place to practice, learn and experiment with photography.  The Lab is a professionally equipped facility with a traditional darkroom, digital lab, workspace and gallery that can be used for personal photography projects.

story:
What If Artists Designed A Hostel?


Who Are We? What Do We Want To Achieve?

East Street Arts is a contemporary arts organisation in Leeds. Our mission is to focus on the development of artists through a comprehensive events programme, membership activities, professional development, and studio/facility provision.

East Street Arts empowers artists through opportunities and engages wide audiences into the arts with a welcoming attitude.

After 20 years of working within the arts, we are are very excited to bring you our latest, very exciting project:

Leeds' first ever social enterprise Art Hostel.


This project has been in the making for years, and we now have a venue confirmed for this pop up hostel.

Our belief is to create a space where visitors experience the city in a different light and discover the alternative.

THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOU!

We have secured the space, but we need a budget to allow artists' minds to have all the creative freedom they need to design and make this Art Hostel to be as unique as possible.

All money raised will cover the wages and material costs to deliver a series of artist commission works, making a range from permenant decor, artworks, and temporary activities and happenings.

The more we raise, the more we will make happen.

Leeds has a thriving grassroot and DIY art scene. The Art Hostel puts a stake in the ground and makes a foundation for artistic practice to grow from, as well as a landing platform for people to enter into the city's culture.

This is a chance for us all to really invest in what our city has to offer.


What We Need & How You Can Help

We have outlined an initial foundation for full Art Hostel design and activity which requires £5000.

This will ensure all artists, payment of wages, material costs, and any other requirments along the way.

This budget is enough to complete decor and artistic presence in every nook and cranny of the Art hostel.

Imagine the people who know how to stretch their imaginations to the furthest reaches of the galaxy allowed an entire building as a canvas to design the alternative in every way! It's almost impossible to visualise how amazing and barmy this will be - that's why we want to make it a reality!

 At East Street Arts, we work constantly to liberate artists to make a real difference to our lives through our everyday surroundings and experiences. You can see more of what we do on our website http://eaststreetarts.org.uk/

This project is about building a creative and supportive community. Even if you can't afford to assist in a financial way, please help spread the word, or get involved in whatever way you can.

Together we can make this happen!

SUPPORT THE ART HOSTEL!

story:
It is said that the hardest time to own a business is in its first few years...help us survive through these tough waters so we can flourish later. 

My name is Bee Robinson. I'm a witch, eccentric artist, paranormal investigator and unfortunately a poor college student. Magick & Macabre Co. is my dream. It's what I was made to do. It wasn't until this year I realized this completely after a lot of trial and error in my life. With Magick & Macabre Co. every day is an adventure. Every day I get to meet awesome, inspiring people. I get to hear stories from customers who enjoy my products, who believe my products truly help them express themselves. It's magical.

I partnered up with some of the closest people to me in my life, Carly, my sister &  Kat. Who have graciously agreed to come along for the ride, no matter how bumpy it may get. We believe that Magick & Macabre Co. has what it takes to be successful. We can feel it. 

All it takes is some help from people who believe in us. People like you. 

A little can go a long way. Right now, we're funding for a gazebo/popup tent of our own so we can stop borrowing from friends, cover fees for future events, table cloths for our booth, supplies to make more products, and overall maintenance things like gas to events, paper towels for cleaning up after bath bombs, ink for our printer so we can print out shipping labels. Stuff like that. Stuff we need...desperately.

Can you help keep the magick alive? Every little bit helps a lot!


What We Need & What You Get

This Indiegogo is going to help in amazing ways. Your funding will go directly towards helping us remain in business through the hardest time of Magick & Macabre Co.'s business life. The beginning.  
Your funding will help us get:
  • A new gazebo/pop up tent of our own.
  • Another 6ft table for our booth.
  • Booth displays: jewelry racks, bathbomb containers, tablecloths etc.
  • General product creation supplies: essential oils, dried herbs, citric acid, crystals, necklace chains, candle molds, the whole nine yards.
  • Event cover fees. Every event we apply to requires a cover fee. It can be anywhere from $10 to $200 depending on the size of the event. The more money we have in the bank, the more events we can line up, the more exposure and business we'll get.
  • General office supplies; tape, paper towels, ink, etc.
  • Transportation Fees. 
  • Indiegogo fees: they take a certain amount. If we reach our goal it's 4%, if we don't it's 9%. All the more reason for you to help us reach our goal! 
We have prepared various perks for helping us along the way especially for you! 

The Impact

We want to help spread spirituality, individuality and art to our customers in affordable ways. We make our items all in a positive environment making sure that it's all infused with good vibrations. We want to be able to continue doing this. 

Our Etsy is a 5 star shop with 12 heartfelt reviews from past customers. Although it says we've been a shop since 2013 on our Etsy, we've only really been in business since January 2015. 12 5 Star reviews and  69 sales in this time period is phenomenal even by Etsy's standards, and that's not even counting our sister Storenvy shop. We have many returning customers and try to make every customer feel special and important to us because, they are. We want to keep this tradition alive more than anything. We don't want to have to start cutting corners due to budget restrictions. 

Risks & Challenges

Keeping our shop operational is difficult when you lose motivation due to financial struggles. We try our hardest to make everything according to our high standards of product guidelines so they're perfect for our customers. We tried doing this for six months without having to ask for help, but the time has come that we start asking. We can't keep doing this if we don't get a little extra help. 

We are still in college. So, balancing Magick & Macabre Co. and school is often difficult for us. Especially when we're stressing over not having enough money to restock our shop. These items all take time to make and sometimes it feels like a fruitless task. Your funding will help take some of this weight off our shoulders. Even if all you donate is a dollar, it helps.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is willing to make a straight up donation to us, and that's okay. If you'd rather purchase something from our etsy, it still helps a lot. The link is below and we have tons of fabulous products.
If you can't afford to donate help us by spreading the word. Networking is key. Share the word about our fundraiser everywhere. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, print our flyers, make flyers whatever you're good at to help. Magick & Macabre Co. is a creative business and we love it when our supporters (bumblebats) are creative as well! 

PURCHASE DIRECTLY FROM OUR ETSY.

LIKE US ON FACEBOOK.

FOLLOW US ON TWITTER.

FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM.

FOLLOW US ON TUMBLR.

These can all help us remain in business. Thank you so much for your support. 

Blessings & all the love in the world,

-Bee, Carly, & Kat.

Share the word about our fundraiser everywhere. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, print our flyers, make flyers whatever you're good at to help. Magick & Macabre Co. is a creative business and we love it when our supporters (bumblebats) are creative as well!

These can all help us remain in business. Thank you so much for your support. Blessings & all the love in the world,
-Bee, Carly, & Kat.

story:
Friends and Family, Friends of Family, Family of Friends,

Here is the truth of it. The Good Work and the Righteous Path is service unto others. Through the wisdom of the unity of all, we know that to render service and aid to others is an act of devotion to the deepest kernel of the self. This is our intention, to grow as individuals and achieve heights from which we can rightfully lend aid to those in need. 

This is who we are: two transformative artists on the threshold of an important opportunity. Elijah Kane Chong has been accepted into the Masters of Art Therapy and Counseling program at Southwestern College in Santa Fe, New Mexico. This is an achievement he has been working towards over the past three years. This wondrous opportunity will allow him to transmute his personal work as an artist into a practice of healing. Joining him on this adventure, Aubrey Schwartz is a theatre mask designer and massage therapist who will utilize her time in Santa Fe expanding her knowledge of therapeutic techniques and modalities at the Santa Fe School of Massage and the White Cloud Institute. Together we are on a mission of furthering our education and expanding our talents. This is our cause, to combine our efforts in the formation of a holistic healing practice that addresses the physical, mental, and spiritual needs of the client. Much work and energy remains to be put into achieving this goal, and we are committed and ready to follow through, but we are in need of some assistance in taking the next step and relocating from New Orleans to Santa Fe. Elijah's first semester at Southwestern College begins in January; the immediacy of this move and the help that we need is not lost on us.

The Gift of Giving

There is a growing and crucial need for mental health services in our global society. By supporting our cause, you will be helping one couple on their journey to fill that need. Your contribution will germinate into a blossoming practice of healing and will emanate with every individual who will be helped along the way. 

Every major move in life comes with costs and risks. In anticipation of this, we are initiating this campaign to help cover the expenses of relocating and starting a new chapter. We are hoping that with your kindest support we can raise enough money to ensure a stress free move. Any amount that you can help with is graciously appreciated and all contributions will be put forth to this transition.

We are energetic beings, forever grateful, who believe in the law of reciprocal exchange, which is why we aren't asking for your help for nothing in return. As artists, we have the ability to offer you something unique, original transformative artwork designed and executed according to your requests. We have set up the following incentive packages as a show of gratitude for your support:

$10 for a high quality fine art print from Elijah

$25 for a set of 3 fine art prints from Elijah

$25 for an aromatherapy product from Aubrey

$50 for an original 7" x 7" mandala painting on fine art paper from Elijah

$50 for a set of 3 aromatherapy products from Aubrey

$100 for an original 10" x 10" mandala painting on fine art paper from Elijah

$250 for an original 15" x 15" mandala painting on fine art paper from Elijah

$300 for an original sculptural mask from Aubrey

$500 for an original 20" x 20" mandala painting on fine art paper from Elijah

Note that all original artworks will be treated as commissioned pieces by the artist. The intention behind our work is to create spiritually uplifting objects with healing potential. Our artwork functions as objects of meditation with the power of transformation. Further contact will be made and a dialogue formed to clarify the energy to be invoked by each piece. Leave your email address or other contact information along with your contribution. Please visit Elijah's website to get a sense of his work, or view our image gallery here for examples of previous works.

This campaign will certainly result in a backlog of projects to be created. We ask that you practice patience when awaiting your gift, as they will take time to complete. Updates on project completions will be posted on this tumblr.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we understand, but there are other ways you may help. Perhaps you know someone who is able to donate and would like an original work of art in return! Please utilize Indiegogo's share features and help spread the word.

Other Ways You Can Help



If you are unable to contribute financially, we understand, but there are other ways you may help. Perhaps you know someone who is able to donate and would like an original work of art in return! Please utilize Indiegogo's share features and help spread the word.

story:
My Story

I felt it necessary to try and capture as much of my family's heritage as I could as I slowly saw the elder generations fading away. All of the great stories I heard as a kid, the traditions, sacrifices and everything they had to endure to become AMERICAN needed to be recorded. These things would be lost to posterity if I did not begin gathering them in at least notebook form. The novel and subsequent screenplay accurately capture my family's story for eternity. In the writing of the novel and screenplay, I realized my family's experiences were not unique; therefore my story is your story.

While countless films have been produced about the New York, Chicago, and Philadelphia mafia family's, MORE LIKE BOTHERS features a different cast of real characters from Camden, New Jersey.  Back in the 1920's and 1930's, the Little Italy section of Camden was a hotbed for Organized Crime linked to Philadelphia and New York.


What We Need & What You Get

We are currently seeking ten thousand dollars ($10,000) to cover casting and pre-production expenses for the feature film MORE LIKE BROTHERS, slated to begin principal photography on February 1st, 2016.

The uniqueness of this film lends itself to an equally unique bundle of perks for donors. Please click on the "Perks" page of this campaign to learn more!


The Impact

We live in an incredibly technical and complicated time, where messages and images are sent and received immediately. Part of the charm of this film is the fact that it transports us to a much simpler and less complicated era. The team we have assembled has an uncanny ability to bring the 1930's to life, as evidenced in the powerful theatrical trailer attached to this campaign. Additionally, the importance and size of this film will generate many jobs for more talented people.


Risks & Challenges

Recreating the late 1930's presented unique and complex challenges for our talented production team. This became evident during the filming of the theatrical trailer. We've learned from this experience. We successfully produced and edited two and a half minutes of film and transported our audience to that era. Now, our goal is to accomplish the same on a grander scale. We need YOUR help to reach this goal! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Social media in the 1930's did not exist. It does now! Please post, like, share, Tweet, Instagram, email, or utilize any other form of media you are most comfortable with to get the word out about MORE LIKE BROTHERS.

story:
who am i and what am i doing?

according to my twitter profile (aka the most concise bio i have ever written), i'm a queer (theatre) devisor, artist, activist, knitter, yogi, writer, and baker. i would like to add craftivist and all-around awkward canadian to that list. i have two theatre degrees, am the artistic director of collaborative devising physical company curiouser theatre, and also the hands and heart behind sunflower knit, my knits & non-knits  company. most of my world is spent playing with fibre and working with others in interdisciplinary performance. 

i have been accepted into the white rabbit arts open air residency, taking place this august in economy, nova scotia. basically, i get to camp on a farm for a week along the beautiful bay of fundy with a bunch of other artists from varying disciplines. we'll be working together in workshops and team activities, as well as working on our own projects. 

my plans for the week include the creation of a soundscape for the next curiouser theatre project, and playing with natural dyes using materials from the surrounding environment. the soundscape will be my main focus. a soundscape is like a soundtrack, but using a collection of sounds/noises rather than music. 

our theatre company uses all sorts of inspiration to create shows that look at opening up dialogue around taboo and difficult societal issues. sometimes it's a photo, sometimes an old story, sometimes a scent caught on the wind. sound is always a big inspiration for us though. the theory and use of aurality in performance has played a large role in our devising processes so far, and for this next project, we're using it as a starting point. what kind of show could be created if you're starting with just a broad theme and a soundscape of found noises? that 's what i'm going to find out this summer, with your help.

nitty-gritty details

being in education for so long has its drawbacks. i graduated from my master's degree (in collaborative devised performance) last year and have been making work for a number of years. unfortunately, because i have not been a) living back in canada for a minimum of 12 months yet and b) out of school for long enough to qualify as a professional artist (while simultaneously not qualifying for special student programs anymore), i don't qualify for arts grants right now. which means i am completely reliant on this campaign to help me get to white rabbit! so, what kind of monies are we talking about?

$285 - the full cost of the residency (this includes my food and accommodation for the 8 days i'm on the farm)

$800 - cost of round-trip flights from winnipeg to halifax

$750 - cost of renting a car for the time i'm in nova scotia (the airport is 20 minutes outside of halifax, and the farm is over an hour outside of halifax, and nova scotia has no transit system that would get me around the province)

what do you get in return for a donation? well, the perks range from $1-500, so take a peek and see what tickles your fancy (and fits your wallet)! the perks snowball, so the more you donate, the more you receive. but they all revolve around personalized messages and love notes with the help of the local environment. items made during the residency will be shipped out to you within the month following my woodland adventure. 

if i don't reach my goal, i'll still be using the money i do raise to cover as much of these costs as possible. every little bit helps!

why does it even matter?

i could go on about the politics around the value of arts in society and the financial politics around supporting them currently in canada. but that requires a whole lot of unpacking, and probably a bibliography of suggested readings. what i can tell you shortly and concisely is that: 

a) i live to make art.

b) i've spent a lot of money over the past six years studying art and theatre in very intense settings.

c) i want to continue to make art that challenges form, style, tradition, and the status quo in all of its manifestations while also honouring the processes perfected by the artists who came before.

d) the idea of getting to hand-stitch love notes and design little personal soundscapes for wonderfully supportive people is really exciting to me. 

e) i miss nova scotia. and august is a beautiful time of year to be by the bay of fundy. so getting the chance to collaborate with a bunch of other artists from a wide array of disciplines while camping on its shores is like a dream come true.

f) this soundscape is the first step for our next show. i think it would be very cool to see the show in a couple of years, knowing that you had a hand in the creation from the very beginning.

all of the options

i totally get that sometimes, donating money just isn't possible. but that doesn't mean you can't get in on the good karma train! help to spread the word by using the share tools and tweeting, facebooking, pinteresting (you can pin videos!), blogging, and emailing folks about the project and campaign. or go the old fashioned way and tell someone over the phone or during a coffee date. 

also, if you're like my mum and never do any money-related thing over the interwebs (smart cookie), just get in touch with me. i'm very happy to accept cheques. and even though it won't count toward our indiegogo goal, i'll consider your donation to count for the same perks, so you can still get a love note from the bay.

story:
Welcome to Road ART Gallery, 

My name is Lisa Marie Sweat and I am the creator of ROAD ART GALLERY. 

ROAD ART GALLERY will be an exciting reality T.V. show about Art, Artist and the perception of art through the general public.

Each show will begin by our host, Lisa Sweat, conducting an in-depth interview with the featured artist as how they create their art and what inspires them. During the interview at the artist studio, he or she will take us through the process of how the art is created. This will give us a behind the scenes look at the wonder of art.

When the art is completed, ROAD ART GLLERY will take the actual art and the artist on the road, transforming to a live Art Show on wheels. Lisa, the featured artist and the art will help educate the audience on the process of creating art from its conception to the finished product.

Once the gallery on wheels has reached its destination is when the real drama begins. Through hidden cameras, and probing questions from Lisa, viewers will see and hear the true thoughts about the art and the artist.

The show is mobile, we will be able to travel to different states and locations such as rural towns, small cities, inner city schools, senior citizens homes, big and small events. This will help introduce art to many locations where it would not normally be accessible.

We believe ROAD ART GALLERY will be popular because first of all, virtually every home in the world has art in some form and we believe everyone yearns to be an artistic. We have many ideas that would make this show interesting and dramatic ie: Some shows will pit one artist against another. Some shows will pit the public against the art and the artist. Our cameras will follow the trials and tribulations of the art and artist on their journey

The Mission at Road Art Gallery is to bring art to you either on the road or in your living room.


Why I need your help....

I began this show with my own very limited funds, But now need your help to bring ROAD ART GALLERY to fruition. I purchased a very unique 40', 1955 GMC bus. I gutted the interior, painted and installed flooring and then filmed the promo with my art. The money will go to make the bus road worthy and safe to travel it. I am also looking for a car hauler to convert into a other gallery for more space for the art, which we will tow with the bus. Both the bus and trailer will have a great look traveling down the road, both will have the logo "Road ART Gallery". Can you see it.... ;). 

We will camera and mic up both gallery's for the hidden cameras that is quality of Broadcast TV. Other cameras will be needed for filming the outside interviews of the Art Show. The same cameras will be used for filming the Artist in their studio, I like to film with more than one camera to show all the wonderful angles of a shoot. Three is nice but two will do. The Artist will walk us through the possess of creating the art as I will ask  the questions that you would love to hear.  We will have a flat screen TV which will show the interview of the featured artist to all the visitors attending the art show. This will also help to education of the process of the Art they are looking at. I love to see how things are made especially Art.

Our cost that we will incur will be for a small crew for camera, sound, editing and a bus driver. The money is also to help cover the cost of food, fuel  and lodging.

Currently I am working with some great LA curators plus we will have other artist summit to the show. We will show all ART, some of the artist will be known for their works, showing and making a living.  But some will be unknowns looking for that big brake. ROAD ART GALLERY will show all the different walks of art, there is so many wonderful new mediums out there to see.

If by chance we do not reach our goal of $250,000, rest assured that your donation will still go toward making as many episodes of ROAD ART GALLERY as possible. Although the show will be compromised, mostly because our 1955 GMC bus is not up for traveling cross country, it still can travel to shows locally. We are eager for you to take this trip with us, either around the block or across this great nation of ours, it will be a wonderful journey.

ROAD ART GALLERY will be the show to watch. I have a dream and with your help "You" will make it happen. 

Thank you so much for looking at Road Art Gallery. Please go to www.roadartgallery.com for more information about Us and the show, 

Plus visit our Face book page for more photos. We here call the show RAG for short.

We will be posting the times and places of our "ART SHOWS" to come, YOU are all welcome to come out to see the "ART" and meet the featured Artist.  

We will see you out on the road.

Blessing to "YOU" 

;) Lisa Marie Sweat

                                    


With your financial gifts to Road Art Gallery we will send you: 

$25.00 a bumper sticker with our logo. ;) You are helping us to make this show happen. 

$50.00 a bumper sticker and key chain with our logo. ;) You are helping us to make this show happen. 

$150.00 a T-shirt, bumper sticker and key chain with our logo. ;) You are helping us to make this show happen. 

$1000.00 a T-shirt, bumper sticker and key chain with our logo, a CD copy of the show. You will get the dream out the door. September 1, 2014 will have everything out to you, but the CD of the show. We will need to film it, then after the show is edited we will send it out to you. ;) You are helping us to make this show happen. 

$10,000.00 or more:

 Your name as a sponsor for one or more of the shows. Plus one of my Tire Pieces of Art. Invited guest to the taping of one of our shows, (you need to cover your own expenses we can not be responsible for room and transportation), T-shirt, bumper sticker and key chain with our logo, a CD copy of the show. "YOU" will be the Dream Maker. September 1, 2014 will have everything out to you, but the CD. We will need to film it, then after the show is edited we will send it out to you. ;) You are helping us to make this show happen. Contact me at: nosweatpro@aol.com

story:
I have begun perhaps the most rewarding photographic project of my life.

While working on assignments, producing marketing photographs in retirement communities I began to work with the many WWII Veterans who were residents. It was easy to spot these folks - many proudly wear ball caps, adorned with campaign medals and ribbons attached. Indeed, the beginning of this project started when a Veteran asked me to copy a picture he had of the airplane and crew he flew combat missions with, from bases in England. It was an emotional moment for me to realize I was talking to one of the airmen who flew some of the most dangerous combat missions of the war. These men and women are special to me. My father was a WWII veteran. He joined the Army Air Force as an airplane mechanic, repairing the B-29 Bombers in the South Pacific that brought the war to the Japanese home islands, and saved countless young lives.

Photographing these Veteran portraits at various locations around the country, has been my passion for the last two years. 

I have photographed close to two hundred Veterans, with whatever items that have survived, (hats, medals, jackets and photos) but especially pictures of themselves - portraits, or other photographs taken during their time of service. As a result, I am developing an exhibit titled "When we were young". Pictures of the young person who went off to war, within a portrait of the senior who carries those memories with them.

Though military conflicts are generally defined by the political, economic, territorial causes and results - my intention of these portraits, is to show the the beating heart of the individual's military experience - memories that live with these people forever. The images and voices of rank and file Veterans have rarely been acknowledged or shared beyond intimates, many have related experiences they have never voiced before. I hope you will join me through Kickstarter to give significance to these individuals and their unique testament and perspective on their military service, and the opportunity to share that record with a larger audience. I have made a start and am hoping to continue to portray these individuals who have been sent in harms way. The portraits we have produced are amazing!

My goal is to raise enough money to produce, print, and frame a total of 25 - 24x30 art prints/interviews to exhibit. Each portrait will be accompanied by a statement culled from my interviews with each veteran, about how their time of service affected their lives. Excerpts from their interviews will be printed and displayed beside their portrait. Some statements are light-hearted, and others are more poignant. These statements, alongside the portraits, will bring another dimension to the "Individual" who had to do-the-work of military operations and give the viewer a feeling of what is was like to "walk in their shoes."

The money raised will go toward the image processing (retouching, color-management, proofing, etc.) required for such large prints, the cost of printing, the framing, and crates for transporting the exhibition. Creating the presentation and preparing the images for traveling to larger venues is beyond my out of pocket budget. That is why I am putting this proposal before you on Kickstarter. As donation rewards, the prints and books offered will be my heart felt attempt to share my enthusiasm of this project with you.  Any money raised beyond the funding goal will be used for additional portrait shoots and to further the project.

Please take a moment to check out some of the Veteran photos we are planning to exhibit www.markmitchellphotography.com.

Though military conflicts are generally defined by the political, economic, territorial causes and results - my intention of these portraits, is to show the the beating heart of the individual's military experience - memories that live with these people forever. The images and voices of rank and file Veterans have rarely been acknowledged or shared beyond intimates, many have related experiences they have never voiced before. I hope you will join me through Kickstarter to give significance to these individuals and their unique testament and perspective on their military service, and the opportunity to share that record with a larger audience. I have made a start and am hoping to continue to portray these individuals who have been sent in harms way. The portraits we have produced are amazing!

My goal is to raise enough money to produce, print, and frame a total of 25 - 24x30 art prints/interviews to exhibit. Each portrait will be accompanied by a statement culled from my interviews with each veteran, about how their time of service affected their lives. Excerpts from their interviews will be printed and displayed beside their portrait. Some statements are light-hearted, and others are more poignant. These statements, alongside the portraits, will bring another dimension to the "Individual" who had to do-the-work of military operations and give the viewer a feeling of what is was like to "walk in their shoes."
The money raised will go toward the image processing (retouching, color-management, proofing, etc.) required for such large prints, the cost of printing, the framing, and crates for transporting the exhibition. Creating the presentation and preparing the images for traveling to larger venues is beyond my out of pocket budget. That is why I am putting this proposal before you on Kickstarter. As donation rewards, the prints and books offered will be my heart felt attempt to share my enthusiasm of this project with you.  Any money raised beyond the funding goal will be used for additional portrait shoots and to further the project.
Please take a moment to check out some of the Veteran photos we are planning to exhibit www.markmitchellphotography.com.

story:
The context

Ten years ago no one believed thay you'll be communicating more online through a portable screen, than in real life. Ten years ago no one believed that Bulgaria actually wouldn’t be able to absorb all the money given by the EU. Ten years ago no one believed the Islamic/Anti-Semitic terrorism will be an important topic here. However, today we’re faced with finding answers to an ever increasing pile of new questions.

We believe that none of the questions of today can be solved using the methods of the past. We believe that a hall of people cannot be lectured by one person and taught what they should do. We believe that “facipulating” a group of people towards a pre-taken decision will not lead to sustainable results. We believe that today the best decisions are taken in group conversations, with the participation of all parties concerned.

 

The Impact

WHAT IS IT?
This innovative event is a 3-day training designed to help people:
- learn simple, yet powerful processes that build community
- activate collective intelligence 
- foster individual and collaborative leadership practices.

Over 3 days there will be the opportunity to participate and practice the hosting of conversations that address some of the complex challenges of our community.
Is there a civilised way to involve and engage different points of view in one discussion? Through meaningful conversations we can discover our energy and focus it on working towards a common goal. 

WHY?
The Art of Participatory Leadership could provide you with the opportunity to find solutions:
- In business setting
- In social activities and communities
- In policy and strategy development
- In social activities and communities

How can you participate?

We invite you to participate by offering whatever financial support you can so that others can join us who otherwise
wouldn't be able to afford it.

If you would like to offer something to the collective pot and to sponsor someone else's participation or simply gift for the joy of gifting, to support transformation in the Bulgarian community, then please make any payment - however much it is you can afford.

Your contribution will: 

Be an investment in the young and established leaders of Bulgaria and in the future of a country in a transition

Be an investment in a strong support network for these agents of positive change

Bring you in relationship with these leaders and become part of their wider support network.   

Other Ways You Can Help

We look forward to welcoming your presence and your contributions in what we are sure will be both a fun and inspiring experience.

LIKE:
our fan page: https://www.facebook.com/ArtOfHostingBulgaria

CONTACT US ON:
website: aopleadership.org
e-mail: aohbulgaria@gmail.com
tweet us on: https://twitter.com/AoPLeadership

story:
Let us share with you the Grand Mezcal passion!!!

Grand Mezcal will bring the most rare, authentic and delicious Mezcal to the greatest places for the greatest people.

Mezcal is problably the most beloved spirit in Mexico and not only because of the flavor and sophistication of this ancestral distilled, but more important  is because of the good Mojo that brings to every moment when Mezcal is present.

We spend more than one year to conceptualise the first bottle and we are so proud of the final result. For us, every detail was important and we want you to fall in love with Mezcal, our brand and with us.  We are extremly happy to introduce  the first bottle of  Grand Mezcal : La ESCONDIDA. 

This is NOT a fundraising campaign! It is an exclusive and unique 'presales' event of the first and unique 2014 production of La Escondida Mezcal.

To our Grand Mezcal Supporters and La Escondida lovers. It’s been more than one year to get this dream come true. And we are finally at the end of the tunnel. We can see the lightttt….and this is just THANKS to YOU. We want you to reward you and not just by eventually presenting you with what you purchased. We like to promise you an experience, we want you to be part of our passion.  

WOW!!! Mezcal La Escondida

We’ve been extremly careful selecting every Agave, and we promise to respect every step pf the process to get an incredible Mezcal 100% hand made. Thanks to the collaboration with one of the greatest names in the Mezcal environment, We are mastering every part of the process. It’s PHENOMENAL.

We want to share a unique experience with Grand Mezcal and having a special glass to get your first taste of La Escondida is part of it. 

Unique design and the perfect shape to get an smooth, delicious and smoky flavor at first on your nose and then in your mouth. Take some time & enjoy!!


•and YESS, we can say that many followers fall in love with LA ESCONDIDA LOGO, so we create specially for the ladies a unique and exclusive: TOTE Bag


But WHY am I reading this on Indiegogo?

The “crowd source” website is the perfect way to bring you Mezcal, but more important is a perfect way to communicate direct with our customers. Besides the fact of producing Grand Mezcal La Escondida for you, It is more important to interact without any intermediaries with our future customers.

Indiegogo is the platform we’ve selected to facilitate preorder sales of La Escondida which will be sell later on in bars, hotels and people that we trust and understand our philosophy.

When will the Grand Mezcal be ready?

We anticipate start delivering our first and unique 2014 production of La Escondida in the first quarter of 2015. 

During the course of this campaign, we will visit probably most of the main european cities : Berlin, Paris, London, Barcelona, Geneva to get you in the Mezcal mood. 

Just how unique is La Escondida 2014?

FOR REAL! IT S UNIQUE. Our first production 2014 is only around 3000 liters of the best Mezcal you can have. This will be sold only during the crowd-mezcal passion campaign  in Partner with Indiegogo.  

Where will the pickup spots be located?

Currently you will pick it up in Mexico City and Geneva, Switzerland. However, during the course of this campaign we will visit probably most of the main european cities to get our future customers into the Mezcal Mood. So new pickup places will appear very soon and we will keep you updated how would you get your bottle.

Are you shipping Mezcal direct in Europe, are you shipping my tote bag as well?

We are currently working on it but most probably yes. When your bottle is ready or your tote bag,  you’ll be notified and asked if you want to pick it up or if you want it shipped to you. We are sorry but there will be a charge to cover shipping and handling. However, we hope you will go to one of our pick up places and enjoy the mezcal moment.

WE WILL POST UPDATES DURING THE CAMPAIGN AND YOU CAN ALWAYS GET IN CONTACT WITH US BY EMAIL TO: info@grandmezcal.com

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

WHAT IS MEZCAL ?

Mezcal is a Mexican spirit which is been around for more than 200 years. It is 100% handcrafted from agave, a plant sometimes wrongly confused with cactus. One of the most sophisticated spirits on the market, mezcal has given some connoisseurs a new perspective on what it means to drink and eat.

So, tell me: Is mezcal the same thing as tequila ?

No. That would be like saying that grape juice is the same as wine. Although both are made from the agave plant, the production process and variety of agave used to produce mezcal are not the same as those used in the making of tequila. Another thing that sets mezcal apart is its delicious, smooth smoky flavor.

Is mezcal that cheap alcoholic drink I just bought in Mexico with the worm inside the bottle?

That question has two answers: NOT TRUE! NOT TRUE! I remember watching a movie where Antonio Banderas drank mezcal on some hacienda in the middle of nowhere while fighting a bunch of bad guys. He managed to impress the ladies  by chugging the whole bottle and finally swallowing the worm. That was probably the worst publicity the mezcal industry has had over the past 40 years. Within the industry itself,  a lack of sector-wide rules and transparency made matters even worse. The raw material, agave, needs at least five years before it is ready for the mezcal distillation process. In addition, the ancestral production methods are time-consuming and tedious, and many  years of experience are needed to gain full mastery of them.  Many years ago, some “wanna-be” producers took advantage of the less-than-transparent practices prevalent at the time and used the worm as a marketing ploy to sell something they called mezcal, even though it really wasn’t. However, the industry has seen some positive changes over the past 10 years, and today those of us who are passionate about mezcal can’t wait to teach the rest of the world what Grand Mezcal is really all about.

story:
Design by Meags Fitzgerald
Video by Ben Wheelwright

It’s the end of June. 10:58. Night. You’re standing in a parking lot with a group of people— a fifteen-year-old snapping gum, a sixty-something-year-old woman adjusting her sandals— laughing, joking. Waiting. The sun has set, but Whyte Avenue continues to bustle with life nearby.

11:00. Your guide appears. You have no idea what to expect. Since getting up this morning, you’ve been chased along the North Saskatchewan River, left love notes in Gazebo Park, moshed in a swimming pool, trekked across the High Level Bridge, drew on walls, and watched a pile of treasured keepsakes go up in smoke.

Your guide leads you past the sliding doors into a grocery store— deserted except for a lone figure lying face-down in a full-body snowsuit. He scrambles to his feet and thanks you all for coming.

Welcome to Found Festival 2014. 

What is the Found Festival? 

The Found Festival is a site-specific, multidisciplinary arts festival that takes place in Edmonton’s Old Strathcona from June 26 – 29th, 2014. It’s a living, breathing showcase of dance, theatre, visual art, music, creative writing and more. Since its beginning in 2012, it's been curated by the non-for-profit Common Ground Arts Society. Emerging artists submit proposals as early as November with ideas for pieces they would like to develop and present the upcoming summer in non-traditional venues. Our aim is to produce an event that is affordable, accessible, interactive, and empowering, encouraging artists to contribute to the cultural landscape of the city. 


Past venues have included a funeral home, residential garage, and a 1997 Dodge Grand Caravan. We’ve had live music played off rooftops, movies projected onto buildings, and a play performed— in the middle of June— on a giant pile of snow. Some pieces are designed for as few as 5 people at a time, with others accommodating as many as 200. We are committed to presenting innovative, entertaining, and provocative new works which push the boundaries of audience interaction, allowing both spectators and performers to engage in a more stimulating brand of risk-taking and play.

Impact

Maybe you're wondering "Why should I donate? Where does my money actually go?"

We're glad you asked.

  • The Common Ground Arts Society is a not-for-profit: this means that while we aim to keep production costs low, we still have a number of unavoidable expenses including artist honarariums, art supplies and venue rentals, to name a few. Your contribution would go directly towards tackling these types of costs. 
  •  For example: a donation of $10 pays a chunk of an artist's honorarium. A donation of $100 covers our equipment rentals. A donation of $250 prints all of our posters. LITERALLY ALL OF THEM. 
  • Donating also gets you access to a number of our SWEET PERKS, including posters, festival passes, and for the first time ever-- Found Festival t-shirts! You'll also get to reserve your festival passes ahead of everyone, guaranteeing your spot at our most exclusive shows, especially those with limited audience capacity. 
  • All donors will also receive a thank you in our programs & be showered with gratitude. 
  • By making a donation, you will be single-handedly championing the Edmonton emerging arts community and providing opportunities for  development to numerous artists who wouldn't have access to the same resources otherwise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in supporting the Found Festival, but aren't able to contribute financially, there are many other ways you can help out! 

  • Help us make some noise about our campaign. Share the link on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, whatever! 
  • Leave a comment letting people know what you like about Found, and why you think it's worth supporting!
  • If you know anyone who may be interested in donating, send them our way!
  • Keeping checking in at http://commongroundarts.ca to find out about other ways you can help out leading up to the event
  • We rely on our cohort of incredibly generous volunteers to help make the festival go! If this is something you might be interested in, please contact our Volunteer Coordinator Sarah Feutl at feutl@ualberta.ca.
  • Come and check the festival out in person! 

Thanks for stopping by & hope to see you there!

Keeping checking in at http://commongroundarts.ca to find out about other ways you can help out leading up to the event

Come and check the festival out in person! 
Thanks for stopping by & hope to see you there!

story:
THE VISION - by Jaimini Art


         THE VISION - by Jaimini Art

                   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art


     Discover the Rising Artist of the Modern Age

                   

          THE VISION - by Jaimini Art


    DISCOVER THE BEST KEPT SECRET IN THE WORLD OF MODERN ART!

     Would you like to know one of the best kept secrets in the world of modern Art?

     He was born and raised in the sacred town of Vrindavan, India! He began creating Art at the tender age of three years young!

     He is one of the best kept secrets in the world of modern Art, and furthermore he is the rising Artist of the Modern Age!



                                               PHILOSOPHY AND ART

     First and foremost, he is the torch-bearer for the growing influence of philosophy in the world of modern Art! He creates a unique style in his paintings, by beautifully combining Reality with Philosophical effect! It is most interesting to look into  philosophy of life in relation to colour combinations, which make his paintings lively!



       WHO IS THE BEST KEPT SECRET IN THE WORLD OF MODERN ART?

                                                  


                

                     THE VISION - by Jaimini Art


                    ~   KAMAL NAYAN JAIMINI  ~

            European effect on canvas by Artist - KAMAL NAYAN JAIMINI

   Reality with philosophical effect is beautifully expressed in the paintings of Kamal Nayan Jaimini, the rising Artist of modern age. He has made a place for himself as a torch- bearer of the growing influence of philosophy in the world of modern Art painting.

   Jaimini's pursuit of Art started at the outset of his childhood as he was born in a cultured family dedicated to Art. His father Shri Brajendra Sharan Sharma, who was educated at the Rajsthan School of Art Jaipur, started training the boy at the early age of two in sketch and memory drawing. Also in the absence of the father the child used to play with colours and create some attractive paintings. At the age of three, as a young child Kamal Nayan produced a lovely painting on the big canvas and thus indicated that he would become a famous Artist in the future. 

    Thereafter Kamal Nayan received training under Art teacher Shri Kripal Dutt Tripathi, Lord Hording Scholar Gold Medalist.  Also, Shri Tripathi, the renowned sculptor and painter imparted all comprehensive training to Kamal Nayan for the rest of his life. With this valuable guidance of his worthy Guru, Kamal Nayan, supported by his hard work, fixed his future destinations.

   The one remarkable characteristic of Kamal Nayan Jaimini is the beautiful effect European Art. This ornamentation is the gift of the renowned American Artist Sir Alfred Josef Valerio who was associated with the well known European artists, namely Salvador Dali, Andy Warhol, and Norman Rockwell.

     Kamal NayanJaimini is established as a worthy modern painter out of enthusiastic hard work, by the blessing of God, and by inner talent. He is respected especially for his philosophical paintings that are mostly in oil colours. Also his paintings made out of textures in the mix media Art are remarkable. It is most interesting to look into the philosophy of life in relation to the colour combinations that makes the portraits lively.

    Commendable is the portrait Art of Jaimini. He has portrayed a number of heroes -  especially Hollywood star Julia Roberts, pop star Michael Jackson and the famous journalist Khuswant Singh. The painting wizard Kamal Nayan Jaimini has proven his command over Landscape, still life, and figurative composition equally well.



                                                                - $ 322.02 Dollars Canadian
                                                                - $ 302.53 Dollars U.S.A.


                   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art

    Portraits of fair sex speak for Kamal Nayan’s practice, deep insight, and perfect maturity. Philosophical effect in his art can be possible only through extraordinary talent. Jaimini's philosophical paintings are full of sublime beauty of the fair sex. The instinctive inclination toward the opposite sex has been addressed in Jaimini's paintings. 

   Jaimini's philosophical creation namely 'Yoga & Maya' has been appreciated by a of number of Art critics in various art exhibitions.  Also, his knife - strokes painting, 'Krishna With Cow' has elicited praise. Worth mentioning is the name of Hollywood movie star Madame Sasha Stuart who praised the above mentioned two paintings during her last visit to India. Amongst other fans of Jamini's Art are the British painter Alfred Josef Valerio, and Indian Art fans Harrywiz couple, Chester and David, who have spoken highly of Jaimini’s Art.

    Creative modern artist Kamal Nayan Jaimini has proven his excellence at big size canvas and small size paintings. Equally well Jaimini's choice of knife strokes in the greeting cards has also been appreciated. He has specially created greeting cards by knife strokes in oil colours. Kamal’s miniature work by oil colours without brush in small cards, calls for direction and hard work. Among the greeting cards created by him, main landscape and portrait are specially popular of late.  His hand painted cards are getting more popular than printed ones in foreign countries and more and more in demand. Jaimini's Hollywood star portrayed greeting cards are being increasingly liked abroad.


card                                      "Indian Landscape"


   The elevated Art of Kamal Nayan Jaimini,  and his expertise, is related to his multifold genius. It is worth mentioning, that he holds seven Master Degrees in seven subjects under the Art faculty as well as, Hindi, Urdu, English, Ancient Indian History, Philosophy, from Agra University, and Post Graduate in Sanskrit from S.S.S. Varanasi, and Drawing & Painting from Jiwaji University Gawalior.

  Jaimini was fond of calligraphy since childhood and he continues the same. When he was studying in Urdu M.A., some of his paintings bear Urdu signatures along with those in Hindi and English.

    According to Jaimini he remembers the 6th January, 1987 for his meeting with the renowned painter Mr. F.N. Souza, under the auspices of Triveni Kala Sangam, New Delhi - the face to face exchange of ideas between a well known painter and a young one, was noteable. Mr. Souza had seen in Kamal Nayan a famous Painting Artist of future.

    Painter Kamal Nayan Jaimini says that Art is the easiest means to arrive at the Art of living which he believes in converting the same to canvas.


         

                     THE VISION - by Jaimini Art

Special guidance by famous American Artist Sir Alfred Joseph Valerio. (Associated with Salvador Dali, Andy Warhol and Norman Rockwell.)

                                    The Impact

                               Your contribution will make a difference!

By assisting Kamal to develop his professional Art practice to an international level, you will be helping to transform good lives into great ones, through art and philosophy!

Individual, community and international growth will be facilitated through the enhanced promotion of JAIMINI ART - since greater joy, happiness, and life fulfillment is the humanity of the pursuit of Art!  

Deeper insights into the inter-connectedness of Philosophical, Cultural and Artistic aspects of classical and modern life and Art will be developed. 

Greater knowledge of Yoga and Eastern Spirituality will be shared at a world-wide level.

Your contribution will make all of this possible and take the VISION of JAIMINI ART from dream to reality!  And all of this will happen with your generous donation that will empower Kamal to replenish his Art supplies, enhance his Art studio, fund a marketing campaign and create Kamal's three phased Art Tour - local, national, and international!

You can help make it happen!

And best of all your funding will uplift a devoted, sincere, spiritual and gifted Artist - Kamal Nayan Jaimini!




                    Other Ways You Can Help


Some people are unable to contribute at this time, but there are still important ways that you can help!


                                              WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can help Kamal take JAIMINI ART to the next level!  The VISION of Kamal's Artistic quest is to enhance the quality of life for both Artist and Art lover, by bringing increased joy, happiness and fulfillment into life.  You will bring Kamal's dream to reality with your investment contribution!

You can also help create success in developing Kamal's VISION for JAIMINI ART by getting the word out there to your family, friends, colleagues, and through your social media such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. Encourage everyone to check out Kamal's campaign! Also, please use the indiegogo 'Share Tools' to get the word out there.  Make a noise!  Let everyone know about the best kept secret in the world of modern Art - Kamal Nayan Jaimini - the rising Artist of the modern age! 

                                       Together we can make it happen!


   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art


                    

                                      Thank you for your contribution!
