THE VISION - by Jaimini Art
         THE VISION - by Jaimini Art                   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art     Discover the Rising Artist of the Modern Age                              THE VISION - by Jaimini Art
    DISCOVER THE BEST KEPT SECRET IN THE WORLD OF MODERN ART!
     Would you like to know one of the best kept secrets in the world of modern Art?
     He was born and raised in the sacred town of
Vrindavan, India! He began creating Art at the tender age of three years young!
     He is one of the best kept secrets in the world of modern Art, and
furthermore he is the rising Artist of the Modern Age!
                                               PHILOSOPHY AND ART     First and foremost, he is the torch-bearer for the growing influence
of philosophy in the world of modern Art! He creates a unique style in his
paintings, by beautifully combining Reality with Philosophical effect! It is
most interesting to look into  philosophy of life in relation to colour
combinations, which make his paintings lively!       WHO IS THE BEST KEPT SECRET IN THE WORLD OF MODERN ART?                                                                    
                     THE VISION - by Jaimini Art
                    ~   KAMAL NAYAN JAIMINI  ~
            European effect on canvas by Artist - KAMAL NAYAN JAIMINI   Reality with
philosophical effect is beautifully expressed in the paintings of Kamal Nayan Jaimini,
the rising Artist of modern age. He has made a place for himself as a torch-
bearer of the growing influence of philosophy in the world of modern Art
painting.
   Jaimini's pursuit of Art
started at the outset of his childhood as he was born in a cultured family
dedicated to Art. His father Shri Brajendra Sharan Sharma, who was educated at
the Rajsthan School of Art Jaipur, started training the boy at the early age of
two in sketch and memory drawing. Also in the absence of the father the child
used to play with colours and create some attractive paintings. At the age
of three, as a young child Kamal Nayan produced a lovely painting on the big
canvas and thus indicated that he would become a famous Artist in the
future. 
    Thereafter Kamal Nayan
received training under Art teacher Shri Kripal Dutt Tripathi, Lord Hording
Scholar Gold Medalist.  Also, Shri Tripathi, the renowned sculptor and painter imparted
all comprehensive training to Kamal Nayan for the rest of his life. With this
valuable guidance of his worthy Guru, Kamal Nayan, supported by his hard work,
fixed his future destinations.
   The one remarkable
characteristic of Kamal Nayan Jaimini is the beautiful effect European Art. This
ornamentation is the gift of the renowned American Artist Sir Alfred Josef
Valerio who was associated with the well known European artists, namely Salvador
Dali, Andy Warhol, and Norman Rockwell.
     Kamal NayanJaimini is established as
a worthy modern painter out of enthusiastic hard work, by the blessing of God, and by inner talent. He
is respected especially for his philosophical paintings that are mostly in oil
colours. Also his paintings made out of textures in the mix media Art are
remarkable. It is most interesting to look into the philosophy of life in relation to the colour
combinations that makes the portraits lively.
    Commendable is the
portrait Art of Jaimini. He has portrayed a number of heroes -  especially
Hollywood star Julia Roberts, pop star Michael Jackson and the famous
journalist Khuswant Singh. The painting wizard Kamal Nayan Jaimini has proven
his command over Landscape, still life, and figurative composition equally
well.                                                                - $ 322.02 Dollars Canadian                                                                - $ 302.53 Dollars U.S.A.                   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art

    Portraits of fair sex speak for Kamal Nayan’s practice, deep insight, and perfect maturity. Philosophical effect in his
art can be possible only through extraordinary talent. Jaimini's philosophical
paintings are full of sublime beauty of the fair sex. The instinctive inclination
toward the opposite sex has been addressed in Jaimini's paintings.    Jaimini's philosophical
creation namely 'Yoga & Maya' has been appreciated by a of number of Art
critics in various art exhibitions.  Also, his knife - strokes painting,
'Krishna With Cow' has elicited praise. Worth mentioning is the name of Hollywood
movie star Madame Sasha Stuart who praised the above mentioned two paintings
during her last visit to India. Amongst other fans of Jamini's Art are the
British painter Alfred Josef Valerio, and Indian Art fans Harrywiz couple,
Chester and David, who have spoken highly of Jaimini’s Art.
    Creative
modern artist Kamal Nayan Jaimini has proven his excellence at big size canvas
and small size paintings. Equally well Jaimini's choice of knife strokes in the
greeting cards has also been appreciated. He has specially created greeting
cards by knife strokes in oil colours. Kamal’s miniature work by oil colours
without brush in small cards, calls for direction and hard work. Among the
greeting cards created by him, main landscape and portrait are specially
popular of late.  His hand painted cards are getting more popular than printed ones
in foreign countries and more and more in demand. Jaimini's Hollywood star
portrayed greeting cards are being increasingly liked abroad.card                                      "Indian Landscape"   The elevated Art of Kamal Nayan

that he holds seven Master Degrees in seven subjects under the Art faculty as
well as, Hindi, Urdu, English, Ancient Indian History, Philosophy, from Agra University,
and Post Graduate in Sanskrit from S.S.S. Varanasi, and Drawing & Painting
from Jiwaji University Gawalior.
  Jaimini was fond of calligraphy
since childhood and he continues the same. When he was studying in Urdu M.A., some of his paintings bear Urdu signatures along with those in Hindi and
English.

Individual, community and international growth will be facilitated through the enhanced promotion of JAIMINI ART - since greater joy, happiness, and life fulfillment is the humanity of the pursuit of Art!   Deeper insights into the inter-connectedness of Philosophical, Cultural and Artistic aspects of classical and modern life and Art will be developed.  Greater knowledge of Yoga and Eastern Spirituality will be shared at a world-wide level.Your contribution will make all of this possible and take the VISION of JAIMINI ART from dream to reality!  And all of this will happen with your generous donation that will empower Kamal to replenish his Art supplies, enhance his Art studio, fund a marketing campaign and create Kamal's three phased Art Tour - local, national, and international!You can help make it happen!And best of all your funding will uplift a devoted, sincere, spiritual and gifted Artist - Kamal Nayan Jaimini!                    Other Ways You Can HelpSome people are unable to contribute at this time, but there are still important ways that you can help!                                               WAYS YOU CAN
HELPYou can help Kamal take JAIMINI ART to the next level!  The VISION of Kamal's Artistic quest is to enhance the quality of life for both Artist and Art lover, by bringing increased joy, happiness and fulfillment into life.  You will bring Kamal's dream to reality with your investment contribution!You can also
help create success in developing Kamal's VISION for JAIMINI ART by getting the word out there
to your family, friends, colleagues, and through your social media such as
Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn etc. Encourage everyone to check out Kamal's campaign! Also,
please use the indiegogo 'Share Tools' to get the word out there.  Make a noise! 
Let everyone know about the best kept secret in the world of modern Art - Kamal Nayan Jaimini - the rising Artist of the modern age!                                         Together
we can make it happen!   THE VISION - by Jaimini Art
                     

                                      Thank you for your contribution!

story:
Gray Life
"Gray Life" is both a realization and awakening, a creation and a destruction. Not all media has to be dedicated to advertisements, to headlines, to filler stories or filler pictures, or any and all other commercialized aspects of the media as we know them.

We connect to media because of our primal connections to fear, drama, curiosity, our search for beauty, and most media companies use that knowledge to manipulate.

My goal is contribute to the dialog, and to ask you to contribute as well, in an attempt to change our visual language, and from it, our perceptions and illusions. 

Your Part 
Any and all donations are fully appreciated. As a freelancing artist I know what it's like to want to contribute but only have $3 to spare (in which case, you will still receive something from the artist). The flat rate cost of production is $10, so starting at $10 contributions, you will receive the copy of "Gray Life" of your choice, as Edition Two is well underway.

story:
"Welcome to Spilt Ink Poetry, where poets have the opportunity to express themselves any way they see fit, where photographers capture the true essence of the human experience, where the truest objectivists of the world expose hidden truths and harsh realities. Where race, ethnicity, and gender are hindrances, Spilt Ink Poetry strives to be a podium where the creatively oppressed can finally unleash themselves." Spilt Ink Poetry is a relatively new publishing house that specializes in helping poets publish their work with comprehensive advice about where to submit, how to submit, and information about publishing news. Also, we have a poetry blog called "WE ALL BLEED THE SAME" where poets are featured for poetry lovers to indulge! The WE ALL BLEED THE SAME Project is designated to raise funding to create a printed anthology for those poems that are featured on "WE ALL BLEED THE SAME." We at Spilt Ink Poetry aspire to further advocate diversity in the arts and empower the voiceless! Please help in this crusade!

WE ALL BLEED THE SAME (Poetry Blog): http://spiltinkpoetry.tumblr.com/

Our Publishing and Advice Blog: http://spiltinkpoetrypress.wordpress.com/

story:
Hey there.  My name is Rebecca Chapman.  I'm a bit of an artist.  I'll get right to the point.

I have a $100 student loan payment looming in the near future and I also need to have about $250 in maintenance done on my car. I'm trying to travel to be with my parents on Christmas because they can't afford to come to me. Hours have been cut severely at work and finding a second job hasn't worked out so far. Any money raised through this would help me to get my car back in good, running condition and help me to pay off my student loan payment for this month so that I will be able to go home for the holidays. It would also help a lot with the traveling costs.

**UPDATE** (See updates panel for full details) For some unexplained reason, the total loan payment amount due this month is $0.00!  So now all I need money for is maintenance and repairs on my car!**UPDATE**

story:
What is the RIZE?

The RIZE is a handmade art display that I created to showcase the amazing properties of ferrofluid, a strange black substance that was originally created by NASA as a prototype rocket fuel. It is reactive to magnetic forces and has only recently been available outside of industrial applications. I find it to be an amazing medium to work with in creating unique art pieces.

The RIZE is activated when you place the sculpture onto its magnetic base.

This magnetizes the giant machined screw in the middle and causes the ferrofluid to spin around and rise up in a beautiful display that will keep you mesmerized.

 

The RIZE captivates childlike curiosity and amazement when people view it, and it makes for the ultimate distraction on your desk or centerpiece in your office.

Even after interacting with these displays for years they still give me inspiration when I see them in action.

The sculpture itself is also a feast for the eyes, created with a variety of different metals and finishes:

Every square inch of the RIZE is hand crafted and museum worthy.

It's also 100% made in the US, right here in our studio in Opelika, Alabama. We are also shipping anywhere in the US for FREE!

This project has taken years of research to perfect, and now we even have colored ferrofluid available.

 

 

4 metallic color-shifting pigments are available:

 

Gold

 

 

Red-Orange Color Shift

 

 

Blue-Purple Color Shift

 

 

Purple-Pink Color Shift

 

 

Each RIZE also includes a powerful handheld N52 neodymium magnet.

 

 The handheld magnet also seperates into 2 smaller magnets for more interaction:

 

 

My Background and Inspiration

Hey I'm Matt, and I've been working with ferrofluid full time for the last 3 years. I have a degree in Electrical Engineering and have always enjoyed creating art. After surviving a plane crash I decided that life was too short to waste in a cubicle and that I would pursue my dream of inventing cool products full time. I like to blend science with art in my creations and my hope is that they will help inspire the next generation of thinkers and inventors!

Pledge now and help me bring the RIZE to life!

Thank you,

Matt Robison

story:
In the wake of the arts being removed from schools in the late 80's, visual artists in Oakland banded together with a shared commitment to restore the arts in education. This is where the Museum of Children's Arts was born. For nearly three decades MOCHA Teaching Artists have been immersed in schools where they use arts integration techniques to stimulate educational experiences. Since then, there have been several generations of young artists that have flourished in our programs.

MOCHA recently moved into a new space in Downtown Oakland and has expanded the reach of our programs over the years. Annually we serve over 25,000 children, youth, parents and educators in the Bay Area. With an abundance of space and talent available to us, the MOCHA Mural Project aims to raise funds to create a vibrant mural that depicts the history of our organization in Oakland. The concept is a large-scale, colorful mural that represents what MOCHA values most: art, creativity, diversity and community.

Miranda Bergman is a muralist with a vast degree of experience creating masterpieces in the Bay Area and globally, and is a pillar in the MOCHA community. It is because of her talent and deep roots with our organization that MOCHA believes Miranda is a natural choice to tell our story through a community mural.

I am indebted to MOCHA on many levels, and welcome this opportunity to give back to this wonderful organization. Murals are a great way to tell stories, honor legacy, reflect pride, educate, and inspire creativity. A mural at MOCHA will do all of these things.  –Miranda Bergman

Over the years MOCHA has impacted the lives of professional artists that educate, students that have lost art in their schools, parents that look for creative and developmental outlets for their children, and teachers that want to integrate art in to their curriculum. In that spirit, we want to tell a visual story of our experience so that we can continue to invigorate and inspire future generations of whole human beings.

What we need

A mural this ambitious is a costly endeavor for our organization and we are in need of an additional $7,500. The funds that we raise through this initiative will be used to obtain scaffolding, purchase materials, compensate Miranda and an assistant, provide stipends for artists, and facilitate professional development workshops and design meetings.

Please help us tell our story and support the MOCHA Mural Project—every donation makes a difference.

Impact

The mural will be a work of art that belongs to MOCHA and the community that it represents. It will depict the history and impact of MOCHA in the community, its role as a longstanding cultural institution in Oakland; brining art to the public through shared spaces.

The MOCHA Mural Project is not just about creating a mural to live in our space; it is also about the process. This is an excellent opportunity for MOCHA Teaching Artists to work with an established muralist and learn what it takes to make a project like this come to fruition. Miranda Bergman has been a creative tour de force for decades and we believe that fellow artists and community members would benefit from working intimately with her on this endeavor. MOCHA Teaching Artists will collaborate with Miranda on all phases of production; from design conception to execution. It through this collaborative process that we hope the legacy of Miranda’s work will be imparted to generations of younger artists that will in turn return continue to build on that legacy by using those practices and incorporating them into their work with students. It is our vision to see the MOCHA Mural Project become the MOCHA Mural Program; where we are regularly looking to bring murals in the spaces that we serve.

Other ways to help

This project is a truly collaborative effort. Together, we can make it a reality! Please share our MOCHA Mural Project with your personal and social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram).

story:
We are running this campaign in loving memory of our good friend Tri Garcia. The plan is to provide his loved ones with wearable apparel, stickers, and keepsakes that allow us to keep him close in our everyday lives as a reminder of the light he shed on those who knew him.

All proceeds will go towards his end of life services including his cremation, his wake and his celebrations of life both in AZ and CA. We will be putting together a video montage as well as art displays so please send any photos, soundbites and videos you may have to MemoriesOfTri@gmail.com. We will release this publically for all to enjoy.

We are running this campaign in conjunction with his GoFundMe campaign so either way you choose to contribute is much appreciated.

story:
Here's The Deal

I would like to explain what contributor's perks will be, explain a little bit about the touring mission itself, and how this is all interrelated:

  • I'm a travelling saxophonist and beer blogger who couldn't be happier with my team of musicians and the national community we've come in contact with.
  • This calendar resembles community and a growth of love and life in a world struggling to stay together. Since the bus has broken down, we've had to cancel shows coming back home and we may miss Thanksgiving with the families. BUT...since the engine blew, the Arizona community has rallied together putting last minute shows together, and helping with rides and accommodations.  
  • Contributors will help put our nationally touring band back on the road and promote uplifting music/live entertainment changing people's days for the better a show at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

Follow me to the Perks:

  • Community Center needs $4,000 to put a new engine in the tour bus. George, the bus, has lost doors, cracked radiators, had coolant leaks, and broken down in the desert twice. He's very moody! HA HA
  • This year's perks are a triple threat:
  • --A sexy calendar for you to love 24/7 365 days a year
  • --Community Center's Current Album "Horns & Thorns"
  • --An exclusive release of Community Center's Newest Album with stickers and Pins
  • --A never before seen experimental holiday album for the Holiday Season
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

Your Impact

This Calendar has always been for fun, but this year there's a cause near and dear to my heart:

  • Your contribution keeps me in your house when I can't be there. I miss my community every day I'm gone, but every day someone smiles or tears up during our shows, it's worth it. 
  • We've run 3 successful campaigns and I'll do my darnedest to make a 4th, but I'll need your help.
  • I only have my desire to be a ham and my hairy chest to offer you, but by golly, you're going to love this calendar and many more for years to come.

Risks & Challenges

This campaign comes from a place of extreme caution as I don't like asking for charity. I'd rather be helping someone out than asking for the help, but sometimes as hard as you fight, obstacles get in the way, and you need someone to lift you back up.

  • I'm hard working, tenacious, and unwilling to give up.
  • I will keep pushing the boundaries with the community back home, and listen to everyone's ideas to keep you getting a great calendar.
  • I've got some Baltimore Businesses willing to help for the cause, and a community of talented, driven, and crazy friends back home that make these calendars so enjoyable. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this year's calendar campaign.
  • Please use whatever tools are at your disposal to share this!
  • If you're able to contribute some props or your time, please get in touch with me on Facebook and we'll get it going

Thank you, everyone for your time.

story:
Nobody Home

My name is Josef, I'm 17 years old and I was recently studying abroad, in Bristol, England. During my stay I created a photography project which mirrors my mental experience of being away from home. Now it's done and I have a great opportunity to exhibit my work in my hometown Gothenburg. I have gathered the project in this book which combines the photographies and texts from the project. I have managed to find a way to print the works for the exhibition but I lack funds for the printing of the book. I'm printing 50 copies.

From the beginning the book was only supposed to be something that would make my work more real when I'm looking for places to exhibit. I would go to the place and show the the book and say that this is what I want to exhibit. But then after finishing the book I decided that it was something that I wanted to share with more people and something I wanted people to be able to bring home. The book contains four parts, including 3D pictures and multiple exposures. Most of the photographs are taken in Bristol.

Below is what's written on the back of the book. It's written by my teacher Mark Curtis back in Bristol and describes the content of the project as well as me and my stay in Bristol. When I was done with the whole project I wanted Mark to write something about it because it felt weird to describe my own work and I was sure that he would write something good.

''Josef came to our course a few weeks into the term, having found his own way through conventional post 16 education into our progressive little course run at the Engine shed in Bristol. The course is developmental and designed to support the immersion of our small group in commercial creative practice at the heart of the Bristol Temple Meads Enterprize Zone. An area defined to attract inward investment in our city in the sectors of Creative, High tech and Digital industry. Walking into our world as a highly creative and digitally aware young man Josef instantly found kindred spirits among the students and staff alike. He is a creative force who manages to challenge and beguile all that he meets and I’m convinced he will continue to do so. I was personally intrigued by this young man who has travelled at 16 to experience another culture without the generational understanding of our very uniquely Bristolian community. I love Bristol but it is not without its 21st century challenges. It is ethnically diverse yet unintegrated, culturally rich yet not inclusive, affluent yet impoverished. It’s a collection of villages that calls itself a city. For all its challenges, I love my city and would not live anywhere else. How can a young man from Sweden navigate the sensibilities that I have a 50 year relationship with, and what would Bristol make of him. In truth Bristol loves a creative free spirit. We are after all the home of Banksy, Brunel and Massive Attack and Josef already exhibits many of their pioneering qualities but he also saw his experience through the anguish and pressure that only a teenage boy alone without the close support of his family could. Love, Family, Freedom and yet a tremendous sense of dispossession and belonging elsewhere. Josef’s work has a haunting quality that combines the common and primal nuances from both Bristol and his home city of Gothenburg. His observations speak to all of us that have made this city our home, I recognise in his work the distance I saw when I first made the decision to settle and the conflict of feeling at home yet away. This is a twenty first century narrative that many migrant communities face across the world in our challenging global political climate. The need to belong when you emotionally reside elsewhere.       This is a visceral story played out in the mind of a wonderfully engaging young man lost, occasionally physically, but more often emotionally, in our city.''

Mark Curtis

Creative Director

Boomsatsuma

Josef’s work has a haunting quality that combines the common and primal nuances from both Bristol and his home city of Gothenburg. His observations speak to all of us that have made this city our home, I recognise in his work the distance I saw when I first made the decision to settle and the conflict of feeling at home yet away. This is a twenty first century narrative that many migrant communities face across the world in our challenging global political climate. The need to belong when you emotionally reside elsewhere.       This is a visceral story played out in the mind of a wonderfully engaging young man lost, occasionally physically, but more often emotionally, in our city.''
Mark Curtis
Creative Director
Boomsatsuma
